22443006.review:
[h1]Make your life legendary[/h1]

Rayman Legends is the sequel to the critically acclaimed Rayman Origins, with Legends taking what worked from Origins and refining it.

[h1]Pros:[/h1]
[list]
[*]You no longer have to unlock powers separately, meaning those who’ve already played through Origins can experience the entire moveset from the start.
[*]A fantastic artstyle that’s a lot more shinier and polished than Rayman Origins.
[*]A large pools of fun and great levels, backed by good level design.
[*]Additional modes like Challenges and Kung Foot help make the experience more replayable for both local co-op and singleplayer gamers!
[*]Surprisingly well optimised for lower-end computers!
[/list]

[h1]Nitpicks:[/h1]
[list]
[*]The bonus “Creatures” element of the game is completely unnecessary
[*]Being locked out of certain levels in the challenges mode by a leveling system is frustrating
[*]Online Multiplayer would had really made modes like Kung Foot more popular.
[*]The levels containing Murphy feel a lot more repetitive than normal, although at least they aren’t auto-scrollers.
[/list]

[h1]Cons:[/h1]
[list]
[*]For a mostly local cooperative game, there’s no excuse for this to require Uplay., even if it has a lot of somewhat unnecessary online activities.
[/list]

[h1]The Review[/h1]

As someone who grew up playing Rayman, I adored the return-to-form that was Rayman Origins, and Legends continue the trend with new levels, shinier graphics, and a ton of additional packed goodies.

Rayman Legends is a mostly 2D platformer with a lot of collectathon elements, but it’s great to know that collecting all of the teensies is much a major requirement, which allows for speedrunning. There’s a huge amount of levels to play, and since you aren’t restricted in playing all of the worlds in order, you are given a lot more freedom to tackle levels! The return of 4-player co-op is good fun, although it quickly devolves the game into a chaotic mess, so completionists are better off playing alone (Which is still fun!).

Gameplay for the most part, is as refined as Rayman Origins. The controls are responsive, and your moveset is versatile but simplistic enough that you are given a lot more control. It’s actually really difficult to talk about this game because of how perfect controlling the characters is. The physics, the button layouts, it just feels so natural. However, for keyboard players, I highly recommend picking up a controller to play this game, as with other platformers.

The newest mechanic in Legends is of course, Murphy. By the press of a button, you can have him slap switches, tickle enemies, and cut ropes. For the most part, however, Murphy’s only included in some of the levels, which I’m perfectly fine with because Murphy feels heavily gimped from the Wii U version.

As someone who’s 100% complete the game on Wii U, I’ve noticed huge differences between this version and the Wii U one as well. For one, there’s no 5 player co-op, or the ability to have complete control over Murphy. Both versions seem to trade one thing for another; The Wii U version allows complete control at the cost of not having direct control over your player in single-player mode, and the PC version lets you control your character, but have more limited control when it comes to Murphy. A good middle between the two would had fixed the problems, but both versions are stuck with the levels containing Murphy being either a slog or being quite the unintentional challenge when speedrunning/completing comes to play.

The reason why Murphy levels feel weird in the PC version is because they were designed to be slow-paced, which makes them unintentionally more difficult now that you have full control over your character and can freely run.

The game includes a wealth of side-modes to play, and while they aren’t anything to write home about, they are nice additions. Challenges make for a unique set of leaderboard challenges that’s constantly reset weekly (although a lot of the challenges are the same things from past rotations and can get repetitive), and Kung Foot is an insane blast to play. However, the addition of a XP bar to lock challenges and the “Creatures” addition seem to be completely unnecessary, and only serve to make 100%ing this game feel more like a chore. Also, Online Multiplayer would had really helped when it came to modes like Kung Foot, because I can’t really get my friends together all the time to play it.

Presentation-Wise, Rayman Legends nails it. While I like the more zany look of Rayman Origins, Legends polishes up the artstyle to look completely unique and beautiful. When certain enemies or objects are shown as a 3D model, it doesn’t look odd or unusual, making it a solid blend of 2D and 3D visuals. It’s music is a joy to listen to, despite being dangerously close to being generic medieval fare. The UI mostly doesn’t distract the player, although the constant in-game notifications definitely are annoying.

So how’s the PC version of the game? Surprisingly good! I managed to get it running 60fps on my laptop (which seems to like running games at terrible framerates), and it’s been doing superb for me on my main PC (to no surprise). If you have a low-end computer, you should give it a shot, it isn’t as intensive as it looks.

Unfortunately, the game requires uPlay (which is weird because Rayman Origins didn’t!), and it’s as big of a mess as always.

[h1]TL;DR - Rayman Legends is a fantastic platformer with splendid controls, tons of bonuses, and a stellar presentation. It’s still my GOTY of 2014! [/h1]

22353581.review:
Rayman Legends definitely lives up to the old style of Rayman games, with a little more extra features than the older games.

It features over 120 different stages each with varying atmosphere, amazing music, and plenty of hidden collectibles. Each of the levels are hand drawn and beautiful to look at. Despite not being overly impressive on a technical level, Rayman uses a timeless style. While games like Crysis 3 probably won’t look that great 10 years from now, Rayman Legends will no doubt retain its charm.

There are underwater stealth missions, time trials, and even musical stages where you jump to the rhythm of remixed popular songs that'll have you laughing stupidly hard at how at first you won't understand what's going on but quickly have a hard time playing because of the nostalgia that hits you as you go further into the stage. The inclusion of daily and weekly challenges allows you to compete with your friends, adding tons and TONS of re-playability. The weekly challenges come with leaderboards so you'll always feel accomplished having topped a certain percentile in the gaming community.

The community is great, many of which have turned into speed gamers for this game.

8/10

22342498.review:
Acabo de terminarmelo y la verdad es que me he quedado un poco con cara de tonto. Mira que me veia venir que iba a ser mas corto que el 1 por los mundos que habia, pero es que se acaba en el penultimo mundo. Apenas se consiguen la mitad de las cosas que hay que conseguir en la campaña, y el resto? Pues en tareas secundarias, repetir niveles del 1 (no gracias, ya me lo pase) etc.

Supongo que el ultimo mundo se desbloqueara consiguiendo tropecientas cosas en niveles secundarios. La verdad es que lo que menos me gusta de estos Rayman es que son plataformas y como plataformas van muy justitos. Se basan mas en coleccionar/recoger 20.000 "moneditas" que en plataformeo puro y duro. Es decir, si quieres que haya un minimo de buen plataformeo, tienes que irte a por todas las moneditas de cada nivel porque si, y si no se vuelve muy simplon. 

No hay mas que ver a super mario. Mario es plataforme puro y nada mas. Quieres algun coleccionable? vale, pero si vas a por el juego, veras una aventura de una calidad sublime en cuanto a jugabilidad plataformera, sin necesidad de autocomplicarte la vida con tonteria secundarias inservibles para que destaque minimamente.

No se por que, pero me ha gustado menos que el 1. Es mejor en todo, pero quizas me ha parecido demasiado mas de lo mismo y mas corto. No veo necesidad de sacar este rayman tan rapido habiendo el 1. La musica me ha gustado menos. Y la verdad, hecho de menos un hilo conductor e estos juegos, no que me de la sensacion de estar jugando 500 niveles sueltos sin conexion alguna.

Los niveles musicales son todo un acierto. El error es que el mejor sea el primero y que el ultimo sea el mas flojo, o lo que es lo mismo: que vayan cuesta abajo.

Tambien es el mas facil de los 2. Demasiado asequible casi todo el juego. Y mira que el Origins era un juego sencillo, pero este lo es aun mas. Y las fases del mosquito se echan en falta.

Y los 800 personajes secundarios que desbloqueas, todos de adorno. No aportan absolutamente nada al juego salvo skins. Con lo tremendamente bien que habrian quedado fases jugadas con ellos, con sus respectivos cambios jugables

Tampoco me ha gustado la "interfaz" de este. El lugar desde el que eliges niveles...madre mia, parece que querian hacer una red social de rayman o algo. Mensajes por aqui, puntuaciones de amigos por alla, retos diarios para competir online...

Ahora me quedan 80970987 moneditas extra que conseguir, pero los juegos que basan gran parte su calidad en la cantidad de tareas secundarias, lo llevan claro conmigo.

22337523.review:
Rayman has always been one of my favorite series. And yep, Rayman Legends is not an exception.

First, about the graphics. This game has came a long way from the previous Rayman game i've played on PC, "Rayman Origins". The graphics is STUNNING. I mean literally, it's like, the whole different game from Rayman Origins, from the world, to every character in the game, all have been enhanced, and they fit with the world perfectly. And the best part is, this game runs at full 60FPS in my crappy laptop. Yes, not a single drop, it's always stable at 60, all the time. That's the one i like most.

Ok, now about the storyline. Rayman Legends, like the other Rayman games before, puts you in a funny storyline. Well gotta say, in my opinion, this game is made to make you laugh, specially when you're playing coop with your friends. Every levels is well designed, suitable for both adults and children to play together, not too hard, but also not too easy, just challenging enough. Also, this game has a "Back To Origin" part, where you can play the levels from Rayman Origins (but this doesn't mean I recommend you to play just the Legends one, i've finished Rayman Origins, and currently playing Legends, and tbh, each game has its own unique style, you can try both if you want)

Thirdly, i really don't understand why people don't recommend this game because of just "Uplay". For the first 3 hours, i haven't encountered any crash, bug, or something like that. When i launch the game from steam. Uplay just pops up for a few seconds, then I'm enjoying the game, without any bug, or crash. 
(And for those who can't play properly because of Uplay, and want to rate down the game, here's my suggestion: After you've launched the game, saw Uplay pop-up said "logging in", shut it down, uninstall Uplay, and download the other version at Ubisoft homepage, install it. After that, you can launch the game properly)

[EDIT] How could i forget about the music, the soundtrack? They are like, what made this game to become a success. All of the music, specially the music levels, are amazing, that's the part made me want to play it again and again (Still in love with the Mexican style music) xDDD

In general, i think this game is perfect to play when you want to relax, or playing with your friends and family. Seriously, i couldn't think of anything bad about this game. So yeah, my score for it is 10/10. Recommended.

22332911.review:
I bought this game a long time ago. Before I started writing these reviews nobody reads. Today I decided to reinstall this game  because I needed some inspiration, as I make games on my spare time and I remembered this game as one of the most amazing looking games I ever played, then write a review nobody will read. 

Every screenshot is an artwork. But visuals anyone can tell how good it is by looking at the videos and screenshots, so I'll move on and talk about the rest of the game. By the way, if you're into art I also recommend googling Rayman concept art and get to know Aymeric Kevin's artwork, the artist behind it.

Now that I started writing this I realize I don't have much to say about the game. There is nothing new to be analyzed; you jump and attack through the levels. So I'll put it like this: imagine the best 2D platformer you ever played, it's likely done by a small team, indie. Now imagine if that game had the amount of polish a triple A game  usually gets. That's Rayman Legends. Every second on it seems to have been crafted by a hundred skilled hands and playtested to exhaustion. It's so well paced that at times it's challenging without being frustrating, at other times it's easy without being boring. At the end of each chapter there's a musical level where you run and jump as you do in bit runner and other rhythm running games, and it's so fun I was laughing out loud while playing. Laughing because you are having fun is not something I'm used to. Laughing of a good joke? sure, but it's not the same thing. It's a super nice variation from the previous levels and it does feel like a reward for beating every level. This is something we always want as gamers, rewards for beating the game. It's why we watch the whole credits and absorb every bit of extra content we have. In the old days we would examine every pixel of those static images of the end game credits. I feel like These musical at the end of each chapter gives us exactly what we want. An explosive and fun reward for all the "work".

Also, it's not every day you see a reboot light years better than the source material. It baffles me every time I remember what the original rayman was like.

If that's not obvious by now, I quite like Rayman Legends and I recommend it.

Oh my god. This fucking game.

There is tons of trial and error at times, but I didn't find myself getting too annoyed, or at all, actually. It's a really fair game. It honestly reminds me of the classic Donkey Kong Country series with the toughness of the game. It's pretty brutal at times, but DAMN I need to keep playing until I beat it and get a great score (which by the way, feels so damn rewarding.) You don't have to just play as Rayman, but you can choose other characters as well and as well as different costume sets (oly if you have collected enough lums.) In this game, I doubt that's a problem since you practically shit out lums every time you finish a level, as well as having a chance to win them at a scratch ticked provided that you've gotten enough lums to get said scratch ticket- okay basically, you're gonna get lums up the wazoo no matter what.. One last thing: Remember when I mentioned variety? This game is also a sweet ass rythem game. 'Fuckin random, right? Naw it's fucking sweet as fuck, yo. Rayman, Ubisoft, I expect great things from you in the future. Please take my money.

22154224.review:
身为前UBI前子公司员工的我，看到了UBI周还是剁手了。

是谁说横版动作游戏已经没落了？！雷曼传奇它很好的证明了，如今年事已高的横版过关类游戏中，仍然可以发挥他们激动人心的创造力。

[b][u]+满屏游戏性（这好像再说老任），各种挑战

+令人惊叹印象深刻的关卡设计以及Boss战

+精美的画面，优美的音乐

+非常完美的本地合作模式，拉妹入坑神作[/u][/b]

我一直认为，育碧的小型游戏都是非常出彩的，光之子，世界大战勇敢的心，雷曼，都给人留下了非常深刻的印象。相反3A级作品现在却逐步走向模式化。
也许是节奏没有掌控好，UBI总喜欢在短短的4-6个小时把所有的游戏内容展现给玩家，剩下的只有重复枯燥的支线。在我看来UBI的3A大作的致命缺点也就是如此，当然他的土豆服务器不算。
不过相比稍微小一点的游戏，他们往往能处理的非常不错，而且大部分都是佳作。

对于育碧，美术和音乐真的没得说。雷曼这款游戏也是，它用了自家特有的UBI ART 2.5D游戏引擎，给人在玩的时候的视觉冲击力非常大。
虽然游戏只有简单的，跳，跑，打击。但是不知不觉间，你就开始要悄悄绕过成批致命的陷阱，同巨大的Boss战斗。
记得第一次玩音乐关卡时，我还以为进错了游戏，那种节奏感，画面表现力，和非常恰当的BGM，我还以为我在玩一款卡通的音乐动作游戏。
游戏的UI设计也是带入感十足，给人一种非常愉悦的感觉。

对于多人合作同屏真的非常赞！在座的各位可以试试带妹子玩玩[spoiler]（你和她一定会有进一步发展的）	[/spoiler]，这游戏我至少拉了3个妹子入坑了。前提你一定要带的动妹纸哦~

[h1]个人评价这款游戏 10/10[/h1]

手柄会给这款游戏带来更好的体验。

This game amazed me on levels few other recent games have. 
For one, the game started at my fullscreen resolution without needing to be told, then I come to find out it supports a TON of screen sizes and even has windowed mode. By this point, I'm already wowed, but then I look to the left of those options, and what's this? Proper control mapping? And it recognized a gamepad other than the 360 controller? More than that, even while using a 360 controller, I can remap all the buttons! 
Just when I think, "Wow this is all great, could it get any better?" I absentmindedly alt+tab out to check something, and to my surprise it DOESN'T crash the game or make it have a fit, I can open it right back up no worse for wear! 

Someone, somewhere loved this game enough to give it a PC port with all the trimmings one deserves, and this is from Ubisoft, a company I never expect anything from.

Oh yeah and it's a pretty great game too, it's got... running and jumping and stuffs. I like it.

[h1][b]Glitches / bugs[/b][/h1] Not at all.
[h1][b]Worth price[/b][/h1] Full price !

[h1]- Review below ----------------------------------------------------------------------[/h1]

The greatest Rayman ever !

The level designs have greatly improved since Rayman Origins. You now have the help of Murfy the Greenbottle guy.

So in this game you have a ranking whatever you played offline or not. Each world and each levels have their own cups and each cup give you points to level up your rank. You can get copper, silver, gold and also platinum cup. Also you earn cup doing online challenges, depending of your ranking at the end of each challenge.

In this Rayman, you get some brand new worlds, levels, bosses and also a "karaoke" mode. The online challenge is pretty new too.

So depending of the amount of lums you got at the end of a level, you get a cup. Also you need to save the teensies, all if you can. When you are good enough you unlock lucky tickets that may reward you with a random gift such as : a creature, lums, a teensy or a level of "Rayman Origins".

You'll also unlock time trials levels, where you need to rush to the teensies before the evil foes launch them with rockets.

At the end of each world you'll have a boss level fight and after that a "karaoke" level. The karaoke level, feature a music with "voices" if we call that voices, where you need to rush continuously until you reach the end. One of it great aspect is that the rhythm of the music and voices are linked to your moves.

"Back to Origins" world and levels are the replica of the original Rayman Origins levels. Only several levels are missing. In this one you'll find normal levels, shooting levels with the mosquito, rushing levels with the moving chest, and last levels with a boss at the end.

Finally the online challenges will be required in order to have all achievements and it will take time until you reach the needed rank. Hopefully you can earn a lot of cups in a week and a lot of points if you're good enough. (16 cups each week)

21672389.review:
I have always had a soft spot for 2D platformers and this is probably my favorite of the genre at the moment. It has got bright colorful graphics, great controls, interesting level design and it offers a good level of challenge without being unfair or frustrating, something Rayman Origins often missed the mark on.

The main part of game world is divided up into 5 different paintings, each with 9-10 levels based on different theme.  The paintings all end with a boss and a musical level, where the action in the level follows the background music. I loved the musical levels and I wish there were more of them. There is an extra unlockable painting that let’s you play the musical worlds again with added challenges, but it is basically the same level.

The game has tonnes of content with invaded levels, daily/weekly challenges, and you can unlock most of the levels from Rayman Origins. You certainly get your money’s worth here.

Honestly the only caveat for this game is Uplay...I have had issues with it in the past and I know many people continue to even today. 

To Ubisoft’s credit, over the last 3-4 years they have taken Uplay from being an unusable piece of malware to more of an annoyance. So let’s give them credit for that, I guess…

My advice is just log into the Uplay application once, set it to offline and never, ever, touch it again.

[h1]Rayman Legends -  это нечто большее, чем просто платформер![/h1]

Значит так: освобождены 700 «малюток», собран миллион «люмов», отыграно 60 часов, теперь можно и впечатлениями поделиться. Ранее я проходил не так много игр подобного жанра, но это – платформер с большой буквы. Платформер всех платформеров! 
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=623437314
В игре огромное количество контента: 5 основных миров, бонусный 8-bit’ный мир (хардкор мод ON) + картина «Back to origins», представляющий собой 5 миров из Rayman Origins. Каждый уровень сопровождается ярким и красочным визуальным оформлением, стремительным, а порой и не очень геймплеейм, который подается под замечательным музыкальным сопровождением.

Каждый уровень – уникален и не похож на все предыдущие, не говоря уже о мирах, каждый из которых – гениален по-своему! Ах да, все это можно пройти с друзьями в локальном кооперативном режиме, что принесет Вам еще больше удовольствия и веселья. А если Вам и этого мало, то для Вас есть ежедневные и еженедельные испытания, играть в которые можно «до посинения». 

[b]10 злобных малюток из 10![/b]

21358927.review:
雷曼的作品只玩过雷曼起源和雷曼传奇，所以仅对这两部作品进行比较和评价。
整体而言，个人喜欢起源多过传奇。
难度
传奇的难点基本集中在了限时关卡和青灰死地，然而限时关卡的难度并不在于你的操作而是在于你是否能够找到最短最快的捷径，所以基本死多几次也就摸得一清二楚了；而青灰死地则是背板背板再背板，更何况之前的关卡里就有标准答案，跟着音乐和莱姆走基本就能过去了。然而起源，天啊，简直不堪回首！从第二关的沙漠关起，就疯狂受苦——各种死各种考验操作。尤其是最后的青灰死地，真的是打得我整个人都不好了。印象最深的是倒数第二节喷火那里，我以为是会自动变小的，结果疯狂地死，我尝试了各种办法然并卵，甚至以为出了bug重新打了两遍前面的关卡。后来我去看了下视频，才顿悟到那里要下蹲、蹲...当时整个人都斯巴达了！当然不能忘了让很多人又爱又恨的箱子关...个人在倒数第二的深海箱子关已经死了无数遍...起源要拿奖牌真心很难，倒是传奇拿金杯还是蛮容易的。
关卡设计
讲道理，个人觉得传奇更多地添加了些解密的色彩，比如有些关卡就不是线性的了，而且一些蓝小小的位置藏那叫一个狡猾...而起源主要考验的是玩家的操作能否一气呵成——如果中途有失误的话，往往会错过很多东西。
场景方面，传奇和起源都做得非常漂亮；然而还是起源略胜一筹。之所以这样说，传奇的单个大关风格基本没有太大的变化，而起源则会有令人赞叹不已的场景变化。比如：饕餮之地的冰火变化、深海关从浅海到深海的变化，衔接都做得非常自然美丽。虽然传奇里的深海关貌似是在一艘破船和海底之城里进行的，但是让我想起了生化奇兵，个人也是非常喜欢的。
操作
我想吐槽雷曼的操作很久了...雷曼的判定有时真的很迷。我明明摁的是小跳，但是结果出来的是大跳——就因为这个我在深海箱子关的那两个连续小跳死了无数次...然后我非常想吐槽传奇里那只该死的青蛙！那个在起源里死太多次问你要不要放弃的那只酱油青蛙，在传奇里莫名地成了重要的角色！大部分时间没有它还不行！还要按Y键！天啊你能想象在摁着加速的时候既要A又要X还要Y的场景吗？！我已经不知道被这该死的青蛙坑了多少次！每次都让我手忙脚乱、左右互搏、A、X、Y傻傻分不清...我真的不懂育碧在想什么。
音乐
两作的音乐都做得非常棒，非常切合各个关卡的氛围。饕餮之地的墨西哥风、深海空灵悠扬的音乐、青灰死地的激昂...说道音乐，不得不提传奇里设计的最棒的ROCK关卡——基本就是听音乐用的，没有什么难度。所有的音乐都太好听了，而且风格各异，每次我开雷曼的时候都要先过一遍音乐关。
最后，起源不需要UPLAY平台，传奇要。光这点起源就可以怒甩传奇两条街了...
总而言之，个人觉得起源更为核心向，传奇更加欢乐，各位想玩雷曼的，可以各取所需。个人推荐是先走起源，再打传奇，然后你就会有种从地狱到天堂的感觉。

잠오는 난이도에서 시작하지만 후반가면 제법 어렵습니다. 난이도 분포가 잘 되있어요.
나중 스테이지는 굉장히 자주 죽었습니다만, 죽음에 대해 패널티가 없고, 자동저장이 굉장히 잘되있고 회전이 빨라서 짜증이 날 때쯤이면 익숙해져서 클리어하고 지나가게 됩니다.

매력적인 그래픽과 아름다운 사운드에 흠뻑 취한 채로 즐기게 됩니다.
각 지역 보스 후의 스테이지인 뮤직 스테이지가 특히나 재밌어요. 마치 리듬게임 하는듯 음악에 취해 비트대로 버튼을 누르게 됩니다. 이런 방식의 스테이지들로만 구성한 스탠드얼론 게임이 나와도 될 것 같은 완성도를 보여줍니다.

로컬협동이 굉장히 특이한데요, 서로서로 살릴수 있지만 마음이 안맞으면 서로 죽이게 되는;;(ㅋㅋ) 특이한 방식으로 되어 있습니다.

21136115.review:
Meiner Meinung nach, der beste Rayman Titel nach Rayman 2! Das Gameplay, die Grafik, die Musik und der Sound ist mehr als überzeugend und es wird auch noch mehreren Durchläufen nicht langweilig.

Die Level sind individuell und liebevoll designt, ebenso wie die freischaltbaren Charaktere, denen es an Abwechslung nicht mangelt.

Zugegeben, gerade was das Freischalten der späteren Skins betrifft, so läuft es früher oder später darauf hinaus, dass man nurnoch Level wiederholt, um an Lums zu kommen, aber das machen die täglichen und wöchentlichen Challenges zu einem Großteil wieder Wett, da man dort ebenfall etwas farmen kann.

Keinem Jump'n'Run Fan sollte dieses Spiel in der Sammlung fehlen. Vor allem, wenn man sich Freunde dazuholt und es mit mehreren spielt, macht es nochmal doppelt so viel Spaß.

Über die Tatsache, dass Uplay erforderlich ist, möchte ich an dieser Stelle hinwegsehen. Ja, auch ich hatte anfangs Probleme mit Uplay und ja, ich finde es ebenfalls überflüssig - wo man das Spiel doch schließlich bei Steam gekauft hat. Aber es beeinträchtigt auf keinen Fall den Spielspaß, darum lasse ich es nicht in meine Wertung einfließen.

Von mir bekommt Rayman: Legens 10 von 10 Punkten!

PS: Ein Controller ist dringend zu empfehlen!

20894816.review:
This is quite possibly one of the best side scrolling platformers of the modern era! It controls beautifully, with pinpoint reaction times. The graphics are fantastic with varied environments bristling with little details. Enemy designs are hilarious and varied. Level design is ingenious. The music is decent, but the "music themed" levels are a joy to play and a welcome interlude from the more difficult levels. However, what makes this game PERFECT is its innate replay value. Each level begs to be perfected, each item to be unlocked. I've simply not had this much fun with a platform game since I was playing Super Mario.

Ubisoft, you weirdos. I love you.

11/10

20444253.review:
Rayman Legends peut haut la main prétendre avoir sa place au panthéon des jeux de plateformes 2D. Doté de graphismes somptueux, d'une bande originale variée et magnifique, et d'un gameplay accessible, mais qui demande un peu d'entraînement pour être maîtrisé, ce petit bijou made in France est un jeu complet à côté duquel il ne faut pas passer.

Les fans de la licence (comme moi) le classeront dans leur top 5 de leurs meilleurs jeux, mais, comme il n'est pas nécessaire de connaître les Rayman pour pouvoir en profiter, les néophytes de la licence y trouveront également leur compte. C'est une valeur sûre ^^

Not much negative to say about it; good music, cool playable characters, nice level variety with plenty of hidden goodies.

Очень сложно писать об игре в которой нет недостатков! В принципе, у кросс-платформеров всегда мало проблем, особенно, когда это именнитая серия от авторитетных разработчиков.
Rayman каждую секунду дарит кучу позитива. Графическое оформление, левел дизайн, саундтреки, геймплей - все на высоте! От некоторых миссий просто захватывает дух и ты уже не можешь сдержать улыбку до конца прохождения.
Игра идеальна для мультиплеера. Можно играть с людьми даже с малым скилом в играх, например, маленьких детей.

Après avoir fait tous les raymans et adoré rayman 3, gold et origins, tomber sur Rayman Legends est une vrai décéption. 
En plus du fait que l'utilisation de ce jeu nécéssite de se connecter a Uplay et a Steam rend tout de suite les choses beaucoup plus compliquées pour un jeu qui n'as pas réellement besoin de connexion avec internet; Rayman Legends est vraiment trop facile. Tous les niveaux se terminent aisément (même les plus durs !), les passages secrets sont tout sauf secret, et le jeu présente une histoire quasi inexistante.
Dommage, d'autant que les niveaux sont vraiment cools pour finir chaque monde.

Ami, si tu aime un tant soit peu les jeux présentant de la difficulté, passe ton chemin.

20266830.review:
Für mich der bisher beste Rayman-Teil!

Aber Moment: Ich bin mit der Rayman Gold Collection aufgewachsen und habe bis zur Veröffentlichung von "Origins" nicht mal gewusst, dass die Serie ernsthaft weitergeführt wurde.

Was soll ich sagen - Rayman gehört meiner Meinung nach zu einer der wenigen Serien, die den Anschluss in die "Neuzeit" mit Bravour geschafft hat und dabei auf sovielen Plattformen vertreten ist, dass es eine Freude ist. (Minigames, die fast keine Minigames mehr sind für Android, IOS und Windows Phone; Versionen für WII, XBOX, PS Vita und wahrscheinlich noch mehr, von dem ich zu faul bin, es zu googlen.)

Bisher hatte ich keine Probleme mit dem Spiel. Es läuft immer flüssig; auch die Online-Herausforderungen sind stets erreichbar. Einzig die Bedeutung des Kung-Foot-Dingens blieb mir bisher verborgen.

Die Level werden - oh Wunder - natürlich immer schwieriger, wobei es teilweise aber wirklich lächerlich wird und man tatsächlich gut sein muss.
Nett sind die "Minigames", die nach Abschließen mehrerer kompletten Level auftauchen. ("Heimgesucht") sowie die Musik-Level, die jeweils nach dem Boss-Fight freigeschaltet werden. Man hüpft und schlägt und weiß der Kuckuck im Takt. Genau das richtige für musikaffine Leute.

Story, wie immer, Kleinlinge retten und Lums sammeln. 
Soundtrack auch wieder gut.

Für Rayman-Fans, jung oder alt, neu oder von Anfang an dabei, ein Muss.

20256921.review:
Rayman legends me parece de lo mejor que ha habido en cuanto a plataformas 2D en estos últimos años. Es divertido de principio a fin, comienza siendo fácil y luego se torna un reto. Su estilo gráfico es genial. Tiene una gran variedad de niveles y de estética en sus distintos mundos, lo hace sentirse siempre fresco. Cuenta con una buena y variada banda sonora. También ayuda que tenga unos controles con los que te famirializas facilmente, aunque en este aspecto me veo obligado a recomendar un mando. Lo bueno es que es para todos los públicos, puede gustarle a qualquiera. Para finalizar diré que me gusta mucho que cuente con cooperativo local, pero le sentaría mucho mejor contar también con cooperativo online.

Recomiendo esto a cualquiera, yo me lo pasé exageradamente bién jugándolo con mi hermano.

20039310.review:
Это. Просто. ШИКАРНО.
1.) Восхитительное звуковое сопровождение, отличный саундтрек, очень яркие мелодии, я уже молчу про восхитительные музыкальные уровни в конце этапов и их же зубодробильные пикселизированные версии, которые заставляли меня скрежетать зубами под конец;
2.) Очень яркие или наоборот, в зависимости от мира, очень темные, но одинаково потрясно нарисованные уровни + крутой дизайн персонажей. Я до сих пор не открыл всех принцесс и сражаюсь с игрой за право играть каждой, потому что, ну... они красивые :3
3.) Мягкое повышение сложности. Первый мир вы пробежите, чувствуя себя героем, а потом будет все труднее и труднее, и вот вы уже грызете зубами стол, потому что пальцы болят перепроходить один и тот же момент! Невозможно же просто так взять и бросить что-то, на что потратил уже вагон времени! >:D

Вывод: первая часть была очень хорошой, а эта просто невероятная! Если вы любите платформеры - вы обязаны ее купить. Особенно хороша в кооперативе, когда можно спасать друг друга. Или не спасать >:3

19528257.review:
A shining gem amongst platformers, varied and challenging. The developers listened to feedback about Origins and replaced the nerve-wrecking mosquito stages with awesome musical levels, the world themes and especially the bosses are also very well designed. The game no longer requires you to complete all stages in order to reach the end, alleviating the still challenging (albeit not to Origins' extent) difficulty, while online challenges not only test the very best players' skills, but give a constant reason to return and play for a while.

Oh, and have I mentioned that ~75% of Origins' levels are included too? Sadly, Land of the livid dead isn't, only its' end-boss, but it's still a great value for the price.

19428341.review:
Melhor jogo de plataforma 2D dos últimos anos e um dos melhores da história. Tudo em Legends beira a perfeição. O gameplay é absurdamente fluido, todas as fases são boas, sem exceção, as músicas continuam excelentes, além de ter um divertido modo online e as viciantes fases musicais. 
O desafio continua alto e felizmente eliminaram os objetivos de concluir as fases em tempo mínimo.
O únicos pontos negativos são a pouca quantidade de conteúdo inédito (muitas das fases são releituras do Rayman Origins), a retirada das fases do mosquito e a ausência de uma fase secreta hiper hardcore como no Origins.

19387792.review:
Du pur plaisir à jouer ! 
Les niveaux musicaux sont géniaux, le gameplay est réactif, une bonne ascention de difficulté.
Le design des niveaux est ingénieux avec des nouvelles mécaniques de jeu introduites dans chaque monde.
Le style graphique est magnifique, ce jeu vaut vraiment la peine d'être joué !

Pour les bémols, j'ai personellement jamais aimé murphy (la grenouille), je trouve que les niveaux où il apparait sont plus corsés, à cause du fait qu'on doit controler 2 personnages avec une manette (ou un clavier, je juge pas ^^). Ceci dit, le jeu est beaucoup plus facile avec un 2e joueur en coop, bien que certaines parties aient été visiblement prévues pour 1 joueur.

Certaines courses contre la montre ou "cours pour ta vie" selon le jeu vous laisseront couverts de sueur avec des niveaux où la moindre erreur de timing vous fera repartir du début !

La soundtrack de ce jeu est également très belle, elle colle à l'ambiance du jeu et permet une immersion vraiment complète dans l'aventure.

Allez-y, les ptit-zêtres n'attendent que vou !!!

19243320.review:
Other than the required U-Play cancer, this game is pretty superb. It's hard to put in words how highly I praise this game. The level design is near perfect for a classical platformer. This, paired with great music, art design, and controls, results in one of the best platforming titles of this generation.  

Not counting the gameplay, my favorite part of Legends is how the game is broken up into worlds (which, in itself, is a design choise dating back to 1985, but I digress).  Each world has its own theme and model swap of enemies, making each chapter seem like a new game; even though these are losely connected into the over-arching story, they have their own, subtle sub-plots.

Up to this point, I've only mentioned the gameplay in passing, mostly because there's not much to criticize about it. Rayman handles like you would expect him to (most of the time) and never feels too stiff.  At times, Legends can be a little on the easy side, mostly because you have unlimited lives and frequent checkpoints, but is balanced out by the difficulty of the secondary objectives. This game is great for completionists, and you can put a good amount of time into grinding out the last few unlockable cosmetic characters that you wouldn't otherwise have by just completing the game.

I don't have a good place in this review to mention the musical levels, but they're pretty fun and a nice change of pace.  
Ubisoft also posts daily and weekly challenges with worldwide scoreboards, if you're into that sort of thing. 

9/10, would recommend in a second.

18688583.review:
Platformers. The beginning of my dive into video games was Super Mario Bros. I've since played most Mario, Sonic, Mega Man, and countless other platform games over the years. I have an extensive history with them.

Based on that, I have to say that Rayman Legends is one of the best I've ever played.

- The controls are very responsive and the gameplay just flows effortlessly from move to move making it your own fault if you screw up.

- The art style is amazing and is something I will never tire of looking at.

- Extensive number of very well designed stages that are extremely fun to play

- Time Trials, Daily and Weekly challenges, and most of the stages from Rayman Origins can be found here.

- Musical stages, where you run and jump to the remixed beat of popular songs. I play these over and over they are just so enjoyable.

Basically, if you don't already own it, buy it. Yes it requires Uplay, but so what? The game is so darn good, I honestly don't see why it matters.

18491185.review:
Rayman Legends es un juego de plataformas bellísimo de gráficos vivos y coloridos, banda sonora fantástica y ocasionalmente muy desafiante en lo jugable. En comparación con su antecesor, Legends tiene un desarrollo ligeramente más variado y una jugabilidad más fluida al deshacerse de los niveles compuestos por multitud de pequeñas secciones y apostar por otros más amplios y con menos interrupciones. Los retoques en el control, los enemigos y otras mecánicas de juego son muy sutiles pero todos ellos van dirigidos a ofrecer una experiencia de juego más rápida y rítmica que la de Origins, erigiéndose como máximo exponente las deliciosamente diseñadas fases musicales, en las que tenemos que completar una fase entera sin detenernos en ningún momento, esquivando, saltando y golpeando al son de una melodia famosa adaptada al universo de Rayman. 

Por otro lado, Legends es también ostensiblemente más fácil. A lo mejor tiene que ver en gran parte con la experiencia obtenida en el Origins, juego al que jugué intensivamente hasta completarlo al 100%, pero lo cierto es que en esta secuela he sido capaz de acabarme la mayoría de los niveles liberando a todos los enjaulados y consiguiendo las medallas de oro, todo en mi primer intento. La recolección de lums, en concreto, es esta vez infinítamente más fácil hasta el punto que no ha sido raro completar las fases sobrepasando holgadamente la cantidad fijada para obtener la medalla de oro. En consecuencia, Rayman Legends se hace un pelín corto. Ubisoft intenta compensarlo introduciendo una serie de niveles extraídos directamente de Origins, algo bastante sorprendente, la verdad. El detalle se agradece y los que no hayan jugado al anterior seguramente lo aprecien todavía más, pero personalmente, habiéndole echado tantas horas en su día a Origins, se me ha hecho un poco cuesta arriba tener que volver a completar todas las fases. Hubiese sido preferible contar con más niveles nuevos en vez de reutilizar los del juego anterior, pero bueno, mejor esto que nada. 

Otro punto un tanto decepcionante es la no inclusión de un mundo extra como el glorioso Land of the Livid Dead del Rayman Origins; un nivel súper difícil que te obligaba a poner en práctica todo lo que habías aprendido durante la aventura. En Legends, en cambio, se desbloquean unas fases llamadas "ediciones de 8 bits" que en realidad se corresponden exactamente con los niveles musicales que antes comentaba, sólo que ahora la melodía suena en 8 bits y a los gráficos se les aplica un filtro dependiendo de la fase como por ejemplo un efecto de pantalla CRT antigua, pixelaciones muy bestias o distorsiones visuales que imitan una pérdida de señal. Lo cierto es que estos efectos más que traer recuerdos nostálgicos lo que hacen es molestar e irritar profundamente. Un nivel de 8 bits en concreto tiene aplicado un filtro tan horrible que lo único que consigue es destrozarte la vista y arruinar totalmente la experiencia de juego. Esto sólo se corresponde con una pequeña parte del juego, pero creo que es importante destacarlo sobre todo si lo comparamos con el genial mundo extra del Origins.

No obstante, Rayman Legends también sabe presentar un buen reto a la altura de vez en cuando, especialmente por medio de las fases contrareloj, rivalizando directamente con las partes más difíciles del Origins, y pese a los puntos negativos antes nombrados, la verdad es que quizás prefiera en líneas generales a esta secuela por encima del original. Es cierto que se ha perdido en duración y dificultad, pero el diseño de los nuevos niveles y sobre todo la mayor variedad de situaciones, propuestas jugables y el nuevo ritmo de juego más fluido y dinámico, conforman una experiencia más amena y entretenida. Rayman Legends es un muy buen plataformas y un imprescindible para todos los amantes del género, es una lástima, pues, que no llegue a la excelencia por culpa de unas pocas decisiones de diseño algo desacertadas. Pese a ello, es un juego que vale mucho la pena. Si tenéis la ocasión, jugadlo en cooperativo. 


8,5/10

18416279.review:
8.3/10 Fantastic game that caters to a large audience.

Although it may seem like a game aimed at a young audience, Rayman Ledgends has a lovely balance of humour and art-style, coupled with the simple controls that reach out toward the adults too. This board spectrum allows for some fun and challenging gameplay for all ages, and a great reason for introduction into family gaming. 

With secrets and hidden treasures to find and unlock, each level is jam-packed with stuff, inviting the player back to the level again and again. The "boss" battles are absolutely inspired musical treats, that are as much a reward than 'yet another level'. Two player control is neat and tidy and highly recommended.

This is probably one of the few games that literally celebrate victory and accomplishment. The characters you save in the level have a little dance, fireworks go off, a creshendo plays and you get to see how well you did and what you won. This is very satisfying for the player (of any age) and definately stuffs the fun back into gaming.

There is so much to do in this game that it is difficult to find anything to be negative about. At it's core the game is solidly built, the artwork is stunningly good, the humour is cheeky with a hint of slapstick and the music is a compliment to the whole tone of the game. Just wonderful.

17687872.review:
Rayman Legends (Orgins) This was always a classic for me considering I first played Rayman on the PS1 as a kid. Awesome platform that always caught my attention. I'm glad to see Rayman has been remade for the PC.

This game has no graphic options at all but it doesn't need it because its a 2D platform with amazing graphics and art design. It's very well programmed and the colors are eye catching and beautiful. 

The characters in the game of course is Rayman and now you can unlock Hero's to play which feels slightly different then playing Rayman. Each hero has many skins to unlock as well. 
The enemys are well desgined and some look really epic and deadly. 

The controls are simple. I use a USB 360 controller of course and the game's physics and mechanics are not difficult to figure out and is actually programmed rather well. The movement is simple and basic but yet one wrong move equals instant death. Game is playable to a 5 year old but becomes difficult enough for an adult while a child can still enjoy the difficulty as the game progresses. 

The platforms are awesome and the levels are super creative its almost genius. Lots of hidden secrets in every level. 
There are so many levels to play and unlock its insane how much work was put into the length of the game. You simply cannot get bored but many breaks will be taken. 

The sound effects are neat. While the music really sells it for me. There is also an online type challenge everyday and one that lasts 7 days. You compete for the Bronze, Silver or Gold cup. Which is great if you like a good challenge.

I'm running this game on an AMD ASUS Sabertooth 990 FX, AMD 8-Core, 16gb Ram, Nvidia GT 750 2gb LP. Windows 7 
no issues at all running this game or any crashes. 

Yes this game does require Uplay which I wasnt a fan of awhile back but who cares it doesnt hurt anything having it installed just don't use it as a main client. Keep using Steam. Uplay only launches when you launch a game that requires Uplay. After you done playing close it. Steam still records your hours played however Uplay is where your achievments are unlocked and recorded unfortunatly. This shouldn't stop you from enjoying the game though. It's worth the time and effort. 
I purchased during the Steam Summer sale for 12$ org price was $29.99. It also included Rayman Orgins for 3$ I believe which was an absolute steal. Highly recommend buying this game. If you can wait buy it during a steam event.

Overall 10/10

Look up some gameplay on youtube just to see the greatness Rayman has to offer. :)

17220461.review:
+++ Fantastic art direction
+++ Simple yet expansive controls that do a lot, with just a little
+++ Healthy difficulty curve that culminates into a solid challenge without being overly frustrating
+++ Varied levels each with their own special mechanic or focus
--- Floaty controls, especially on narrow platforms
--- Boss fights built on trial and error

Rayman Legends is 'the' definitive modern platformer of the era.  It offers a clean experience without being too pure, it's loaded with goodies without getting bloated under the weight, and it stands out with its own signature rather than rely excessively on classic gaming references and nostalgia (excluding the 8-bit levels of course.)  The game is just right, just plain fun, and it never outstays its welcome.  A rare example of its kind, it's a delight for the casual and the hardcore alike.

17005267.review:
Rayman Legends, continuação de Rayman Origins, lançado em 2013 pra PC, e plataformas da Sony, Nintendo e Microsoft é um jogo de plataforma 2D produzido pela Ubisoft. 
O jogo é dividido em 6 mundos principais que são divididos em várias fases e subfases(normalmente 10), além de fases do Rayman Origins, não todas, mas a grande maioria está também nesse Rayman. 
Em cada fase você tem cerca 10 tensies, sendo 8 normais e um rei e uma rainha teensie. 
Em Rayman Legends, você pode jogar com dezenas de personagens diferentes, mas no final das contas são apenas 4 personagens principais com variações de Skins, apesar do jogo dar uma história de fundo pra cada um deles, o que é bem impressionante. 
Os personagens são o proprio Rayman o personagem da capa do jogo que não possui pernas ou braços e de mãos e pés flutuantes; Barbara, uma garotinha viking; Globon, o melhor amigo de Rayman que é uma espécie de sapo gordo gigante, e os Teensies, que são as criaturas que você salva no jogo.
Através de vários estágios você deve salvar nada menos que 700 tensies, um número bem impressionante. Eles são necessários para desbloquear os próximos estágios que requerem que você tenha um determinado número de teensies para serem abertos. Algo que chama bastante atenção nesse jogo é a quantidade de desbloqueaveis que existem nele, e a forma como você é notificado o tempo todo e como o jogo te força a raspar bilhetes da sorte pra desbloquear mais e mais e mais coisas, me faz pensar que Rayman seria um jogo melhor de se jogar no Wii U(que também tem uma versão do jogo).
O excesso de notificações, as fases em que você deve interagir com seu ajudante, Murphy que consiste em apertar um botão para fazer ele cortar e interagir com coisas no cenário para que você possa avançar, seria bem mais fácil e rápido de fazer, deslizando o dedo numa tela touch em vez de ter que apertar um botão.
Enfim, além das fases normais, existem fases musicais em que suas ações seguem o ritmo da música, fases de corrida, e até um modo multiplayer local com partidas de futebol! 
No geral é um jogo excelente, muito bem produzido, com gráficos exuberantes e um controle competente. Pena que algumas fases consistem de memorização e tentativa e erro o que quebra muito o ritmo do jogo. Inferior a Rayman Origins por causa do excesso de fases de tentativa e erro, mas mesmo assim superior aos seus "concorrentes" Mario e Sonic.

16904081.review:
I'm going to start this review off by saying the only negative thing about Rayman Legends is Uplay, which if you haven't yet experienced it is basically the worst thing since the invention of the Vuvuzela. That said, I'm not even going to let Uplay hold me back from giving this game the amazing review it deserves. 

If you like platformers, you're going to love Rayman Legends. Simply said, it's one of the best platformers ever made and,  as someone who really loves platformers, I don't say that lightly. The artwork is beautiful, the soundtrack is incredible, and the game is just non-stop un-adulterated fun from stop to finish that you'll have a hard time putting it down. I logged more time into this game that I've ever put into any game short of Pokemon Silver version before I'd even realized I'd been so long. The amount of content that this game has to offer is astounding, especially considering almost all of it is utterly fantastic. 

Normally I'd give the message to boycott anything and everything that runs through Uplay but - just this once - I'll have to make an exception, because if you don't play this game you're missing out on something truly wonderful.

16870714.review:
I really love this platformer game.  The levels are challenging but not impossible, and makes the right choice to have there be varying rewards based on how well you do, rather than make every level a pass/fail.

One of the best parts of it is that there's no real penalty for dying.  Other players can just shoot you, and you're back.  This means that I can play it with my 5 year old and 7 year old, and we all have fun.  Sure, I'm getting most of the lums, but they're having a blast, too.

I'm not as big a fan of the challenges.  They're repetitive, and I felt like I was grinding out my million lums by the end.  There's also the problem that there are so many cheaters that a platinum result in the challenges is basically impossible, so it makes it an even longer grind.

By far the biggest problem, though, is the lack of multiple saves.  I couldn't play my own game, and then start over again with my kids.  If you want to start over, you need to delete your entire save.  That means multiple people can't really have their own games.  It's a huge flaw, and something the first game didn't do.

Score: 8.5/10

After having completed the unlockable content of the game and being just 30 Lums away from 100% completion, it's time to rate this game. What can I say...:
[b]It's the best freaking Jump'n Run ever (on Steam)![/b]

The artstyle, the gameplay, the character design, the music, the varying leveldesigns (rhythmbased, flight, speedrun, typical sidecroll levels etc)... It's so well-done, I can't think of anything the developers could have improved.

16740630.review:
As noted in my Rayman Origin's review, this game and its predecessor are two of the best platforming games to come out in recent years, far superior to Nintendo's Mario offerings.
However this one, unlike Origin's, suffers a fault - one that is almost unforgivable. This was originally a Wii-U game, utilizing the touch-pad on the Wii-U for certain segments of the game. In this PC port, these segments still exist - rather than redesign the level to be more fun platforming sections, instead they ham-fistedly added a "press Y to do a thing" function that makes these sections occasionally fiddly and tedious.
Other than that, this is more of the same (quite literally, as a good few dozen of Origin's levels make it into this one too as a bonus). Excellent music, theming and platforming. Highly recommend either of the recent Rayman games for any fans of platformers.

16429145.review:
Rayman is an interesting fella. He doesn't have a neck or limbs, but that doesn't prevent him from being a platform household name. His first game back in 1995 was full of original gameplay concepts that kept you hooked, despite the game's brutal difficulty. The game was such as succes that sequels followed after a few years. As great as those were, they were subject to the '3D rule' that departed from the classic side-scrolling worlds of old and offered 3D worlds instead.

After the succes of games like New Super Mario Bros. in recent years, many platformer series started to explore the good old realm of 2D platforming again, a realm lost somewhere in the late 90s. Rayman did it with the fantastic Rayman Origins (also on Steam, check it out if you have not already). Origins was a welcome game in 2011, as we hadn't really seen Ubisoft's mascot in a while. It was an old-fashioned 2D platformer like the 1995 classic, but also brought in elements from the 3D sequels. What Origins did better than many games in the new generation of sidescrollers, though, was that it also had new additions to the series of its own.

Other genre icons often kept innovation limited to 3D games, using the 2D entries to provide a nostalgic feel of familiarity. Origins was different. It was quirkier, more experimental, more anarchic in both gameplay and visuals, while also remaining true to its 90s roots.

Building from the same engine as Origins, Legends controls and feels very similar to its predecessor, yet somehow it also manages to feel fresh. What makes it so fun is that each level feels different and new gameplay elements are contstantly added, adding additional depth to the cleverly designed levels. At one point you're jumping through the desert along the beat of 'Eye of the Tiger' while later you might find yourself running vertically along a wall being chased by dragons. For a true fun fest you can gather some friends around and play cooperatively. Too bad there's still no online mode for this.

This is especially painful when you notice how big and robust of a package Legends otherwise is. There's plenty of  unlockable characters, which unfortunately have very little variation in both appearance and gameplay. More interesting are the levels you can unlock. Additional levels are unlocked if you collect more fairies and free more Teensies (your friends). The game has new weekly challenges to satisfy even ardent platform fans. The game even throws in a selection of the best levels from Origins as an unlockable extra. These are tweaked just so that you don't quite get the same experience as in the previous game.

The presentation is even better than in Origins. While I found that game to be one of the prettiest I ever played, Legends is even more detailed and dynamic than its predecessor, without changing much in terms of Rayman's distinct style. I could not have imagined a 2D game even more stunning than Origins, but Legends somehow manages it. Legends truly shows that there's really no limit to what can be achieved with today's 2D graphics in HD resolutions. The musical score is gorgeous and fully orchestrated. The tunes are a little similar, even when compared with Origins. There could have been a little more variety. Still, this is a soundtrack with a level of quality that most platformers don't have, just like in 1995.

Rayman Legends is just sheer fun, especially with friends. While not a drastic departure from the already impressive Origins, Legends still manages to provide a bigger, more polished package. If you can look past the lack of variety in characters or the lack of an online coop mode, there's is simply no better side-scrolling platformer available at the moment. This is the combination of art direction, gameplay and creativity that is rare in the genre these days. Rayman could just have taken the easy route and use the 'retro IS the appeal' mantra so common these days. Instead, Rayman Legends is also a modern game at the same time. Don't waste your time and money on the latest same old New Super Mario Bros. Rayman is where it's really at right now. Sorry, Nintendo, but Ubisoft beats you where you used to excel.

9,5/10

Jugablemente perfecto, largo, variado y sin absolutamente ningún defecto a destacar. Altamente recomendado a todos los amantes de los videojuegos y obligatorio para los que les guste el género.

Puntuación: 10/10

16003536.review: Homem Raio Lendas é a sequencia do ótimo jogo de plataforma Homem Raio Origens. Se você jogou o Origins, pense no Legends como sendo aquilo que você poderia esperar em uma sequência: mais variedade, mais conteúdo e melhoramentos no geral. Diferentemente do primeiro jogo, Rayman já começa sabendo todas as mecânicas (exs: planar com os cabelos, correr por paredes, etc.) e elas são aplicadas em mais ou menos vezes dependendo da fase, já no Origins, elas eram implementadas aos poucos. Além disso, houve uma preocupação maior na sequência em tornar cada fase uma experiência mais particular do que outras do mesmo mundo, notando-se por vezes mudanças drásticas na temática, música, visual, etc, entre uma fase e a seguinte. Houve bastante cuidado no visual de Legends, com mais detalhes que no primeiro jogo, além de às vezes ter um inimigo ou outro em 3D, mesmo que a jogabilidade toda seja em 2D. Os controles estão mais responsivos e a performance do jogo é excelente, rapidamente as fases são (re)carregadas. Alguns momentos são divertidos, especialmente no fim de cada mundo ou em alguma referência que aparece. Em vez de só colecionar lums como no Origins, Legends te dá mais uma tarefa nos estágios, que é salvar os Teensies (normalmente 10 por fase). Destaco também as "fases musicais", onde o andamento delas é definido pela música que toca e é necessário ter mais reflexo, e revisitações às fases comuns em que é preciso terminá-las em tempo recorde para salvar todos os Teensies. Ainda há espaço para challenges (desafios atualizados diária e semanalmente), kung-foot (modo multiplayer que é tipo um futebol zuera) e creatures (onde criaturinhas que você coleciona te dão mais lums todos os dias), sem contar que vários personagens podem ser desbloqueados dependendo do número total de lums (apesar de eles não terem diferenças de jogabilidade entre si). A trilha sonora do jogo, independentemente do tipo de estágio, é sensacional, com estilos bem variados, tendo também adaptações de músicas conhecidas, como Eye of the Tiger. Não é um jogo difícil nem fácil e vai te ocupar por umas boas horas. E pra quem não jogou o Origins, não tem problema, Legends remasterizou e adaptou 2/3 das fases do primeiro jogo e mesmo eu já tendo jogado-o, resolvi experimentar e notei que foram mudanças positivas. Então é isso aí, se você quer uma excelente opção de platformer para jogar sozinho ou com até 3 amigos no mesmo local, pegue Rayman Legends.

Rayman Legends veio definitivamente se impor aos grandes títulos da Ubsoft, já que por sua vez não vinha trazendo jogos decentes a tempos. Apostando na mesma fórmula bem sucedida de seu antecessor Legends trouxe a mesma mecânica simples porém eficiente, jogabilidade fluida e comandos que respondem muitíssimo bem, trouxe novamente seus incriveis gráficos que mesmo sendo em desenho conseguem sem sombra de dúvida ser muito bonito, com cores fortes e bem vivas tendo cenários e personagens desenhado mão.

15518340.review:
首先要对所有2D Platformer游戏的爱好者们说：[b]雷曼传奇的品质值得你为它忍受一次坑爹的UPLAY。[/b]

雷曼传奇在育碧中国商城上买49RMB，中文版，但不是steam激活，所以对中文有需求和对+1没需求的可以入育碧中国商城的版本，但看其他测评的仁兄有提醒说中国特供版还存在同步成就方面的问题，不知现在是否解决，所以还是慎入中国版。

另外，如果你玩过移动平台（iOS/Android）上的雷曼：丛林冒险和雷曼：嘉年华，需要提醒的是，移动平台上将雷曼改成了跑酷类，一条道走到黑，而PC和主机上的正作雷曼是手动控制移动的，算是相当传统的2D横版过关ACT，不过偏重过关而非ACT。

雷曼系列也是我早年就涉猎过的游戏，因此育碧重推雷曼起源的时候，我也玩了一把三大妈版。当时起源的画面和BGM着实把我震撼了，传奇的画面对比起源，部分boss使用了3D建模，但整体画面仍是带景深的2D。我可以毫不夸张地说：[b]育碧拥有几乎全球最好的2D美工和游戏作曲人才。[/b]雷曼和光之子的画面水准摆在那里，ubiart引擎的牛真不是吹的。

同时，传奇在内容上也是大大的良心，把前作起源的大部分关卡（应该至少有2/3）经过些许调整，收入传奇，这样基本上是买一个游戏玩两个游戏（但对强迫症患者来说可能是灾难），同时个人感觉起源关卡比原版起源稍简单，特别是起源里让我很苦手的飞行射击关卡，想要拿到全收集金牌很难，而进入传奇后收集要求降低，稍显容易。

最后说说本作亮点音乐关，将音乐节奏类和ACT结合，玩起来相当过瘾，这个需要自己玩过才能体会其中妙处[spoiler]（大家不用担心，国产良心厂商TX已将之抄袭）[/spoiler]。国内某[strike]育碧舅舅[/strike]主播还制作了蒙眼打音乐关的视频，实在用心良苦。[spoiler]不过可惜也没见雷曼在国内火起来……[/spoiler]

至于UPLAY，大家都懂。目前的情况是，有时连不上育碧服务器，导致成就不及时解锁、打不开挑战等问题，但一旦连上服务器成就会自动解锁，大概三天有一天连不上，也无需担心太多。还是开始说的那句话：雷曼传奇的品质值得你为它忍受一次UPLAY。

15406310.review:
The great:  Originality seeps from every pore of this game.  The artwork is phenominal, the level design is smart, and the music is lively and joyous.  Every character is quirky and fun, even if they're not that different gameplay-wise.  Rayman Legends capitalizes on the simplicity of the platforming genre, and does it in an accessible, streamlined experience.

The good:  The game modes.  When you finally exhaust the immense amount of levels, there is still more to do.  You can play a surprisingly intense round of Kung Foot, which is soccer meets the Matrix.  You can play some levels from the previous games.  You can also do some challenges that are devilishly tricky.  Obviously, this stuff was added as an afterhtought, and it isn't as fleshed out as the main levels, but it was a smart afterthought, because it is still quite fun.

The bad:  It's an Ubisoft game for PC, so you know what that means.  Yup, you're gonna have to deal with the annoyance of Uplay.  Booting up the game from Steam only to have it open Uplay and update itself, and then slowly clunk you into what you actually wanted to do in the first place, which is play the game.  It's unfortunate that this exists, because the developers had nothing to do with this decision and it's all Ubisoft's fault.  Bah humbug.

Overall, this is a must own for lovers of local co-op and/or platformers.  It has a unique charm about it that is unseen elsewhere, and it's worth dealing with Ubisoft's incompetence to get to the reward of this phenominal experience.

Verdict:  Buy it for any price, you won't be sorry.

15324388.review:
Si hubiera que describir con una sola palabra este juego, la más adecuada sería sin duda 'máravilloso'. Rayman Legends es la prueba viviente de que un juego no necesita una historia sólida para brillar y hacerte pasar un buen rato. Si bien es verdad que se aleja de lo que en su momento fue el nacimiento del primer Rayman, hay que decir que su evolución no ha destruido su pasado sino que ha supuesto una sorpresa agradable.

Empezando por el apartado gráfico, podemos decir que mejora lo que ya se vio en su primera parte, Rayman Origins. Nos volvemos a encontrar con los típicos dibujitos que de momento indican que no se trata de un juego serio, sino de un mundo mágico en el que perderse y dejar volar la imaginación. Unos escenarios coloridos y vivos que harán surgir alegría y entusiasmo en el jugador, haciendo que admire la belleza de la flora  y los diseños de los distintos personajes, enemigos  y escenarios. Los nuevos toques 3D (en especial aquellos que se aprecian más en los combates contra los jefes finales) nos harán meternos en la situación y darle un toque más realista al juego.

Una sincera enhorabuena al compositor de la banda sonora del juego. Cada melodía, cada sonido y cada ruido se ajusta perfectamente a los escenarios, manteniéndote relajado y disfrutando o en tensión y nervioso dependiendo de la situación o la misión que en ese momento tenga que ser cumplida. Además, descubriremos en un tipo de nivel especial que seguir el ritmo de la música será de vital importancia para abrirnos paso y tener éxito en dichos niveles. Por mi parte, no he podido evitar conseguir esta estupenda banda sonora y seguir escuchándola en aquellas ocasiones en las que necesito rememorar mis horas y horas sin dejar de jugar a este juego.

En cuanto a la jugabilidad, no podría ser de lo más sencillo y entretenido. Un botón para moverse, otro para correr, otro para pegar y otro para saltar. Lo que bien parece ser unos controles la mar de sencillos, pueden ser unas herramientas a tener muy en cuenta a la hora de afrontar los diferentes puzzles a lo largo del juego, que nos harán calentarnos la cabeza cada vez que queramos una partida perfecta, sobre todo jugando en solitario. No bastará con saltar en plataformas y conseguir el objeto deseado. A veces habrá que jugar con la velocidad y la potencia de salto para evitar ser golpeados por las distintas trampas del nivel y salir ilesos. Otras veces, como en los niveles a contrarreloj, será cuestión de encontrar el mejor atajo a la vez que se es lo más rápido que se pueda.

Decir que este juego es divertido, es quedarse corto. No solamente veremos que se trata de un mundo loco lleno de distintos niveles, los cuales están divididos en distintas temáticas, sino que además contaremos con montones de secretos y coleccionables con los que dedicarle horas para conseguir el 100%. Una vez acabado, también hay que tener en cuenta que contamos con unos minijuegos con los que mantenernos más entretenidos intentando superar los distintos records establecidos por jugadores de todo el mundo. Es necesario añadir también, que los creadores han tenido el buen detalle de alargar la vida del juego aportando algunos niveles de su primera parte, Rayman Origins, algo que agradará a todos aquellos que lo jugasteis y lo disfratasteis, y que gustará a aquellos que en su momento no lo probaron.

No tengo más que decir, tan solo que yo puntúo este juego con un 10/10.

Lo mejor
+Un mundo mágico lleno de vida y con una historia graciosa.
+Los escenarios y puzzles están realizados con mucho cariño e ingenio.
+Los niveles de rescate, contrarreloj, y musicales. Asombrosos.
+El añadido de niveles de Rayman Origins
+Cooperativo local de hasta 4 jugadores

Lo peor
+Se podría haber explotado un poco más el tema del online
+El juego es tan divertido que se hará corto al acabarlo

Jogo bastante divertido, com o mesmo estilo fantástico de seu antecessor Rayman Origins (uma vez que é sequência), que é uma retomada (não totalmente) de características de jogabilidade do Rayman do PS1 (que também é plataforma), lançado em 1995. 

No game em questão foi inserida uma infinidade de modos e minigames divertidos, além de outras novidades. A trilha sonora é igualmente incrível (ás vezes parece melhor) ao seu antecessor. Os gráficos são bonitos e cômicos, semelhantes aos do Rayman Origins. As animações dos personagens e das fases, desde pequenos detalhes, são belíssimas.

A jogabilidade é simples, porém as fases dificultam em determinados momentos, tendo mecânicas distintas dependendo dos estágios, não sendo fácil completar 100% alguns deles.

O grande destaque desse game, na minha opinião, foram os estágios musicais, que são extremamente divertidos.

Jogo recomendadíssimo pelo mero mortal em questão.

Wirklich sehr cooles spiel. Da ich wirklich viele derartige spiele spiele, kann ich sagen, dass Rayman Legends eins der besonderen art ist. Es war nicht umsonst lange so preisstabil. Es steckt wirklich eine menge liebe in dem spiel und jung und alt können es zusammen spielen. 
Was mir besonders an dem spiel gefällt ist die stimmung die rüber kommt. Die Musik in verbindung mit dem lustigen comic look und den animationen zieht einen mit in die Stimmung rein, so dass ich lachen muss wenn ich nach dem 10 Versuch etwas zu schaffen wieder den gleichen Fehler mache.
Das spiel ist nicht wirklich schwer, was es aber schwierig macht, ist es zu zweit..dritt...viert zu spielen, da man sich gegenseitig einfach stark einschränken kann wenn einer nicht schnell genug ist oder jemand dir den schirm weg schlägt auf den du springen willst, ..oder die plattform für sich verschiebt und die anderen spieler missachtet.  
Wenn man dann alles synchron erledigen will und den gleichen weg geht, versteht man so allmälig dass man entweder besser mit seinen spielkameraden auf augenhöhe ist, oder sie unterstützt. Manchmal ist man fast schon gezwungen nur unterstützend dabei zu sein. Bei manch anderen spielen bin ich enttäuscht und gehe längst auf die Barrikaden wenn ich nur eine unterstützende Rolle spiele. Hier aber nicht, aus irgend einem Grund macht das sogar Spaß :)
Ein weiterer Pluspunkt ist imho. dass es sich wunderbar für speedrun's eignet, nicht nur weil es sich schnell spielen lässt, sondern weil es auch einen großen wieder-spiel-wert hat.

15203811.review:
Rayman Legends is a more accessible platformer than its predecessor Rayman Origins with a gradual difficulty scale, easier to find secrets, and slower paced levels.  Does this bother me, no, not really because Rayman legends is still a fun platformer with well-designed levels.  

What bothers me is that the creative art design and amazing soundtrack in Rayman Origins was not passed down to its sequel.  Fortunately for Legend owners there is a large collection of Origin levels that can be earned and unlocked, which is a great bonus feature.  

Remember the treasure chest speed levels from Origins?  No chests this time, but there are these speed levels that go along to a song and all of them are fun and challenging. 
 
Last thing to note is that I have mixed feelings with the Wii-U touch screen levels where you tell the A.I. to interact with obstacles instead of a touch screen swipe motion, these levels feel a bit awkward IMO.  

To sum up Rayman Legends has better pacing, level design, and more content.  Rayman Origins has a better soundtrack, artwork, and harder, faster levels.

Overall Rayman Legends is a must have game for platform gaming fans.

15116046.review:
I have to say, this is a pretty inspired platformer. The controls are simple, power-ups are few, but instead you get treated to some seriously well designed environments. The daily and weekly challenges are a testament to how much gameplay variety the game has. There are enough background touches that replaying a level a few times, you'll notice things that you missed the first time through. The musical stages are a treat for the eyes, and a nice homage to the early auto-play ROM hacks (i.e. SMW Kumikyoku) which would do the same thing. (though you need to jump and fire to the beat, of course)

You don't have a lives counter. When you die, you just start back at some arbitrary checkpoint. You can also just opt to restart at the last checkpoint via the pause menu if you messed up getting some collectible. (lums or teensies) Challenge purists may scoff at this feature but anti-frustration features such as these are long overdue. Some players go for utter perfection and they can still impose that challenge on themselves. Those of us who'd rather not endure dozens of repeats of an entire stage for one difficult section will have things the way they are. Not to mention, anti-frustration features are much more kid friendly. Finally, Ubisoft cycles through challenges every day where you can compete with the world. They have you covered, though they admittedly do a miserable job at managing the hackers.

The game is fairly non-linear, with paths opening up as you collect more teensies and lucky tickets.  Teensies make more standard stages available, and tickets (eventually) open up more of the "Back to Origins" stages.

90% of what I _didn't_ like about this game can be summed up in one word: UPlay. The fact that they're using steam as a conduit to push their redundant DRM system which significantly adds to the startup time is appalling. One thing you better not do is check the box that says "don't tell me again" when you close the window with your key. You won't have the steam overlay available to get it again when it's time to enter the key again, many minutes later. I almost botched my install this way...luckily I hadn't copied something else into my clipboard. This experience alone almost caused me to knee-jerk a negative review in...lucky for them, the game is extremely good.

The rest of what I found irritating were some of the pop-ups after a level. One made it look like an option but literally forced me to stop what I was doing and go play an invasion level. I also kept getting annoying popups to use the tickets even though I'd already responded to one such popup. It's my own damn prerogative if I want to use them all at once. I also don't like the fact that unlocking levels is somewhat RNG based, but I'm guessing that they had the sense to heavily influence the "randomness" of unlocking said levels.

All in all, I guess I recommend it. Hopefully someday Ubisoft will realize they're alienating gamers with their DRM, and...yeah, I'm sticking with Steam. Thanks. That said, the game itself is worth the annoyance.

- Gráficos / interação com o cenário (UbiArt).
- Trilha sonora I M P E C Á V E L.
- Coletáveis.
- Multiplayer local super amigável para se jogar com filhos, sobrinhos ou crianças pequenas.
- Personagens extremamente carismáticos. (Bárbara <3)
- Fases musicais.


Contras:

- Falta de integração ao Steamworks: isso significa que não há cloud saves, trading cards ou conquistas (exceto as do uPlay). Se você tem dois computadores, por exemplo, deve manter saves independentes em cada um deles - o que é ridículo.

15054688.review:
Super fun platformer! The gameplay, the art, the soundtrack ... is all so well done. It truly makes you want to come back to the game for more hilarious fun. It's like Rayman Origins, but with enough new elements to keep the experience fresh (and imo it's more fun too).
Have to say this is one of the most (if not the most) fun rayman game I've ever played. Rayman 1 is still my favorite in the series (though nostalgia is a big influence here), but in terms of pure fun, this game is just AWESOME.

If you have some friends to play this game with, I strongly suggest you do so. It makes the game even more fun & hilarious. Don't worry though, so far I've only played singleplayer and that is a lot of fun aswell. Also, if you haven't played Origins (and you wish to do so), there is no real need to buy it, as there is a whole "back to origins" stage available in this game. You gain access to these levels throughout your adventure.

So: if you like rayman, or 2d platformers (with humor), just get this game. It's worth its money for sure!

Very fun to watch and play
10/10

14975292.review:
Лучший на моей памяти платформер с приятной рисованной графикой и отзывчивым управлением. В нем нет как такового хардкора, от которого хочется сломать геймпад или клавиатуру. Все миссии довольно простые, к тому же есть чекпоины.

Особое внимание вызывают музыкальные уровни. Они представляют собой небольшой продолжительности раннер под музыку. Всего таких уровней 12. 6 оригинальных и они же в 8-битном исполнении.
Тут можно глянуть первый : http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=409418986

Прохождение основных уровней займет часов 15. А если взять еще и уровни из "Ориджина", которые можно открыть в игре, то еще часов на 10.

Еще присутствуют дневные и недельные задания, в которых соревнуешься с игроками со всего мира. Эти задания представляют собой уровни на время, количество собранных монеток и т.п.

Ачивок в стиме нет, но в юПлее есть как стандартные 4 юПлейные с наградами, так и 50 обычных. Все ачивки делаются довольно просто, и требуют только время.

В целом очень позитивный и веселый платформер. Советую всем! 9/10.

14965544.review:
Dies ist mal ein modernes Spiel so wie sie heute alle sein sollten. Kreativ, gut umgesetzt und es macht verdammt nochmal Spaß. Mein größter Kritikpunkt an den meisten Spielen sind nicht nur die absurd hohen Preise des Spiels an sich sondern ein Wort das viel zu oft in Bezug auf moderne Videospiele fällt, DLC. Und siehe da Rayman Legends ist nun eine Weile draußen und noch kein einziges, hier wurde wirklich ein Spiel abgeliefert das unterhält und Spaß macht. Der erst Teil war schon verdammt gut nur hatte ich irgendwie ein Problem mit den Bossen ich fand sie eher nervig aber dafür waren sie schön designed. Bei diesem Punkt schwächelt Rayman Legends jedoch ein bisschen meiner Meinung nach sie sind zwar immer noch nett designed aber mehr als "nett" ist da meiner meinung nach auch nicht drin, zu dem passen manche Welten nicht in das Rayman Universum, das ich so empfinde kann aber auch daran liegen das ich mit Rayman aufgewachsen bin und er der Jump 'n run Held meiner Kindheit ist und ich vor allem die 3d Teile genossen habe und sie auch heute noch als sehr gut empfinde. Dies liegt unter anderem jedoch auch am Nostalgiebonuss jedoch ahbe ich mir von den Welten an sich mehr versprochen.Jedoch hat das Spiel generell einen Stil der auf mich persönlich und wohl auch für Kinder sehr ansprechend ist und sein sollte. Das Gameplay ist rund, wobei mir die Level bei denen dauerhaft sprinten "muss" in meinen Augen am besten sind, da sie einen netten Flow erzeugen der das Adrenalin schon ein bisschen ansteigen lässt. Somit hat man ein fast perfektes Jump 'n run mit netten Ideen in den Leveln die für abwechslung sorgen. 

WAS NUR FAST PERFEKT?!

Ja, dies liegt an ein paar kleineren Sachen die mich jedoch gestört haben. Ohne Kritik geht es nun einmal auch nicht..

Die Menüführung finde ich schrecklich grade zu Beginn ist das alles sehr.. unübersichtlich und überladen, da alle 10 Sekunden irgendwas aufblinkt und einem etwas neues cooles gezeigt werden will, es ist wie mit so kleinen Kindern die einen Ständig hauen um sich aufmerksam zu machen um zu zeigen, tja... das sie cooler als die Anderen sind. Mich nervt sowas einfach weil ich mein neu gekauftes Spiel, spielen will und nicht ständig unterbrochen werden will. Dann die Spezialstages in den Leveln, also diese Geheimgänge bei denen man noch Kleinlinge abgreifen kann..warum werde ich verdammt nochmal jedes mal aus der Tür geworfen wenn ich in dem Level verkacke?! Da jedes mal rein zu laufen, zu verkacken, nur um dann 5 Sekunden später nachdem ich erneut reingelaufen bin wieder zu verkacken und wieder raus geworfen zu werden finde ich persönlich unnötig warum nicht im Level wieder neustarten, und wenn man rauswill geht man halt durch die deutlich bereits vorhandene Tür wieder raus, es dient ja dem Comfort. Und deswegen kann ich diese kleinen Kritikpunkte nicht wirklich zählen lassen da sie wirklich minimal sind und vielleicht auch nur mich stören ich kann einfach keine objektive Sicht auf ein Spiel haben, kann niemand. Aber das sind halt alles Dinge die die Geduld des Spielers auf die Probe stellen und stellt euch nun mal ein Kind mit weit weniger Geduld vor. Man darf nicht vergessen es ist ein Spiel unteranderem für Kinder.

Aber all dies sollte niemanden vor dem Kauf abhalten es ist ein wirklich gutes Spiel und Leute die den ersten teil mochten werden auch den mögen es ist eine Fortsetzung die mehr Content bietet und mehr Ideen hat und bei der einige Sachen verbessert wurden so wie eine Fortsetzung sein sollte. Hier wurde sich mühe gegeben im Gegensatz zu..gefühlt allen Spielen bei EA. Sollte jedoch auch aus dieser Serie ein Franchise werden das jedes Jahr erscheint würde auch Rayman für mich sterben, so wie Assassins Creed. Und das würde ich nur sehr sehr ungern erleben also bitte Ubisoft werkelt lieber etwas länger an neuen Spielen als jedes jahr das gleiche raus zu hauen. Als wenn sich irgendwer von denen das hier durchliest.. naja man kann ja hoffen. Also dann ich muss noch ein paar Kleinlinge retten.

14947952.review:
честно, я ненавидел Рэймана, с 2001 года, когда поиграл в Rayman 2 на Sega Dreamcast. Игра тогда казалась какой-то непонятной и странной бродилкой, с непонятной камерой, еще и в 3D... Следующее мое знакомство с героем без рук и ног состоялось в 2013-м году на платформе ios, и поначалу даже понравилось, но... жирнющую точку в отношениях поставила фримиум база игры...

История нынешних приятных взаимоотношений со вселенной Рэймана началась когда я зашел в гости к другуполгода назад и увидел эту игру на икс-боксе. Изначально полный скепсис, желание развидеть, обиды прошлого, но аппетит приходит во время игры! 

Поиграв пару откровенно слабых уровня, сказал что фигня этот Рэйман, после чего увидел хардкор и быстро  проникся к этой игре. Не знаю что сподвигло, задорный темп, элементы пародий, "живые уровни", или глаз просто свыкся с мультяшной графикой, но игра зацепила. И уж очень хочется ее сравнивать с такой классикой как bubsy и sonic, различия только в темпе самих персонажей.

Rayman Legends 10 люмов из 10
