14940827.review:
Este jogo esta tão perfeito que eu não sei nem por onde começar !

Primeiramente devo dizer que a melhor parte do jogo de longe é a trilha sonora ao melhor estilo heróico e épico. Além das musicas que tocam durante o jogo, todo final de 'Mundo' ainda se encontra uma espécie de Guitar Hero, aonde voce move seu personagem ao longo do cenário que te conduz a fazer movimentos a combinar com a música, não preciso nem dizer que essas músicas também são épicas não é?

O gameplay não deixa a desejar ao melhor estilo Rayman te dão até a possibilidade de escolher outras skins ou outros personagens, porém todos possuem o mesmo estilo de movimentação, não te forçando a ter que jogar com certo personagem em certa fase, o que pode ser bom... Ou não, porque no final eu acabei só jogando com Rayman.

Os gráficos estão cartunisticos 2D e alguns vilões em 3D, pra mim que joguei o jogo de gameboy color, a evolução veio a cavalo e em ótimo estilo.

O jogo mesmo tendo a mesma pegada em toda fase ele acaba não sendo repetitivo, pois sempre ocorre pequenas inovações e desafios cada vez que você tem progresso em seu mundo. Caso você zere o jogo ainda existe uma quantidade infinita de contéudo extra, com atualização de 'challenges' dia-a-dia, semanalmente e mensalmente.

Conclusão: 
Você é fã de Rayman? Este jogo é obrigatório. 
Você é fã de jogos nessa pegada ""Mario"" ? Este jogo é obrigatorio. 
E se você não conhece Rayman devo dizer que vai começar com o jogo perfeito.

14938766.review: [b]If you're the one for nostalgic games, including Rayman, then this is the one for you! The gameplay is superb, and although it does lag a tiny bit now and then, you won't even care because you're too focused on how fun this game is. ;) Some levels require fast thinking, multi-tasking and being quick on your feet (Rayman feet) as you jump through obstacles and fight off enemies that come in your way whilst a fire blaze is coming after you. There are also lever-related levels where you have a handy sidekick guy who helps make your obstacles a bit easier, as long as you remember to use this little sidekick guy by pressing 'w', or 'q' and 'e' to make him rotate the wheel/s. Furthermore, there are mini games such as challenges, and a sports ball-kicking multi-player mini game. Throughout the game, you'll have little bonuses popping up here and there to help you gain more points/life, and during the game loads, there may be a free life-line heart which you must grab before the loading has finished (if you want to!). You also must try to free all of the little blue guys (in some or all levels) in order to gain all three trophies for each game room. Overall, from a Rayman lover, I think this game is worth the buy, especially since I was able to get it 75% off (special sale). You won't regret it, and like I similarly said, you will have so much fun once you get into the grip of the game.[/b]

14934092.review:
Rayman Legends es un juegazo en toda regla.
Desde sus niveles basicos por cada mundo hasta sus grandes niveles de musica, con sus personajes, su extraño multijugador competitivo y su extrema rejugabilidad hacen de este un gran juego.

En temas de rendimiento esta muy bien optimizado, claro esta que no todo el mundo podra jugar por desgracia.

Modo historia, si asi se le puede llamar... Ofrece una gran variedad de mundos, y que, al menos para mi gusto, hacen de este un gran juego de plataformas.

Las referencias a sus anteriores son abundantes:
Murfy, rescatar a los Diminutos de jaulas, vencer a jefes originales cuanto menos, y todo eso junto a una gran banda sonora que hara que te lo pases bien, muy bien.

Su multijugador local me parece una opcion excelente, pero que deberian combinar con posibilidad de multijugador via internet.

En resumen este juego se lleva para mi un 8/10

14931261.review:
ПРЕДУПРЕЖДЕНИЕ: ИГРА НЕ ДЛЯ МАЛЫШЕЙ! ДЕТСКАЯ И МУЛЬТЯШНАЯ ГРАФИКА МОЖЕТ БЫТЬ ВЕЗДЕ, ДАЖЕ В ВЗРОСЛЫХ ИГРАХ И МУЛЬТФИЛЬМАХ!
Rayman legends - отличный платформер от известной студии Ubisoft. Автором идеи является Мишель Ансель. Этот человек решил возродить старую серию игр. У него это отлично получилось. Графика в игре приятна глазу, она очень хороша.
Кратко о сюжете:
Злодей из прошлой игры размножился и наши главные герои: Рейман, Глобокс и две малютки идут спасать малюток и люмов от злодеев.
Кратко о геймплее:
Мишель Ансель решил создать платформер, в котором будут различные пейзажи, на которые можно подивиться, в котором будет великолепная музыка. У автора это хорошо получилось. В игре есть различные локации: средневековье, болото, гора Олимп и другие. В конце каждой локации будет 3D битва с боссом и музыкальный уровень. Музыкальный уровень - уровень, в котором все действия нужно делать под музыку. Если вы прошли все уровни, то вам разблокируются уровни на время - захваты картин. Если вы прошли всю игру, то вам - к испытаниям. Испытания - это уровни, которые меняются раз в день или неделю, в них вы можете посоревноваться с другими игроками по всему миру. Если вам надоело бегать и прыгать, то можете сыграть в кунг-фут, это что-то вроде футбола 1 на 1 и в 2D, оригинальная задумка этого кунг-фута. В игре есть выбор персонажа, их там около 20. В игре есть питомцы, которые дают вам игровую валюту каждый день. Игра лёгкая, самое то для того, чтобы расслабиться, посмеяться, посмотреть на персонажей, на игровой мир. У игры есть один минус: мультиплеер только локальный, тоесть когда куча людей играют на одном компьютере.
Игра шикарная, рекомендую брать.
ВПИ: 12+ т.к. есть плохие шутки и грудь у некоторых персонажей.

14930202.review:
After playing Rayman Origins, I didn't think this sequel would to live up to the fun I had with that game, and it didn't.... It exceeded it! I love this game from beginning to end. It bring all the wacky traditional fun platforming I had with the last game and enhance it. The music is great and the stages are just gorgeous, honestly I didn't think they would top some of their over the top levels in Origins but they made those look mediocre by comparison. Not to mention how every world end with a musical level is just spectacular.

Story:
The story is just as confusing as last time, you know what it hard to even gather a story. Who cares! Bad guys are doing bad things, platform your way to victory and stop them! It work for Mario after all. 

Gameplay:
Fast pace platforming that goes from easy to insanely difficult. But despite that there will never be a point you just say enough. You want to keep trying for the better score or fastest time to complete a stage. With the addition of a daily/weekly challenges, you can compete against other people for the fastest times or biggest score. 

Sound:
Some of the best music I heard in a game. Honestly I could listen to all the songs from the musical levels of each world all day long. 

This games does what a sequel should do, top the prequel. In fact it relish in it by letting you go back and play the classic stage from each world in Origin. Honestly between all the characters to unlock, time/race challenges of each level, the Origins levels, creatures to collects, Scratch off tickets to win, and why am I still typing? I gotta play this game some more!

14927666.review:
这是一个好游戏，关卡十分精妙，设定十分有趣，雷曼算是育碧老一代的系列游戏，这么多年了，虽然玩法没有改变，但是内容却在不断创新。
如果只看关卡，简直是神作，每个关卡系列都有一个特殊的主题，然后不时加入新的设定和玩法，简直眼花缭乱。
在美术上，虽然这种卡通风格非常常见，但是动态效果非常细心，你会发现几乎所有的要素的动作都很细腻，各种要素的动画帧数都相当高，表演也很丰富。不光是关卡相关，连背景演出都值得一看。
战斗系统的存在感很低，因为这确实是一个动作游戏，敌人几乎没有难度，难度全部建立在关卡上，敌人只是其中一个陪衬要素。
这个游戏的最大乐趣在于，在游戏关卡中不断的得到新玩法，不停的观赏新关卡的新设定，以及，寻找那些隐藏要素。
-------------------------------------------
刚刚清了所有的关卡，最后的音乐8bit复刻关卡是我玩过所有游戏最反人类的关卡没有之一。简直反人类！简直反人类！简直反人类！简直反人类！简直反人类！简直反人类！简直反人类！

14922120.review:
这几年谁都不知道育碧在想什么，除了大力推广整死人的PlayU平台之外，就是抱着刺客，极地战豪这几个新兴牌子就狠命榨干，老牌子就都死的死残的残，波斯王子、雷曼系列，这些伴随着包括中国玩家在内的玩家美好童年的游戏就这么一个个销声匿迹了。

雷曼（Rayman）系列就属于育碧已经做到瓶颈的几款品牌之一，带有一丝常见横板卷轴游戏的初代，堪称3D变革和巅峰的二代，中规中矩的三代可谓是让这只没胳臂没腿的神秘生物伴随着玩家走过了童年，而育碧本身也是最早进入中国大陆的游戏厂商之一（育碧上海 工作室）所以使得雷曼系列成为了当时最为家喻户晓的游戏，甚至还涉足到了教育部门——当年一款特供中国的英语大闯关更是全程中文配音，可见当时育碧对这个系列的重视程度。

然而神龟虽寿犹有竟时，雷曼到了4代可以说是自己把自己给玩死了，而一切的起因就是因为雷曼4疯狂兔子

 http://store.steampowered.com/app/15080 

疯兔的出现导致了疯兔反客为主成为了比雷曼更为火爆的角色，雷曼瞬间屈居于配角，以至于疯兔自成一派，而本作究竟是疯兔系列的原点作还是雷曼4也有些不好定性，在多平台的初代之后发现这种小游戏构造的游戏居然更适合于任天堂的Wii平台，于是重心全部转移到了Wii平台的疯兔系列之上（也是任天堂和育碧蜜月期的开始），雷曼的正统作系列也在疯兔之后被雪藏（尽管疯兔系列也有雷曼客串但是已经不是雷曼正统作了）。

于是，从2007年开始，经历了5年的等待最终雷曼的续作 雷曼起源出品了

 http://store.steampowered.com/app/207490 

，制作组已经意识到3D在疯兔之后被玩烂，玩家已经回到了返朴归真的2D横板时代，于是一切回到了原点，完全2D的起源就这么出世了，然而仍然是后劲不足，影响力不算太大，而雪藏那么多年的雷曼确实也快被人遗忘了。

结果育碧开始玩起了量产，于是复活作第二作：雷曼传奇在一年后发行。

雷曼传奇首先依然是2D横板过关，但是明显吸收了最近很流行的2D玩法，3D人物景深的方式，虽然是2D，但是人物并非纸片人，而是有很大的层次，姑且算是2.5D了，画面采用了最近育碧很流行的UBI ARTS风格，水彩画的风格配合卡通化的人物，让玩家感到很放松。

其次流畅的动作，带有一定跑酷战斗性质一气呵成的动作手感让所有玩家感到顺畅无比，初代那种战斗感觉又回来了，而且还有所加强，

再说小人物配合，雷曼的朋友在游戏中起到了一些决定性的作用，快速地与他们配合是游戏能够一气呵成的关键，而这个步骤在WiiU版中更是借用触摸屏的方式表现的异常有趣，当然这里还是PC版本于是点到为止，不多提。

各种BOSS的魄力也是十足，游戏也是颇有难度，尤其是吸收了一部分马里奥系列的惯性移动方式之后，也很容易失足落水等等，好在游戏本身没有“命”的概念，无非就是回到checkpoint继续，因此对于动作类苦手也是比较亲切。

可以说，在这个横板卷轴复兴的年代，雷曼传奇虽不是一款神作，但是也算是佳品。如果玩家拥有WiiU的话，更应该体会一下为WiiU特制的操作方式。

不过虽然游戏不错，但是PlayU平台依然拖了后腿，上海育碧特供中文版而不是全球发行多国语言版更是让玩家必须在steam的鱼和中文版的熊掌之间犹豫一阵，之前特供版和全球版的冲突更是让玩家无法同步成就，不怎么样的DRM和特供版完全地毁了这款游戏本身很好的游戏体验，因此如果你能忍受怕PlayU差劲的体验的话，这款游戏是绝对值得一玩！

14921752.review:
[b] If you enjoy this review please consider following my Curator page [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/31067175-ParanoidAndroid-Picks/] here [/url]. [/b]

Rayman Legends is a truly special game. Following the fantastic reboot of Rayman Origins, Legends surpases it in every way possible. The tight controls and superb level design makes gameplay smooth and fluid. Every death feels like a fault of your own and not the cause of a cheap obstacle or bad game design. Add to this the best visuals and art direction of any platformer ever (yes, including Trine 2), and you have a recipe for greatness. The UbiArt engine is able to produce such lush and wonderful artwork that it's hard not to stop at stare.

As for content, this game has more than enough. Boasting a sizeable amount of main stages as well as Origins redone. Throw in the time trials and daily challenges, this game will surely satisfy any platformer fan.

Although it may seem hyperbolic, I believe that I can say with certaintly that Rayman Legends is the finest platformer that I have ever played. It's the complete package. If you are a fan of the genre at all you owe it to yourself to pick this title up.

14918923.review:
Rayman Legends, a game that was supposed to be Wii U exclusive on February 21, 2013 and Ubisoft decides at the last second to make it multi-platforms so it was moved to September 2013. I honestly have played all the versions of this game but i only own the Wii U and PC version. Rayman Legends is a sequel to Rayman Origins where this time, instead of saving happy faces, you save the usual Teensies like in most Rayman games. There are multiple characters to play as even though there all the same. Gameplay is good however, when your playing Murphy levels, you cannot tap whatever you want unlike the Wii U version. This is frustrating since you cannot get some extra lums for a gold trophy. Every level has 2 objectives, get a certain amount of lums and save teensies. You cannot progress furthur until u get the right amunt of teensies. There are other modes in this game like Kung Foot where its basically soccer. There are also Challenges in which you do a certain objective everyday. There are 4 types of challenges: Daily.Daily Extreme,Weekly, and Weekly Extreme. The maps also change once its been a day/week and a diffrent objective like how far can you go or how fast can you get a certain amount of lums. You do get trophies for this which raises your Awesomeness level. Your Awesomess Level increases as you collect trophies as they give you points. Once you reach a certain amount of Aweomess, you unlocked all the challenges. There is also a lottery and to get tickets, you need to get a certain amount of lums in levels.
I give this game 7 out of 10 because this game is literally meant for the Wii U, Plus the Wii U version has more content than the other versions like being able to control Murphy which is really good.

14918081.review:
Хороший платформер с красивой рисованной графикой (местами 3D). Имеет отклонениея от Rayman Origins как в хорошую, так и в плохую сторону. Вердикт: очень хорошо.

Положительные изменения:
[list]
[*]Все возможности игрока доступны с самого начала (не надо открыть атаку, парение, бег по стенам и прочее в процессе игры)
[*]Больший выбор персонажей
[*]Уровни в стиле Land of Livid The Dead (бег с препятствиями) встречаются в течение всей игры, а не только в конце.
[*]Сильный удар накапливается куда быстрее
[*]По ощущениям, управление более отзывчивое
[*]Геймплей поразнообразней.
[*]Графика местами сильнее впечатляет, особенно в том, что касается освещения.
[*]Нет уровней, которые было почти невозможно пройти идеально. В Origins было несколько уровней (особенно летающих), где без чуть ли не десятков попыток нельзя было получить все награды, так как было нужно наизусть выучить расположение всех врагов. Или, может быть, они были рассчитаны на кооперативное прохождение.
[*]Бои с боссами сделаны более оригинально, а сами боссы сделаны в подходящем по стилю 3D.
[*]Отдельно стоит упомянуть музыкальные уровни (последние в каждом мире). Представляют из себя уровень погоню, как в Land of Livid Dead, но с каждый сопровождается уникальной музыкальной композицией, синхронизированную под происходящее на экране.
[*]Испытания на скорость доступны не сразу, так что нет необходимости после прохождения уровня тут же пытаться пройти его заного, но быстрее. И сделаны они более оригинально, в виде вторжения (уникальные уровне в стиле текущего мира, но с врагами из другого) и могут быть пройдены на золото, серебро и бронзу.
[/list]

Отрицательные:
[list]
[*]Из-за небольшого изменения визуального стиля (от сплошных цветов к полутонам) и отказа от чётких линий, графика местами выглядит размытой. Это не так страшно, учитывая, что в других аспектах графика только улучшилась. Но просто немного расстраивает. Хотя, полагаю, это дело вкуса.
[*]Беготня между картин надоедает, следовало сделать выбор уровней попроще.
[*]В игру были добавлены ненужные элементы, вроде купонов, зверьков, сетевых испытаний, уровня крутизны и центра уведомлений, чтобы за всем этим следить. Без этого всего в игре было бы меньше раздражения.
[/list]

В общем, Legends в важном даже лучше Origins, а расстраивает лишь в мелочах.

P.S. Я купил игру за 400 руб. в виде предзаказа (бонусом был Rayman Origins, который иначе нельзя было купить в русском Стиме), то есть по 200 руб. за игру. Обе игры стоят того, а может и полной цены.

14907309.review:
As of late, the 2D platforming genre has seen a bit of a resurgence, especially in indie games like Super Meat Boy, I Wanna Be The Guy and to a lesser extent in more high-profile titles New Super Mario Bros. and the like. Rayman Legends, the sequel to 2011's reboot of the Rayman series, Rayman Origins, is one such platformer, and quite possibly one of the best in its genre. 

Rayman Legends, like its predecessor, is very simple in terms of its gameplay: Run, jump and punch your way through each of the levels, rescuing the small, fairy-like Teensies (who replace Origins' Electoons) as you go. It's actually quite a good thing the gameplay is this simple, because this game's difficulty is certainly not to be sniffed at. On some of the Challenge levels in particular it might take someone many different tries to get past a particular area of the game, and whilst at first this may seem aggravating there's no feeling quite like finally completing that ONE level. Another interesting addition is the Murfy mechanic - whilst playing, the player can use Murfy to guide their character through the level, by for instance moving platforms or distracting enemies, adding a little variety to the gameplay whilst still retaining the simplicity that makes it so enjoyable. There are also additional characters, but the differences are mostly cosmetic and don't change the gameplay, though in all honesty this is more to the game's benefit, since the gameplay is OK as it is, and doesn't really need any different character abilities to make it any better. 

Also like Origins, Legends' story is barebones, quite possibly to the overall game's benefit. Not focusing much on the story means that the player can divert their attention to actually enjoying the gameplay and uniquer art style, which are the game's main points. 

I have but two overarching criticisms of this version, however: First of all, the implementaion of the uPlay DRM system, even on the Steam version, which is unnecessary and cumbersome. Second: This game was clearly meant for the Wii U, a fact that shows as you play the game. I thought that maybe the Wii U's features would transfer more easily to the PC, but unfortunately Ubisoft didn't really take advantage of the keyboard ands mouse in the same way they took advantage of the Wii U's gamepad. Actions formerly performed by the player themselves as Murfy on the Touch Pad are now performed with a single touch of a button on the controller, which if you ask me is a bit of a missed opportunity. 

To summarise, despite clearly being designed for the Wii U, Rayman Legends is the best anyone could ask from a platforming game. It's challenging, it has funny characters, enjoyable levels, it doesn't focus too much on the plot, and most importantly - It will keep you entertained for a VERY long time. Yes, it can get very, VERY difficult, but as you play it, you realise that that's the whole point: Trial and error, improving with every failed attempt, slowly but surely perfecting your strategy. And it's exactly that that makes Rayman Legends special.

14907222.review:
From what i've played so far, the game is really fun. Though, there are quite a few sections in the game where (assuming you're using an Xbox controller) you have to press Y to control a fairy guy to activate obsticles on the course, and it's a little obvious it was made for the WiiU's gamepad. It's a better transition then you think it would be, but it really ruins the pasing in my opinion, the flow is almost completely ruined in those levels. (Update: It's worked in a lot more levels, but in quite a few he could definitally been left out) That, and the added punishment for people who actually bought the game, and no one else, which is known as "Uplay" (A DRM service for ubisoft games as an anti-piracy method) is also used for the game. Multiple people have reported Uplay crashes when attempting to boot up the game, and they have also reported stolen gamekeys, so Uplay doesn't think you actually bought the game when you did, and the customer service is reluctant to help. So be cautious with the software. Currently, i'm unable to get cards and steam acheivements because of Uplay, so that's a bummer. Probably won't go for that completionist because of it. (just saying, Uplay is basically gunlaws for piracy, the only people you're punishing is the honest.)
But, with the game's amazing art, controls, gameplay, music, and even a large collection of levels from Rayman Origins, it's definitally worth getting on sale, just in case Uplay does fuck you over. Otherwise, i'd maybe even spend the 40 if you're a platformer or rayman fan. And it's easy to see that Ubiart put a lot of care into the game, they even added lore for pallet swaps. Reccomended.

Edit: forgot to mention the lack of online multiplayer, because "You can't punch people over the internet."
Ubi pls no.

I can't belive that i didnt picked this game earlier up.
One of my steam friend bought it for me, i can't thank him enough.

I'm now currently at World 4-2. So far everything that i saw was absolutly fun, cool and i could play these levels over and over, just because they are so goddamn awesome.

One thing that this game makes it so cool is the fact of the humorous and jokes this game has to offer. Want to play as a duck? Wanna see a random giant wrestling guy falling from top to bottom just you can go on? Or do you just want to hear a plant singing by slapping his eye?
Then this game should give you a good laugh.

Gameplay: Nothing here changed since Origins, which i also played too (Wiii Version). I feel like Legends is easier then Origins. I had my problems getting progress in the previous game, probably because i was back there a child which had nothing better to do. Also, the levels from Legends are in my option better, but it's also cool to see that you can play the previous levels from Origins, i really like that.
Bosses that i had to beat were top. My favourite one HAS to be the 3rd boss.

The biggest feature are the music levels. Diffirent covers from songs, like from Black Mary, Eye of the Tiger and so on. I NEVER had so much fun playing these Music Levels. They are completly new and fresh also. if some DLC's were avalible, i would defendly try them out. Also Castle Rack has to be the best one.

Soundtracks: Some soundtrack from Origins were re-used, but that doesnt matter. The soundtrack is often outstanding, is fitting really good in the currently situation you are in. I was imaging i were in a mission impossible in World 4-1, damn that was perfectly. 

Challenge: I never had the experience yet to be in a trial and error section. Otherwise, the game isnt too easy, and isnt too hard.  Mixing the difficulty perfect together makes an awesome game experience.

Overall, this game is it money worth. Buy it now if you can!  Trust me! You will never have more fun then playing this!
10/10

14901022.review: Bereits nach ungefähr 2 Stunden Spielzeit möchte ich mich hier zu Rayman Legends äußern und meine Eindrücke schildern. Denn es brennt mir stark auf der Zunge, allen Lesern dieses Reviews zu sagen, dass ihr euch dieses Spiel kaufen solltet. Nirgendwo sonst, habe ich bisher ein Jump 'n Run mit so viel Liebe und Charme spielen dürfen. Das Leveldesign ist farbenfroh und abwechslungsreich gestaltet. Die Musik überbietet alles, was ich bisher in anderen Spielen dieses Genres gehört habe und perfektioniert das Gesamtbild, welches ich mir in relativ kurzer Zeit machen konnte. Die Entwickler haben in dieses Spiel ihr ganzes Herzblut gesetzt, das spürt man bereits beim Spielen das ersten Levels. Nachdem Rayman Origins als Vorgänger für mich auf einer Heimkonsole bereits geglänzt hatte, macht diese Fortsetzung einfach alles noch besser. So ziemlich jedes Level hatte für mich bereits einen Grund, es erneut zu spielen, da man versucht alle Geheimnisse und Extras zu finden. Und Motivation dafür findet man reichlich, denn die traumhafte Musik und die Struktur der Levels sind so genial und einfallsreich sowie individuell, dass es nie langweilig wird. Für mich steht dieses Spiel weit über dem Niveau eines typischen Super Marios, hier spürt man, was es heißt ein mit Liebe gestaltetes Meisterwerk vor sich zu sehen. Ob es nun die vielen verschiedenen wöchentlichen Herausforderungen oder die kleinen Goodies wie Gallerien mit spielbaren Leveln aus dem Vorgänger oder die vielen verschiedenen Charaktere sind, die allesamt nach dem gleichen Prinzip funktionieren, sich aber in Aussehen und Gestaltung äußerst unterscheiden, die Vielfalt dieses Platformers weckt Lust auf mehr, man schließt einen Level ab und will am liebsten direkt den nächsten starten, denn die Kunst, die man hier vermittelt bekommt, zieht den Spieler in seinen Bann und es dauert nicht lang bis man die Zeit aus den Augen verliert und zu sich sagt 'ach, ein Level noch!'. Der Schwierigkeitsgrad ist perfekt fordernd, an manchen Passagen scheitert man desöfteren, aber das schnelle System von Versagen und Respawnen in unmittelbarer Nähe, lassen einen nie die Motivation verlieren. Im Großen und Ganzen macht dieses Spiel all das besser, was man an heutigen Jump 'n Runs zu bemängeln hat und gilt für mich als großartige Kunst, die ich in meiner Lebenserfahrung als Gamer sicherlich nicht vergessen werde. Wer Rayman Legends nicht spielt, hat eine wahre Spiele-Legende hinter sich gelassen. Ein vollkommener Must-Have!

14877552.review:
Si bien el genero de plataformas siempre nos ha brindado momentos divertidos desde hace años lo cierto es que no suelen ser desafiantes para los jugadores Hardcore, mas bien la mayoría de ellos se enfocan hacia los jugadores casuales, brindando unas aventuras cortas, fáciles de completar y divertidas.

Sin enbargo, Ubisoft ha logrado desde los años 90, traernos una franquicia muy que divierte en ambas audiencia. Rayman Legends, la secuela del magnifico Rayman Origins, es un juego que nos ofrece diversión, desafios y unos niveles de los mas coloridos y vivos de este genero. ¿Asi es que, vale la pena hacerse con el? Enseguida lo descubriremos.

La historia de estos juegos suele ser muy simples ya que en este género lo que realmente importa es su jugabilidad. Sin embargo les platicaré brevemente de lo que va. Un día cualquiera, El Claro de los Sueños ha sido nuevamente invadido mientras nuestros héroes dormían, las criaturas “pesadillas” han secuestrado a los “diminutos” y debemos aventurarnos a distintos universos mediante el uso de los cuadros de pintura. Historia simple pero muy efectivo y divertido. 

En cuanto a su jugabilidad, esta entrega ha mejorado bastante en los diseños de los niveles y su curva de dificultad, ofrecen muchos tipos de niveles y la novedad de todas, los niveles músicales donde nuestro timming al realizar los saltos y golpes tienen que ser perfectos para seguir. Si bien el juego no es tan complicado de completar, si que te llevará tiempo el completarlo al 100%. Además al final de cada mundo, enfrentaremos a los Jefes Finales, donde tendremos que aprender sus patrones para poder vencerles, algunos de ellos son algo más complicados de detectar que otros pero tampoco son muy difíciles. 

En cada nivel tendremos que encontrar “Lums” y “Diminutos”, en la cual, los primeros nos servirá para desbloquear tickets de lotería los cuales nos pueden recompensar con más lums, diminutos o incluso niveles secretos. En cuanto a los “diminutos” los necesitaremos para seguir avanzando en la aventura, ya que tendremos que disponer de cierta cantidad de “diminutos” rescatados para desbloquear más niveles. No son tan complicados de encontrar si estas acostumbrado a explorar los niveles antes de terminarlo, claro que esto no lo hacen todas las personas y está bien, cada quien tiene su estilo.

Pero esto no es todo lo que nos ofrece el título, han introducido un sistema de “invasiones” en las cuales volveremos a pasar los niveles en un modo donde enfrentaremos a Rayman Oscuro, un personaje que va a imitar todos nuestros recorridos y si nos alcanza, tendremos que repetir el nivel. 

Por si esto no fuese suficiente, también tendremos una modalidad online, donde se publicaran retos comunitarios cada día, cada semana y cada mes, lo cual aumentará mucho el contenido jugable del título. 
El humor no puede faltar en la franquicia de Rayman, Ubisoft lo ha hecho muy bien desde el principio y se nota que ha mimado bastante a Rayman Legends.

Otro añadido es que mantiene el modo cooperativo de Rayman Origins, donde 4 amigos podrán disfrutar de la aventura o pueden jugar ambos en un minijuego de futbol, ustedes elijen.

En cuanto a los gráficos el título goza de acabados que da gusto para nuestros ojos, con paletas de colores muy llamativas, gracias al motor que utiliza el juego, el conocido “Ubi-Art”, que ha permitido crear objetos en tres dimensiones y a la vez manteniendo la dinámica del juego en dos dimensiones. Lo que esto trae ante nuestros ojos es que los decorados tienen mayor profundidad, mejor iluminación y por supuesto, los Jefes descomunales a los que enfrentaremos.

La música ha sido desde siempre uno de los factores importantes en la franquicia y Ubisoft lo sabe muy bien, que nos dan increíbles piezas musicales épicas y a la vez piezas musicales con mucho humor que da un disfrute el escucharlo mientras juegas. 

Rayman vuelve en una que podría ser la mejor aventura que tenemos de la franquicia hasta la fecha, tenemos una calidad visual muy llamativa, música que nos hará disfrutar de los mejores momentos en el juego, cooperativo, retos, coleccionables, niveles secretos, Jefes Finales, niveles musicales, humor y diversión. En fin, un título de gran calidad la cual les recomiendo bastante que lo prueben.

14768605.review:
This game is pretty great. If you liked Rayman:Origins, you'll like this one. If you don't have Origins, you don't really need to buy it, since this game contains almost every one of the origins levels as bonus levels. It's a great idea, and they're fun to revisit. 

If you like fun, cheerful platformers with good music, good controls, and a good difficulty curve, you'll really like this game. 

However, unless you really enjoy pain, I'd recommend finishing the main levels and quitting. 
By the time I realized that was what I should have done, I was close enough to 100% that I just soldiered through, but it really left a sour taste in my mouth in places. 
One of the best parts of Rayman:Origins for me was how the difficulty ramped up through the whole game, culminating in the Land of the Livid Dead. Those levels were monsters, but practice and a bit of luck would see you through, and [b]man[/b] did I feel accomplished when I beat them. You needed every single trick you'd picked up in the game, and maybe a few more, but they weren't unfair, just brutal. 
Rayman:Legends on the other hand, has a land of the livid dead that's not new, it's not interesting, it's just selected levels you've already beaten with hideous graphical filters over them. Pixelating them, adding pulsing static and other visual noise, oh, and removing the checkpoints. Two of them gave me hideous headaches. 
Just for that alone, I'd have to say Origins is the stronger game. 
Legends also adds a whole bunch of timed mini levels, some of which can take dozens of runs if you're trying to rescue all of the smurfs that have been captured. Some of them are a nice break, but having so many of them makes the magic run dry very quickly. 

I'd also like to know why there are ~40 unlockable playable characters when there aren't appreciable differences between them. Not sure what the point there is. 

Anyway, overall, this game is in places good, even great, but for completests, it's a bit of a kick below the belt in the places it should really shine. I recommend it, but with the caveats mentioned.

14690523.review:
Context:
Well polished and rich game, reminds me of the rich, unique, original and well polished work that used to come out more often in the past, caring so much about the finer details that make a game a universe of its own. 
Considering how the CoD and AC series were initially at a such high level of quality, especially the first releases but later declined with every sequel. It is therefore a surprise how Ubisoft with its overall declining quality, managed to produce such a great quality work with this one. Could this mean the same for its other series? Only time will tell, since as Ubisoft has shown here, it's never too late to get back on track.

Some snippets from the game itself: 
+This game as many others have mentioned, is suitable for all ages and is great for gathering friends and family in playing such a fun game cooperatively or competitively.
+Every level is unique on its own, giving a different flow, challenges and experience to every level, this is one of the major factors that make the game so replayable.
+Small details regarding playable and non-playable characters in their movements and reactions to the envirnoment, which are so well made that not only do they truly give an impression of the personality of the character, but aids in making the gameplay experience so fluid.
+Manages to instill an actual sense of achievement, versus a ton of modern games that reward 'achievements' without the actual sense

Minor negatives:
-Requires Uplay which constantly and forever will have sync issues with achievements or saved games. (I never needed to backup saves for Rayman, but for AC:Unity and Sleeping Dogs, which overwrote my progress, I needed to backup my saves constantly mid-game)
-Only local Coop +Counter: However this encourages getting actual persons to play with you in the same room, which enriches the experience. Also, there is an online score ladder, with other player's ghosts to compete with in the weekly/daily online competitions.

Rating: 9/10

14521967.review:
Ich habe Rayman Origins gespielt und das auch gerne. 
Dann hatte ich aufgrund eines Sales mir Rayman Legends gekauft und ausprobiert. Seitdem habe ich Rayman Origins nicht mehr gespielt, weil Rayman Legends so ziemlich alles besser macht.
Die Level sind kreativer, die Grafik ist schöner, der Kader ist größer die erspielbaren Extras -  wie kleine "Pets", Figuren, Extra Levels, sowiel alte Origin Levels - sind mehr und schließlich gibt es noch die Musiklevels, die alles toppen.
Wenn diesem nicht schon genug wäre, hilft Ubisoft noch mit sogenannten "täglichen" und "wöchentlichen" Herausforderungen nach. Diese sind zwar auf ihre Art und Weise immer wieder gleich, aber das Gefühl gegenüber anderen Spielern einen Silber oder gar Goldpokal erspielt zu haben ist nicht nur angenehm, sondern fordert immer wieder neu heraus, seine eigene Bestzeit noch etwas zu toppen.
Leider gibt es wohl hier auch ein paar "Cheater", die es irgendwie schaffen in einem Level ein paar Kilometer zu laufen, oder in unter einer Sekunde am Ziel zu sein, was das Level gar nicht hergeben kann, aber das stört mich nicht weiter.
Für jeden, der gerne Jump and Runs, bzw. Plattformspiele mag, dazu einen leicht schrulligen Humor, eine einfacher Steuerung und guter Musik, ist bei diesem Spiel bestens aufgehoben.

14316774.review:
Один из лучших платформеров, которые я видел за последнее время. Под казалось бы детской графикой скрывается не по детски интересная игра.
 Последние уровни в каждой локации просто шедевры левел-дизайна, напоминают своего рода мюзиклы, генерируемые от части действиями пользователя, и построенные для проходжения без остановки персонажа. 
 Весьма радуют отсылки, например к Splinter Sell и фильмам Kill Bill. Присутствуют левелы в стиле Super Meat Boy, которые заставляют попотеть, а также уровни которые можно проходить размеренно, чтобы расслабиться в промежутках между быстрыми и динамичными уровнями.
Прекрасный саундрек. На геймпаде играть гораздо удобней. Наличие кооперативного режима.
 Правда минус, который бросается в глаза это довольно однообразные в прохождении боссы под конец локаций.
 Кроме PC версии играл также в версию для PS Vita, где адаптация управления под тач-скрин и гироскоп крайне радует и еще более разноображивает геймплей, отчасти меняя механику игры.

13690601.review:
This is what sequels should be all about. Taking mechanics that worked from the first title and buffing them to a mirror finish, and then introducing new ideas to make it original. 

For me, Origins was a really, really fun and solid game and a great return to form for the Rayman franchise. I've sunk many hours (three digits) into it and, despite not being the completionist type, have been pushed to try quite hard to do so by it's captivating art and great soundtrack, plus pile of content. With Legends, Ubisoft has managed to recreate this gem, but better. It's as simple as that.

The UbiArt engine is slick at all times and always stable, the game is even prettier then the first and, somehow, even more tuneful. I haven't anything to complain about yet, except perhaps that it's not occasionally as brutal as Origins in spots, but there's always plenty more in the game, and I haven't even mentioned the online challenges yet where the player competes against a global leaderboard.

If you like platformers, you'll probably love this game. It's fast, it's competitive and is sensibly integrated into online challenges, and doesn't suffer very much from being originally WiiU exclusive. It's my favorite game of 2013 (previously a title given to Revengeance), and a perfect 10 in my books.

I do recommend picking up Origins before this one if you're a newcomer to the franchise, though. You will simply be missing out otherwise and it has come down drastically in price.

13535825.review:
“O herói mais famoso na Inglaterra retorna ao Brasil se tornando um sinônimo no quesito plataforma.”

Sim é ele, o mais louco personagem, o herói menos improvável aquele que dá socos e pontapés sem ao menos ter braços ou pernas, direto da terra dos sonhos lhes apresento o fabuloso e novíssimo Rayman.

Lançado em 2013 pela Ubisoft Rayman Legends veio com a missão de apresentar coisas novas e superar o seu antecessor que foi muito bem aclamado pela crítica, e ele conseguiu. Rayman Legends inovou em muitos quesitos tornando um jogo muito completo para garantir a sua diversão e de toda a sua família.

Para começar vamos ao modo de jogo principal do Rayman que é o aventura. Nesse novo game você conta com diversas fases no qual estão representadas em quadros de pinturas, essas fases estão bem mais divertidas e desafiadoras e com estilos totalmente diferente de umas para as outras. Logo que se inicia o game podemos perceber algumas mudanças em relação ao seu título anterior. A primeira delas é a mudança de seus objetivos na fase pois agora você deve explorar a fase e libertar todos os teensies que foram presos pelas criaturas do pesadelo, outra alteração foi que não existe mais o rei lumen que foi substituído pelo lumen roxo que faz com que o jogador tenha que pegá-los em um sequência para poder ganhar o dobro de lumens. Outro quesito interessante que foi adicionado são as caveiras de medição de nível que permite o jogador identificar o quão difícil a fase pode ser antes de encará-la.

Os cenários das fases são muito belos e interativos além de diferenciados de modo que nada se repete. O jogo em si ficou muito mais completo porém a falta de multiplayer online ainda é um problema que vamos encontrar no game mas ainda está disponível jogar todas as fases em modo co-op local para até quatro jogadores o que é muito divertido pois a tela fica uma confusão com tanta gente e cada fase fica ligeiramente mais complexa. Rayman legends também traz novos personagens jogáveis e novos modos de jogo como o kungfoot. A jogabilidade está mais fluida e simples no qual o jogador já tem disponível para ele todos os poderes do Rayman desde quando se inicia a primeira fase o modo aventura. O game traz muitas fases e também traz um conteúdo bônus que permite jogar as fases de seus jogos antecessores.

A trilha sonora de Rayman é a mais espetacular já vista, as músicas que acompanham cada fase são simplesmente sensacionais, para se ter ideia na fase Castle Rock a música de fundo é um rock que é totalmente interativo com a fase fazendo com que o jogador abra um sorriso sensacional por não acreditar que aquilo existe é simplesmente fantástico o trabalho sonoro que a Ubisoft fez no game.

Como nada são flores Rayman possui um problema muito chato que nem a própria Ubisoft sabe explicar. O que ocorre nesse problema é que o jogo fica lento mais não porque uma máquina não atinge aos requisitos mais simplesmente apenas o personagem fica lento, isso pode não parecer um problema mas nas fases de velocidade é que vemos como isso pode ser chato. Esse problema é o que tirou do Rayman a “bola de ouro” pois algumas vezes chega a irritar afinal mesmo se mudarmos as configurações nada é capaz de resolver o problema.

Rayman legends inovou os jogos de plataforma com vários modos novos de jogo, novos personagens e uma trilha sonora impecável é um grande pedido para as férias mesmo com o problema da lentidão em certos momentos. O co-op para 4 pessoas funciona de forma significativa e permite uma diversão familiar gigantesca então não perca tempo chame os amigos compre refrigerantes e salgadinhos e faça garanta um dia inteiro de risada e diversão.

13496519.review:
Une petite perle de la plateforme dont il serait plus que dommage de passer outre, tant la qualité proposé est grande.
Les niveaux sont variés et tous incroyablement funs, et on s'étonne à enfin apprécier un niveau sous l'eau dans un jeu de plateforme, chose que Mario n'aura jamais réussi à cracher après plusieurs dizaines d'années à tenter désespérement. 
Les compositions musicales sont grandioses, variés, et l'un des points fort du jeu sont les niveaux musicaux, prévus pour être synchronisés avec une musique populaire, remixé façon Rayman (Black Betty, Eye of the tiger et beaucoup d'autres), ce qui aboutit à un résultat absolument génial, on s'étonne à refaire plusieurs fois ces niveaux tant ils sont sympathiques.

Il vous est de plus proposé de rejouer à certains levels de Rayman Origins, moins dur certes, mais bien plus agréable à parcourir, et bénéficiant à leur tour de très nombreuses améliorations (graphiques entre autre). 
J'aimerais d'ailleurs revenir sur les points qui font de Rayman Legends une suite globalement plus aboutie qu'Origins. Selon moi, Rayman Legends est moins difficile qu'Origins sur bien des points, mais est-ce vraiment quelque chose de négatif ? 
Absolument pas, car Legends vire les points les plus frustrants en conservant le vrai challenge des niveaux. Je m'explique :
1) Dans Origins, les ennemis que vous tuez se transforme en bulle, et vous devez par la suite brisez cette bulle pour gagner quelque lums supplémentaires. Cette idée brise absolument toute la vitesse et la fluidité dans la progression, car pour atteindre le maximum de lums, il faut souvent s'arrêter et casser les bulles. Ca n'a l'air de rien comme ça, mais le simple fait d'enlever cet élément de gameplay permet de dynamiser énormément les levels de Legends, en ne les rendant pas moins dur, mais plus fluide et agréable.

2) Il existait un système de combo dans Origins lorsque vous attrapiez un roi des lums, vous obligeant à vous dépêcher pour attraper un maximum de lums avant que la musique ne finisse. Cet élément de gameplay était extrêmement contraignant, et c'était tout l'inverse du premier point : on vous impose un rythme, non pas en vous freinant, mais en vous obligeant à vous dépêcher, et c'est extrêmement frustrant.

Dans Legends, ces problèmes n'existent plus, et croyez le ou non, des petits changements comme ceux-ci changent totalement la donne. Certes le jeu est plus facile (par moment, il y a encore une bonne dose de challenge dans Legends), mais l'expérience en est tellement bonifié au final que Legends est incontestablement le meilleur des deux jeux.

Si Rayman Legends n'est peut-être pas le meilleur jeu de plateforme de tout les temps pour certains,  il n'en demeure pas moins le meilleur jeu de plateforme 2D de cette génération, sans aucune contestation possible. Le prix (30 euros, 20 euros en solde actuellement) peut donc paraître excessif pour un simple jeu de plateforme, il n'en est rien pour l'un des meilleurs d'entre eux.

Et j'aimerais aussi revenir sur la problématique d'uplay : ce n'est pas un problème en soi et il est inacceptable de critiquer un jeu sur un élément extérieur à celui-ci car ce n'était évidemment pas une décision des équipes de développement. 
Et franchement, Ubisoft a bien amélioré le logiciel, et celui-ci est désormais largement plus stable que Steam selon moi.

13455719.review:
I have beat this game multiple times on console (don't hurt me), and I can easily say that this is one of the best platformers ever...hands down! Whenever people hear "greatest platformer ever" people always point at the original Mario games, Super Mario Galaxy, etc. However, this easily joins among their ranks. 

 This game is a breath of fresh air in the platformer genre. Along with its counterpart Rayman Origins (which I have also beat), they are both really refreshing platformer games because of their unique style, in graphics, gameplay, and level design. 

 Firstly, the game is visually stunning. The game uses an engine called the "UbiArt" engine, which is used to easily animate any image. The animations in this game are flawless given the many different movements that Rayman can use. Plus, the game feels INCREDIBLY smooth, and there are no visual flaws whatsoever. If I was to ever to die in this game, I cannot fault the game for choppy frame rate... I always blame myself!

 Speaking of which, the game has a difficulty balance that can accomodate both new players and old players. Some levels can be a breeze, but then others you can die A LOT, especially some of the later levels. 

 The level design is really good. Like most platformers, each world typically has a "theme". In my personal opinion, I believe that the "Fiesta de Los Muertos" world in Rayman Legends is the best, clearly because the level design is so great in every single level (if you play the first level at the world, you will see exactly what I mean). What a lot of platformers truly fail at achieving is creating MEMORABLE levels, and Rayman Legends has at least a few memorable levels that will be stuck in your head. Even the boss battles are really great! 

  The gameplay is also really addicting, with plenty of different moves to learn. This can range from a series of simplistic punches, all the way to cartwheels (a slightly more advanced move). While the objective is to complete a level, there is also a ranking for each level to grab a both a certain number of lums and "teensies". Lums, unlike the last game, are accumulated and can be used to unlock new variants of characters. Plus, lucky tickets unlock plenty of different things, including updated Rayman Origins levels!

   ...and the multiplayer...oh my....the multiplayer is GOLDEN!!!! This game easily has the most fun local multiplayer in a long while! The multiplayer is perfect for anybody, whether you want to play seriously or if you want to troll your friends. :)

 Another memorable part of the game, even though it is not as prominent, would be the soundtrack. The soundtrack really compliments the game in different ways, and I had a couple of tunes stuck in my head. Overall, the game can last you quite awhile, maybe about 15-20 hours to complete everything (depending on how good you are). What can also add to the length would be the daily and weekly challenges, where you can REALLY hone your skills.

 There are a few flaws, given the overall grand scheme of things, but hardly hold this game back from sheer greatness. I think that there should  have been more minigames along with "Kung Foot" because "Kung Foot" isn't necessarily my favorite part of the game. Also, I think that there are also too many "clone" characters (variants of Barbara in particular).

 To whomever might read this review, I would not even hesitate getting this game. Play it and love it! You won't regret it!

13315875.review: Overall a great game. The thing that I don't like is the menus. They are quite confusing and not user friendly.

13311860.review:
Сегодня я бы хотел переписать свою рецензию на эту игру "с нуля". Прошлая рецензия была написана на эмоциях после 40 минут игры. Теперь же я прошел её полностью и наиграл более 50 часов.

Графика выше всяких похвал. Яркая,красочная и безумно стильная. Музыка завораживает, некоторые треки частенько переслушиваю на YouTube, а каверы Eye of The Tiger и Castle Rock просто шедевральны. Геймплей очень разнообразный, а управление очень отзывчивое. Одним словом - шедевр. Но я ведь не просто так сел переписывать положительную рецензию, верно? Есть тут чайная ложка дёгтя и сейчас я вам о ней расскажу.

У меня имеются замечания по поводу ачивок,челленджей и некоторых уровней.


Уровни-вторжения.
Открываются они ближе к середине-концу прохождения. На каждом таком уровне есть 3 малютки которых нужно спасти, но не как в обычном уровне, а на время. 60,50 и 40 секунд для 1,2 и 3 малюток соответственно. Короче - забег на время с препятствиями. Претензия моя в том, что пройти менее чем за 40 секунд - это настоящий подвиг. По началу уровни не будут сложными, но последние из них просто таки ад. Я бился над ними без особого удовольствия несколько часов. Судя по ютубу - не одному мне они нервы потрепали. Не совсем вписываются в динамику остальной игры.

Уровни 8bit.
Это усложнённые версии музыкальных уровней. Открываются они под конец. Но чем же они плохи? А тем что все 100% усложнения в дикой пикселизации,вращении экрана и "помехах". Ты банально ничего не видишь когда бежишь и конечно же в самых сложных местах больше всего этих "помех". А если вы хотите спасти на них всех трёх малюток, да еще и Золотой Кубок получить, то иной раз придется десятки раз переигрывать и буквально заучивать уровень. Считаю что не нужно было вообще делать такие уровни, потому что это просто нечестно по отношению к игроку.  

Челленджи.
С самими челленджами всё в порядке, играются они в большинстве своём нормальное. Много читеров, но жить можно. Проблема в том что типов челленджей очень мало и они не мотивируют. Пробеги наибольшее расстояние; Пробеги дистанцю за наименьшее время; Собери наибольшее кол-во люмов за минуту; Набей энное кол-во люмов как можно быстрее. Вариант - сделать что-либо из этого в падении. Бывают ежедневные и еженедельные челленджи, сложность варьируется и не всегда недельный челлендж легче/сложнее.

Ачивки.
Я получил почти все. Почти. Получить все кроме двух я могу. Почему? Они требуют фарма и задротства, задротства и фарма. Первая ачивка - собрать 1'000'000 люмов. За прохождение всей игры и уровней Back to Origins я получил около 650'000 люмов, при том что я нехило так заморочился по сбору люмов на уровнях. Казалось бы, в чём проблема собрать еще 350к? Ну, чтобы это сделать есть два варианта - сотни раз перепроходить уровни, либо наяривать челленджи. По моим подсчетам, с челленжами уйдет около 2-3 месяцев в зависимости от усидчивости. 3 месяца фармить люмы? Ради ачивки? Это без меня. Вторая ачивка связана с Крутизной и челленджами. Максимальный уровень крутизны - 11. Я кое-как набрал 10 уровень, а для 11 нужно... верно! Фармить. И не меньше, а то и больше по времени чем люмы. Очки крутизны дают за кубки в этих самых челленджах, а бриллиантовые вам не дадут получить читеры. Золотыми же будете набирать в день по чайной ложке. Проще говоря - эти две ачивки не стоят времени нужного для их получения.


Ну и ко-оп есть только локальный. Смотрел его на ютубе - весьма посредственно. Впечатление от игры все эти недостатки не портят, но они есть.

По прежнему рекомендую поиграть всем и каждому. Посадите детей,маму,бабушку,кота и играйте. Массу удовольствия гарантирую! 

10/10 - ШЕДЕВР!

13303016.review:
[b]Overall, I give this game a B-.  Noteworthy for strong platforming and aesthetics.  Very weak on plot, legacy, and characters.[/b]


Very fun platformer, for sure.  Difficulty starts low but it ramps up as it goes, and the game feels challenging yet rewarding.  This is at its core, a platformer, though.  Don't expect much from combat and don't expect much from the boss fights.  The platforming itself is spot on, and arguably the game's best strength is its music levels (watch some videos to see yourself).  The visuals are breathtaking and just in style with Rayman, and the soundwork is equally top tier.  [b]The platforming, art, and sound all definitely feel like Rayman, alright.  I give these an A.[/b]


HOWEVER


While this game looks, sounds, and plays like Rayman, thats as far as it goes.  If you are looking for a Rayman nostalgia trip, I wouldn't exactly say this is it.  Beyond what I mention above, this game holds little in common with its predessesors.  First off, Rayman Legends fails to live up to the tones of the previous games.  The trademark "grimdark hidden by a humorous and groovy world full of adventure and mystery" has been thrown out in favor of a completely light hearted and juvenile tone, but somehow isn't even big on the humor from previous games to make up for it.  Rayman Legends is as it implies; its all about adventure, mystery, and exploration, so it manages to keep those at least.  Its not about saving the world or laughing your ass off, its about running through various locations while you beat up random monsters that happen to find themselves in your way.  You won't feel much for the characters and they won't inspire you to feel much yourself.  Every character is a cookie cutter of the last; they offer no unique expressions or unique performance.  Rayman won't be offering his snarky comments and you won't get the comic relief you expect from Globox or the Teensies.  Villians from previous games do not make appereances.  None of the additional characters have anything to offer rather than a sentence of flavor text and are cookie cutter skins, and feel quite out of place given the Rayman universe.  Nobody even SAYS anything to characterize them or add any semblance of a plot.  The most plot you get is the order in which you play the levels and the progression between them.  [b]I give the game's legacy, characters, and plot a D.[/b]  Note this game is still quite good, but its sad given that this game is literally half of Rayman; Rayman was known for its superior universe / tone AND its gameplay.


Legends and Origins are supposed to be prequels to the 3D games, but since there is no dialogue or plot its highly arguable that this is a completely standalone title.  This dissappointed me quite a bit, since the game's sells itself as Rayman's "origins" and "legend."  Please keep that in mind when purchasing this product.


Also if you are eyeing Origins, don't bother since this game includes Origins.


Another thing that might really get on your nerves is that because of the game's target audience, there are a bunch of really dumb minigames that the game is constantly shoving in your face, such as the Monster Room or the Lucky Ticket game.  In fact, in order to even play the Origins half of the game you must play that minigame around 100 times.


[b]Overall, I give this game a B-.  Noteworthy for strong platforming and aesthetics.  Very weak on plot, legacy, and characters.[/b]

13295610.review:
I have always been fascinated by the Rayman series because of the good graphics, but I never liked the games very much and never related in any way to the main character. However, giving this newest part of the series a chance was a very rewarding decision. The developers did nearly everything right in my opinion:

gameplay - just great, you have perfect control over the character and a lot of different moves, in part depending on your environment 

amount of content - the game is really exemplary in this respect: multiple playable characters, a huge amount of levels and additional daily and weekly mini challenges that remodel certain areas 

difficulty - even though challenging at times, the game always seems to be fair and does not lead to a lot of frustration (and I played all the locked and hidden levels)

design - the graphics are beautiful, especially the vegetation and the sci-fi stuff. the level design is very good and keeps you entertained with varying design elements and a lot of funny and crazy ideas

sound - the sound effects and most of the music is great and original, sometimes very atmospheric, more often very funny. some of the tracks could have been better suited to underline the atmosphere of certain areas. the music-themed levels (in which your movements have to be in line with the music) are awesome in general, as is the music for the underwater levels  

In sum, I can really recommend this game to everyone who likes to play platformers. Even If you only like some of the platformer classics, but stopped playing that type of game for a long time - you probably should give this game a try :)

[fanboy mode off]

13142870.review: Man merkt an allen Ecken und Enden, dass hier Entwickler mit viel Leidenschaft für klassische Jump-n-Runs am Werk waren. Ob nun das traumhafte Design, die albernen Animationen, der große Umfang oder die coolen Musik-Levels: Das Spiel sprüht förmlich vor Abwechslung und guter Laune. Auch die lange Entwicklungszeit hat dem Spiel offenbar gut getan. Die Abschnitte sind bemerkenswert gut ausbalanciert – frustige Bosskämpfe oder Fluchtsequenzen tauchen diesmal nicht auf. Trotzdem gibt es jede Menge knallharte Herausforderungen für Profis. Schade, dass alle Figuren lediglich ein überschaubares Repertoire gleicher Fähigkeiten besitzen – und dass es keinen Online-Koop gibt. Davon abgesehen gibt es aber kaum etwas zu kritisieren. Rayman Legends baut zwar lediglich auf einem altbekannten Spielprinzip auf, perfektioniert dieses aber auf eindrucksvolle Weise!

12798919.review:
В моей памяти Rayman всегда ассоциировался с 3д платформером на манер The Great Escape и я считал его довольно мертвым франчайзом, особенно в момент когда Ubisoft начала узурпировать тему Raving Rabbids. Каково было мое удивление, когда узнал, что каждый год выходит какой-нибудь Рэйман или его ремейк.

Особенное удивление принесли Origins и Legends. Которые вернули серию к корням 2д платформера. С этой стороны возникает интересный нюанс, сейчас когда у данного жанра слишком богатая история, создающая сложности в инновациях, в цену вступает хороший левел-дизайн и эстетика.

Этим и славился Мишель Ансель, создатель оригинального Рэймана, который многим более известен за разработку Beyond Good & Evil. Старые части получили очень много хвалебной критики за умные элементы дизайна, сложные уровни, анимацию и музыку.

Rayman Legends воплощает эти аспекты сполна. Во-первых весь дизайн уровней подкреплен "ритмом". Ритм, в данном случае, это сочетание визуальных, звуковых, собирательных и боевых элементов. Которые выстраивается в окружении так, что создают в голове игрока множество интуитивных подсказок как действовать отбрасывая все вопросы "что делать". В итоге уровни проносится на одном дыхании.

Во вторых каждый набор уровней имеет свои тематические механики, будь то повороты уровня, обилие передвигаемых элементов, соревнования на скорость или даже стелс уровни. Большое разнообразие так-же добавляют элементы паззлов и веселые музыкальные уровни.

В третьих, в игре удачно реализован кооперативный режим. Он облегчает игру, добавляя оживление игрока и упрощение некоторых задач. Но в то же время он построен на принципах Battletoads, где каждый удар или неверное движение напарников конкретно ломает прохождение и делает игру еще сложнее. В итоге соблюдается баланс этих элементов и игра становится только веселее.

Еще один интересный нюанс, что первый Рэйман в свое время время получил несколько наград за анимацию и звук. И вот Оригинс в свое время стала первой игрой реализованной на UbiArt фреймворке, который специально рассчитан на более мелкие, но эстетически ориентированные игры (Более поздние примеры Valiant Hearts и Child of Light). Это приправлено отличным саундтреком, который хорошо вписан в геймплей. И даже есть некоторые уровни которые целиком построены на аранжировках известных хитов.

В итоге мы имеем простой, но красивый платформер, который неимоверно затягивает. И хоть Legends в построении уровней будет немного проще чем Origins, оно гарантирует боль в пальцах к концу игры. Даже не смотря на то, что замечаешь повторяющийся саундтрек и понимаешь, что вся сложность заключается лишь в своевременной реакции и запоминании уровня, оторваться от игры становится все сложнее и сложнее. 

Ну и да, в игре очень много женщин-варваров с топорами на любой вкус, разве это не прекрасно?

Lo que más destaco del juego es su apartado artístico, luce un estilo bonito y personal, haciendo uso del ''Ubiart Engine''. Déspues de la cagada que fueron los juegos de Rayman junto a los ''rabbids'', realmente da gusto que tanto ''Rayman Origins'' como ''Rayman Legends'' hayan vuelto a llevar a Rayman al sitio que se merece.

12400478.review:
Mario ain't got nothing on Rayman Legends. Slamming music, tight controls, eye-bleedingly astounding art direction, 4 player-same-screen-co-op on PC. Show up for the charm and amazing aesthetics. Stay for the super-hard-core platforming action. RESCUE ALL THE TEENSIES!

Hands down one of the most finely crafted platformers I've ever come across. You owe it to yourself to check out Rayman Legends. Just make sure to rebind Murphy's context button. It's horribly placed. =D

However, there's a pretty big asterisk to this review: Like most Ubisoft games, this game requres you to maintain a Ubisoft Uplay account in order to run the game. I don't care, personally, but a lot of people are turned off by draconian DRM measures that Ubi has put in place. Making matters even more confusing, Ubi is evolving Uplay into its own digital distribution platform ala Steam. So it's like Steam-ception. It's a Steam within a Steam, albiet a Steam that is geared towards Ubi's publisher proclivities. So, to recap, you have to download a digitial distribution service through your digital distribution service in order to play the game. Like I said, doesn't bother me, but I know it sure as hell bothers a lot of people.

12370151.review:
Almost everything about this game, when it comes to platforming terms is perfect. The graphics and gameplay was something to look at, and had a shorter delay time than what Gabe Newell had mistaken to be lunch: Half Life 2 episode 3. Ubisoft outdid themselves once again for making another great recovery from that raving rabbids horror show, that nearly destroyed rayman. However, that logging in to ubisoft garbage was quite annoying and have made access a little more complicated...(especially the blasted updating)

Think back to the other Rayman greats like Rayman 3: The Hoodlum Havoc or Rayman M. You HAVE the disc, you GOT the disc! You can do anything with it. Except using it as toliet paper like I do with any disc that has Call of Duty in it. This game's whimsical structure was quite charming, but could have had bosses that actually connects to the story and maybe not always giants. And an actual final boss next time. 9/10

Πολύ όμορφος σχεδιασμός, πολυχρωμοι κόσμοι, ωραία μουσική, σχετικά εύκολο στον χειρισμό με το πληκτρολόγιο. Μεγάλο σε διάρκεια και με πάρα πολλές πίστες.
Σαν να παίζεις σε διαδραστικό κόμικ.
Επίσης, περιέχει καθημερινές αναμετρήσεις σε διαφορετικές πίστες και παγκόσμιο πίνακα στατιστικών, ενώ έχει και πίστες για αποκλειστικά ομαδικά παιχνίδια για παραπάνω παίχτες.

Αυτό που μου τη σπάει, είναι ότι χρειάζεται το Uplay για να παίξει (κάτι σαν πλατφόρμα Steam, Origin κτλ, αλλά για παιχνίδια της Ubisoft). Έλεος με τις Steam-wannabe πλατφόρμες, που για να παίξεις ένα παιχνίδι, πρέπει να φτιάχνεις λογαριασμούς, να είσαι συνδεδεμένος και να φορτώνεις ένα σωρό επιπλέον σαβούρα για να παίξεις. Τουλάχιστον το uplay δεν είναι τόσο απάλευτο όσο το Origin.
Ακόμα, κάτι που προσωπικά μου είναι αδιάφορο, συνδέεται η πρόοδος του παιχνιδιού με τον λογαριασμό σου στο Uplay και ξεκλειδώνει achievements κι άλλα δώρα.

It adds a lot new levels and a new gameplay mechanic in which every few levels there's a little fairy dude who you can press a button and he'll bop an enemy or open a passage to help you through the level. It has a lot of recycled levels from Rayman Origins, but for some reason they didn't recycle my favorite world, The Land of the Livid Dead, or give us anything in comparison. There's online leaderboards for bragging rights and to help you collect Lums but there's no way Ubisoft is going to convince me to collect 1,000,000 of those guys just to prove to the world that I can. I'm not keen on time trial levels either so once I beat the game and the Living Dead Party world I just dropped the game, I didn't 100% it like I did with Rayman Origins.

Four out of five Lennys

It's hard to put Rayman Legends into words, but know this - if you like games that can be summed up with 'fun' and '2D plattformer' then Rayman Legends is for you. It doesn't really offer a story, but what it does offer is a charming, beautifully drawn world with memorable character designs and an innocent sense of humour. It's got local coop, by the way, which usually doubles the fun if you can get someone to play it with you.

12206906.review: One of the best 2D platformers to date. The main levels aren't as good as Origins in my opinion, but the online challenges make up for it. Outstanding level design, gameplay and soundtrack.

12200458.review:
A beautifully rendered platformer, with an exquisite soundtrack, and exciting worlds, challenging single-player, baffling co-op... typical Rayman awesomeness. It refines the way Rayman Origins handled, resulting in a much more satisfying game to play than the occasionally slippery original. Honestly, there's little to criticize - Rayman, as a series, has an infectious optimism and joy, and Rayman Legends has it in spades; the music, characters, collectables - everything contributes to an atmosphere of happiness and fun. The only problem is that it's a game developed for the Wii U. And, nothing against the Wii U, the unique control system that influenced a lot gimmicky levels in this installment does not translate well to PC. Neither does Ubisoft's proprietary Uplay system, which is insultingly tacked on and is required to be open to play. 

Rayman Legends is, thankfully, a game awesome enough to overcome being a Wii U ex-pat and a Uplay software. Any other project would likely be irrepairably tarnished for it.

12081505.review:
Rayman Origins nous baladait dans les grands classiques du jeu de plates-formes en nous faisant visiter autant de mondes et de couleurs dominantes qu'il y a de cartouches Pokémon, du vert jungle, rouge volcan, blanc glaces et jaune plage. (Légèrement) moins foutoir, Legends préfère ne pas trop s'éloigner de son thème médiéval sans pour autant s'y limiter, céder son incohérence à la raison et ainsi renier les plaisirs du n'importe-quoi. [i]Jamais de la vie[/i].

On passe moins du coq à l'âne mais l'allure des environnements reste plurielle ; c'est un plaisir que de les traverser. D'autant que jeu est d'une beauté à s'en arracher les yeux de malheur : on sombre en dépression à l'instant où l'on pose le regard sur Rayman Legends. Parce qu'on comprend qu'un jour il faudra bien quitter l'écran et tourner la tête pour un truc qui paraît si fade en comparaison, genre Jessica Alba nue. Ou alors on peut toujours se la donner à la coréenne, à la dure, et jouer jusqu'à mourir sans s'alimenter pour ne pas avoir à éloigner ses pupilles de la télé. Oui, Legends est encore plus beau qu'Origins. De dingue. Les boss, qui étaient le point faible visuel de l'opus précédent, sont désormais modélisés en 3D et apportent de la profondeur à des affrontements simples mais spectaculaires. Cligner des yeux est une offense, une perte de temps que l'on pourrait passer à contempler les différents tableaux du jeu, un gâchis au point que je ne lance jamais une partie de Rayman Legends sans scotch pour me maintenir les yeux ouverts façon Orange Mécanique.

Côté gameplay, on retrouve les sensations et la formule d'Origins, à quelques changements près. On ne cherche plus à délivrer des smarties roses mais des ptizètres planqués aux quatre coins des niveaux. Les contre-la-montre se jouent maintenant sur des parcelles de niveau repensées pour une épreuve de course. Les chasses aux [i]coffres-à-pattes[/i] ont été remplacées par des séquences musicales démentes héritières des niveaux funky de Rayman 3 ou des danses des Lapins Crétins. Mais la véritable nouveauté reste les niveaux avec Murphy, pensés avant tout pour la Wii U, qui composent quasiment la moitié des niveaux. A la manette, ils se jouent (presque) comme des niveaux normaux : il suffit de progresser comme d'habitude et d'appuyer sur la touche correspondante pour que Murphy fasse apparaître des plates-formes, déplace un mur ou désactive un piège. Au pad, cet exercice n'est ni fabuleux ni désagréable. On n'en retiendra qu'une seule chose : [i]Murphy is back ![/i]

En négociant avec succès son virage médiéval, Rayman réussit là où Sonic avait trébuché sur son Chevalier Noir et se pose comme le digne héritier du trône cédé par son ancêtre. Rayman Legends et Origins forment décidément un très beau couple de plateformers.

Mais là où Rayman Legends impressionne le plus, c'est également là où il est le plus cruel : il a clairement été pensé comme une exclusivité pour la console de Nintendo, une exclusivité de lancement d'une machine peu puissante, un jeu à la fois peu cher à produire et pas gourmand mais magnifique grâce à la magie de l'Ubi Art Framework ; un jeu avec un contenu calibré pour occuper des heures durant des premiers acheteurs qui n'ont que peu de choses à se mettre sous la dent. Rayman Legends a tout du jeu de [i]line-up[/i] parfait et devrait être le cas d'école de ce qu'il faut absolument faire à la sortie d'une machine : de nombreux niveaux à re-traverser pour tout débloquer, du solo et du multi offline.

Quoi de plus qu'Origins, me direz-vous ? Origins lui-même. Michel Ancel et son équipe ont, dans un bel élan de générosité, garni la galette jusqu'à raz bord. Un système de jeu à gratter dont on débloque les tickets en collectant assez de lums dans chaque épreuve nous permet d'acheter des niveaux supplémentaires tirés de Rayman Origins. C'est au final [b]la quasi intégralité du Rayman précédent[/b] qui est disponible dans Rayman Legends ! Et dans chacun de ces niveaux, la collecte des lums et des ptizêtres est de mise. Ajoutez à cela un système de semi-online avec deux épreuves journalières et autant d'épreuves hebdomadaires sur lesquelles scorer et affronter le monde entier, un mignon mini-jeu de "football" pensé pour le multijoueur local, des créatures poules-pondeuses à collectionner qui nous enrichissent chaque jour, une galerie de personnages jouables à débloquer au moins deux fois plus importante que dans Rayman Origins, un système de fantômes auxquels se mesurer...le jeu de [i]line-up parfait[/i] je vous dis.

Quel pied ce doit être d'acheter une nouvelle machine avec un jeu pareil, pensé jusque dans ses moindres recoins pour occuper et faire plaisir aux premiers acheteurs à moindre frais. Dommage que les joueurs concernés se soient fait priver de ce délice par les caprices d'un éditeur qui a fait sauter l'exclusivité comme un bouchon de champagne, refusant de se priver des autres marchés et provoquant injustement un re tard conséquent par ricochet. Tant pis pour eux. Tant mieux pour nous.

:-)

12079140.review: Рекомендую, игра весёлая, но пукан гореть будет!От сложности просто взрыв мозга!

12070527.review:
Originalmente eu joguei este jogo no WiiU (que por sinal faz um exelente uso do gamepad), mas eu acabei comprando no PC também. Rayman Legends é uma sequencia direta de Raymann Origins, para quem quer dar uma olhada:
(http://steamcommunity.com/id/BlackChrome/recommended/207490)

A história do jogo, pra ser sincero, não muda muita coisa com relação ao primeiro jogo, porém ela é bem narrada desta vez, além d epossuir dublagens em Português Brasileiro.

A gameplay do jogo, muitos aspectos foram mantidos do primeiro jogo. Voce anda, corre, ataca, pula, etc. O jogo ainda mantem o sistema de coop, porém ainda é apenas local.

As músicas, como antes, são muito boas.

Os cenários, são muito bonitos, bem desenhados. E com direito há alguns secrets.

Os gráficos estão bons e deram uma melhorada leve, pra ser sincero, voce vai notar poucos improvisos, mas estão ótimos ainda assim.

Não encontrei bugs ou glitchs.

A Ubisoft fez um ótimo trabalho com Rayman Legends, e é naquele mesmo esquema, se voce gosta de Mario, Sonic, Little Big Planet, Donkey Kong, Castle of Illusions, Ducktales, etc, então vai gostar de Rayman Legends também. E se voce jogou o Rayman Origins (antecessor), vai gostar também do Rayman Legends. No geral, se voce gosta de plataforma eu recomendo o jogo. Caso não goste do gênero, deixe quieto.

Mit Rayman Legends hat Ubisoft noch einen Sprung im Vergleich zu Origins geschafft. Die Levels sind super designed und unterhalten kontinuierlich. Besonders gelungen finde ich Levels, die mit Musik bekannter Lieder hinterlegt sind, zu denen man die Hindernisse und Gegner überwinden muss.
Die tägliche und wöchentlichen Herausforderungen finde ich gut, jedoch sind sie nicht sonderlich lange motivierend, da aller paar Tage das gleiche Level bzw. Level-Kombinationen wieder auftauchen. Hier hätte ein bisschen mehr Abwechslung sicher nicht geschadet.

Zusammengefasst ist Rayman Legends für mich auf jeden Fall das Geld Wert. Ich habe es für 10€ im Steam Summer Sale erstanden.

11774008.review:
I loved Rayman Origins, completing it 100%, and consider it one of my favourite games. With that in mind, Rayman Legends is better. In every way, Legends has improved upon the formula from the previous one, itself a worthy and excellent successor to the classic Rayman games of old. With the power of the beautiful UbiArt engine, this is a uniquely pretty game. I sometimes find myself stopping to watch the backgrounds of the levels, before continuing on a mad, frenetic and incredibly fun romp through the fantastic landscapes. The music is also excellent, with the musical levels being particular standouts. These levels are strictly platforming, with the only cues for your jumping and punching being the music and occasional markers on the ground. They are tough, but even if you die, there are frequent respawn points to keep you in the action. This fits the game on the whole- it's grueling, but the respawns are fast and the lives are infinite. It's possible to rush through the levels while only collecting what crosses your path, but there are secrets all around which require some exploration to find. 

This leads to my complaints about this game. Yes, I love it, but it's not perfect. Firstly, the Teensies and other collectables. They are hidden, yes, but usually not very well. There are some that I've found and thought were harder or more clever than the norm, but on the whole it's not hard to collect everything. It just requires some thoroughness. Second, Origins had a speedrun feature, where beating a level gave you the option to replay it with no checkpoints, and a medal if you finished within time. This added some good replayability, and while you can still run through levels in Legends, there's no speedrun feature. There are special short invasion levels which time you and post your time to a global leaderboard, which is cool, but ultimately I would have liked for the speedrunning to be available on normal levels too. Thirdly, I've had two levels actually glitch out on me. The second music level has a segment where you jump off a large cliff and fall, and my game does not allow me to do this properly- I die mid drop because the screen scrolls too fast for me to survive. I managed to get around this by pausing and unpausing repeatedly during the fall, but this is a fairly major problem. As well, the third music level has a section where you run through a skull, and come out the other side shrunken. The first time I played this level, when I ran into the skull, I died. Every time. The next time I loaded the level, it worked fine, but I was left thinking it would be uncompleteable. Perhaps the first bug is due to me playing on a laptop, but nothing else in the game has done that, so i have no idea. Finallly, my last problem is UPlay. 'Nuff said. I personally have had no real problems with it, but it's still annoying and unneccessary, and many people do have major problems. So keep that in mind when considering this game.

In conclusion, Rayman Legends is fantastic and I love it and it's one of my favourite games, but it has got problems, and I recognise that. Still highly recommending it, 10/10.

11736998.review:
[b]Rayman Legends 5/5:[/b] Pokud objevíte hravější a nápaditější titul, tak prosím dejte neprodleně vědět; předem děkuji. Ovšem těžko přetěžko se vám takový bude hledat... Jelikož i když je Rayman "pouze" rodinnou plošinovkou, tak ve svých stodvaceti levelech (osmdesát nových a čtyřicet remasterovaných z minulého dílu) nikdy nesklouzne (co nesklouzne, ani se nepřiblíží!) vlnám stereotypu.

 Je až neuvěřitelné, že i navzdory omezením daných žánrem se bezmála každý level hraje jinak, má jiné mechaniky i nápady (např. rytmické hudebně skákací levely či kung-futbalové pasáže, které jsou ve dvou hráčích zábavnějších než veškeré oficiální fotbaly co jich mezi hrami je apod.) Tohle umí snad jen Nintendo s Mariem a to ani zdaleka ne vždy. Sympatické pak je, že při absenci obtížností je zda přesně trefená hranice, kdy projití levelu zvládne časem každý (a tak speciálně v coopu těžko hledat vhodnější hru pro rodinné hraní), ale výzvou je projítí (resp. vysbírání) všeho na sto procent. V tu chvíli by u mnohých podobných her hrozila flustrace, ale Rayman je i při neustálém opakování některé náročnější pasáže vždy hrou, u které se snad ani nelze cítit jinak než "v pohodě".

 Hudební stránka spolu s neskutečně roztomilou (a nekýčovitou!) kreslenou grafikou v tom pak hrají zcela zásadní roli. Lze jen doufat, že si tvůrci nevyplýtvali veškeré nápady a i příště půjde o takovou osvěžující tsunami zábavy.

11736427.review:
Increíble Obra Maestra de los videojuegos, que supera con creces a Origins en las pocas cosas en que este podía ser superado, destacando un diseño y planteamiento de niveles mucho más variado y ligero (que sobre todo se aprecia en el mundo de agua, el cual en Origins no estaba del todo bien conseguido en cuanto a jugabilidad, en mi opinión).

La banda sonora es increíble, destacando los niveles musicales, en los que realmente sientes que te encuentras ante un videojuego superior a los de su género, que ha sublimado las plataformas hasta niveles de jugabilidad insospechados. 

Gráficamente es precioso, y mucho más bonito visualmente que Origins (Ojo, que ya de por sí Origins es un gran juego!).

Por poner alguna pega, el 'Retorno a los Orígenes' a mí se me ha hecho algo redundante: una forma forzosa de alargar el videojuego, pero que pone en evidencia los errores que tenía la anterior entrega de Rayman. Afortunadamente, como estos errores eran pocos, se puede disfrutar de esta extensión del juego igualmente, pero se nota una bajada de calidad notable.

En definitiva, un juego de 10, donde todo, hasta el último salto, está pulido al máximo para asegurarte una experiencia de juego inolvidable.
