9645147.review:
Rayman Legends це чудовий приклад того, що жанр платформер ще живий і ще може розвиватись в будьякому напрямі. Ця гра просто чудова, тут є веселий геймплей і ко-оп на 4-х гравців, чудовий гумор який якщо не змусить вас засміятись, то усмішку з лиця виб'є точно. Гра доречі доволі складна місцями, є багато рівнів які змусять вас попотіти але складні рівні найбільше як на мене запам'ятовуються, деякі з них можна досконало пройти тільки у ко-опі. Якщо хочете більше вражень від гри, то краще роздільть їх з дрізями, родичами або близькими, в ко-опі грати в 100 раз веселіше. Гра практично не має мінусів, вона просто ідеальна, відшліфована до деталів. Всім рекомендується пограти 120\10
 P.S. Єдине що мене Дууууууже розчарувало в грі так це відсутність справжнього пекельно-складного випробовування після того як збереш абсолютно всі предмети.Складних рівнів в грі вистачає але не вистачає секретного надскладного останнього рівня який був присутнів в Origins у вигляді пекла з босом Бабуською на кінці)))

9635116.review:
Après un Rayman Origins tonitruant, est ce que sa suite allait réussir à égaler voir surpasser le volet précédent ?
Les réponses sont pour moi oui et non.
Rayman Legends surpasse Origins en certains points, mais déçoit dans d'autres.
De ce fait il égale globalement son ainé.

Graphiquement sublime et maniabilité au poil.
Les boss sont globalement meilleurs et plus inspirés que ceux de Legends.
Le Level Design a tendance à rendre le parcours des niveaux beaucoup plus fluide, voir même les orienter vers les courses ou le speed run, ce que j'ai vraiment adoré !!!
Le tout est plus vif et dynamique.

Mais on baisse de plusieurs crans au niveau du challenge, le jeu étant beaucoup plus facile que son ainé...ce qui ne m'a pas gâché mon plaisir car le plus important pour moi dans un jeu de plateforme, c'est la fluidité, et ce Legends l'est globalement plus que Origins.
De plus le titre est toujours assez long à boucler à 100% vu la tonne de chose à faire, et le contenu à débloquer.
Les personnages cachés sont en revanche beaucoup trop dures à obtenir, car il vous faudra jouer quotidiennement aux évenements en ligne, ce qui prendra une éternité...

Petite déception sur le design global des mondes et leurs thématiques.
Les trois premiers sont purement excellents, mais les suivants décroissent en originalité et en qualité.
J'ai trouvé Origins bien mieux équilibré à ce niveau là, car je suis resté sur ma faim dans Legends quand je le compare avec le volet précédent, dommage.
De plus, je n'ai pas aimé la repompe inutile des niveaux de Rayman Origins, qui sont en plus vraiment trop simplifiés.

Les musiques sont justes incroyables !
Celles d'Origins étaient déjà très bonnes, mais ne faisaient que dans le registre rigolo, plein d’onomatopées.
Rayman Legends monte d'un bon cran dans la qualité et le diversifié, en proposant de vraies mélodies enchanteresses, semblables à celles du Rayman d'origine, ainsi que des airs incroyablement rythmés.
L'inspiration celtique m'a énormément plu à ce niveau là.
Le bon point c'est que la bande son de Origins reste tout de même très intéressante en comparaison, tant elle est différente de celle proposée dans Legends.


Rayman Legends reste donc globalement complémentaire à Rayman Origins: meilleur au certains points, et moins efficace dans d'autres, il a le mérite de proposer quelque chose de différent.

Tous les deux restent de toute façon mes deux plus grosses gifles vidéo ludiques de ces dernières années !!!



* Points forts :

+ C'est magnifique !
+ La patte artistique
+ L'univers enchanteur et humoristique
+ Fidèle à l'esprit Rayman d'origine
+ Bande son enivrante et stimulante
+ Gameplay au poil
+ Level Design hallucinant
+ Les niveaux de course
+ Challenge équilibré
+ Une tonne de choses à débloquer


* Points faibles :

- Des mondes moins marquants que dans Rayman Origins
- la repompe inutile des niveaux de Rayman Origins
- Plus facile que son ainé
- Ces persos cachés quasiement impossibles à obtenir
- Toujours pas de coop online




19/20

9611808.review:
Un juego de plataformas continuacion de Rayman Origins, en este juego sigue la historia de su sucesor, ahora con nuevos amigos y mas diversion, añadiendo nuevas cosas como:
-[b]Niveles musicales[/b], al final de cada "cuadro" (mundo) hay un nivel musical diferente, algunos con canciones de cantantes y otras son musica original de Ubisoft
-[b]Jefes finales en 3D[/b], esto mejora mucho la experencia de juego.
-[b]Retos online[/b], este modo generalmente es de competencia con diferentes retos como conseguir la mayor cantidad de lums, llegar a una meta en tiempo limite entre otros, los cuales son [b]Diarios[/b] y [b]Semanales[/b].
-[b]Murfy[/b], ahora tendras un compañero (muy a parte de jugarlo con alguien mas en coop), si en tu camino hay algo que no puedas hacer con Rayman, Murfy te ayudara.
-[b]Back to Origins[/b], algo que si jugaste el juego anterior te gustara, regresamos a Rayman Origins pero con graficos aun mejores.
-[b]Kungfoot[/b] Este mini-juego trata sobre futbol que los puedes jugar de 2 pero no es la misma experiencia, esta diseñado para jugarse de 4.
-[b]Criaturas[/b] Tus mascotas en este juego los cuales ganaras en los "Billetes de la suerte", ellos cada dia te daran lums
-[b]Recompensas[/b], cada que termines un nivel se te dara un "billete de la suerte" el cual tienes que "rascar", los premios a ganar son crituras, lums o diminutos, tambien te daran lums al finalizar un cuadro.
[b]Invadidos[/b] Niveles contra reloj, donde tendras que salvar a los diminutos del nivel antes de que el tiempo acabe, cada diminuto tiene su tiempo.
Dentro del juego, cuenta con una banda sonora regular que acompaña bien a los niveles, mejora de graficos, una gran cantidad de niveles, divididos en 5 cuadros (mundos) y uno extra, el cual tiene una sorpresa.

9603362.review:
La suite de l'excellent rayman origins qui reprend les mêmes bases solides. Comme toujours, l'animation est au top, les univers colorés et les musiques entrainantes. On retrouve dans cet opus un nouveau type de niveaux bonus, les niveaux musicaux, qui sont très agréables à jouer (même si d'un point de vue gameplay ce n'est pas la panacée), on perd par contre les "niveaux du coffre" de l'ancien opus qui se rapprochaient plus de niveaux à la super meat boy.
Globalement on prend la même recette et on recommence, avec beaucoup plus de contenu (une 40aine de niveaux d'origins étant inclus en bonus), des challenges online qui se renouvellent tous les jours, quelques mini-jeux etc...
La sauce prend à nouveau, et c'est un excellent jeu de plateforme, mais malgré la supériorité du contenu je préfèrais amplement la présentation de Rayman Origins, dans lequel la liberté d'explorer les niveaux n'importe comment n'étais pas aussi présente, ce qui faisait qu'un avait une bien meilleure sensation de continuité dans le jeu. Dans Legends, tous les pouvoirs sont débloqués initialement et ça en devient un jeu du type "tiens faisons quelques niveaux de ça et quelques niveaux de ça" ce qui réduit un peu l'implication dans le jeu je trouve.
Autre point noir : contrairement à origins qui était DRM-Free, Legends se retrouve derrière le ""fameux"" client uPlay d'Ubisoft, qui, comme tout le monde le sait, serait plus utile brûlé et enterré dans un trou profond qu'en activité pour nous casser les burnes sur nos jeux steam.

9597573.review:
Rayman Legends is a game that has got a lot of attention everywhere. And it defintely deserves to be regraded highly among the gaming enthusiasts. Its a platformer, and more than that, its the most complete platformer I have ever come across. Its got collectibles and lots of little medals and stuff but most of them are achievable, they are not insanely tough to get or anythinng. The graphics are cute, fresh and interesting. The controls are reallly tight, as should be in a good platformer. The difficulty is not insanely tough( not atleast in the beginning) and every single level seems self-sufficient, in terms of its length, difficulty and number of collectibles. It is also a pretty long game, especially for a platformer but if you play a bit every now and then, it does not feel frustratingly long or overburdening in terms of gameplay. The game is so much fun you wont ever realise there are no steam achievements. There is so much to do within the game itself, that you dont feel like you miss out on achievements. 

I pretty much love this game and, for anyone who likes platformers, this is undoubtedly the game of the year.

Much recommended to everyone.

9556781.review:
While I prefer the art direction of Origins over Legends (the cel-shaded cartoon look was just SO good), this is by far the better of the two games if you're one of those that has to gold every level.  In some ways it's a lot easier to do so, but at the same time, Origins did some seriously nasty things requiring you to play a level down to a science.  Legends allows you to take a few bumps from time to time and still come out on top.  Whether or not you think that's good or bad depends on the type of gamer you are.

The other things you can expect are normal for a Rayman game - tight controls, great humor, heaps upon HEAPS of levels to run through, a bajillion collectible items, AND remixes of select levels from Origins (only this time without any King Lums).

If you're totally new to Rayman, I would recommend Legends without blinking.  If you're a bit more of the hardcore platformer, go with Origins.  Or get both!  These are two of the most solid 2D platformers on the market today.

Charakterystyczna postać z odłączonymi od siebie wszystkimi częściami ciała, czyli Rayman wraz ze swoim najlepszym przyjecialem - Globoxem, powracają w nowej grze o podtytule "Legends". Nie bez powodu, bo gra względem swojej poprzedniczki, czyli Originsa, całkiem zmienia klimat... oraz grafikę, na jeszcze ładniejszą. (Kupując Legendsa dostajecie od razu odświeżonego Originsa ;) ) 
Długość gry jest zadowalająca, znajdziemy w tej produkcji również fajnie zaprojektowane poziomy z nowymi pomysłami na rozgrywkę oraz masę nowych, grywalnych postaci. Świetne muzyczne levele na końcu każdego świata zachęcają do ciągłego ich powtarzania ze względu na mjuzik :). Plus zadania dziennne, miesięczne oraz specjalne, w których można pobijać własne rekordy jak i innych graczy zdobywając przy tym puchary. Gra warta poświęcenia czasu i wydanych pieniędzy. Polecam grać na padzie... w kooperacji ;)

9508913.review:
Продолжение отличнейшего 2D платформера. Игра только похорошела и улучшилась, хотя и стала легче. На выбор теперь и больше персонажей, если раньше у вас было всего по 2-3 Реймена и Глобокса (жаба), и просто уйма версий Тинзи (синий чувак), то теперь просто уйма персонажей (на консолях правда еще больше, там и Реймен-марио, Глобокс-луиджи, Реймен-ассасин и т.д.) + новые персонажи - богини. 
Сама игра стала меньше, хотя для "расширения" игры добавлены и уровни из Rayman Origin (которая зачастую достается бесплатно с Legends, особенно если покупать на стороних сайтах).  Да и после прохождения открываются уровни на скорость, уже для истиных хардкорщиков. Но эпогеем стали уровни под музыку. В конце каждого мира вас ждут музыкальные уровни на скорость, где вы бежите под музыку и уровень построен так, что вы совершаете действие (прыгаем, бьем) в такт музыке. Здесь и рок уровни, и оперные, и музыка из Kill Bill. Последний мир открывает музыкальные уровни в 8-битной версии. И это жесть... 
В игре все сделано для фана, после прохождения вам открывают стикеры, стерев которые вы можете открыть как новый уровень, получить зверюшку или люменов. Забавный режим в футбол. Для истиных фанов, можно играть в ежедневные испытания, пытаясь побить рекорды других игроков, заодно заработать люмов на новых персонажей.
Так же забавно было наблюдать как пришли друзья, особо не ознакомленые с играми, и просто сели и начали играть, смеясь и веселясь. Если вам нужна семейная игра или игра для компании, чтоб повеселится и раслабится, то это игра для вас.

9508048.review: Loved it. Highly addictive. I lost sleep. I didn't miss it. I miss playing this for the first time. Runs beautifully (mechanically and visually).

9507629.review:
So I was excited as I could've been for this to come out, seeing as how Rayman Origins was proabably my fave 2D platformer in a long while. 
It was on the day when this became available for preorder that I noticed it had mandatory Uplay DRM. I swore not to buy it at full price, let alone preorder it, solely because of that fact. I would not be the one supporting DRM in my DRM, no sir.
I eventually bought this more than half off and found out that there's no option to disable gamepad rumble, and do believe that I loathe rumble.
After having muttered some Ubisoft addressed swear words I started playing and...  I forgot about my well-founded self-rightous hate in all but a few minutes. It's slick, intuitive and responsive, the sound design is one of the best you'll ever find and the graphics are sure to make you widen up your eyes on occasion.
Do I recommend getting this game? Of course I do. Do I recommend getting this game on Steam? Not necessarily.

Why is this game so good?  I have no idea why the developers of this game took such time & care on this masterpiece, but I am so glad that they did. 9495016.review:
Following off the glorious footsteps of the fantastic Rayman Origins, Rayman Legends successfully follows in the footsteps of its predecessor and delivers another high-quality entry into the Rayman franchise.

The rebooted Rayman series are 2-D platformers that do away with the traditional lives and continue system in most platformers in favor of a fair balance of high yet-fair difficulty balanced out with a good checkpoint system, making the game more about overcoming obstacles rather than trying to beat a game in a single sitting. The spot-on controls make it so when you die, you feel it was your fault rather than the game messing up or the game being cheap.

Since this game was originally planned as a Wii U exclusive, there are several stages that are clearly intended to be played on a touchscreen, which involve using longtime series character Murphy the fly to do tasks such as moving blocks, rotating wheels & cutting ropes. These features work perfectly fine on controller, but these particular levels are not nearly as engaging as the rest of the game.

This game also supports four player co-op and has a fun multiplayer mini-game. Sadly, the multiplayer is only local. There is also a daily challenge mode that gives players the opportunity to complete with other players in several time trial courses complete with player ghosts to help feel the competitive spirit of the addicting game mode.

This game has a great deal of content that can be enjoyed both in single player and multiplayer and is a title that deserves to be in your library.

Unfortunately this game crashes upon launch for me.  I have tried to contact Ubisoft Support and they have told me that there is no fix for this issue.

Others on their forums are also complaining of this issue, and the official statement has been to "Disable internet before launching the game, and start Uplay in Offline mode".  When done, the game *does* launch (and it's a GLORIOUS game).  

This is quite possibly one of my favorite couch co-op games, similar to a less-frustrating Super Mario Bros Wii in that each player tries to complete the level simultaneously, but can punch or inhibit other players if they want to be mean.  The game has very excellent controls, vibrant and varied visuals, and a stellar soundtrack.  Upon completing each stage you are rewarded with a "musical" level that requires you to keep the beat almost like a platformer Guitar Hero.

However, despite my glowing review, I cannot in good faith give this game a recommendation until Ubisoft does something about the Crash On Launch issue that turns launching the game into a chore.

Gráficamente mejorado, diseño de niveles impecable, cooperativo local igual de divertido que el anterior con la adición del personaje diseñado para el Wii U Gamepad, que en el caso de PC tiene un movimiento ya predeterminado por la pantalla (si algo hay que criticarle es que no lo hayan hecho controlable al 100%, cuando tranquilamente lo podrían haber hecho para mouse o el stick del control).

Por último hay que destacar los desafíos online, tanto diarios como semanales, que le dan vida extra al juego, donde se puede competir con amigos o desconocidos hasta que nos salgan callos en los dedos.

¡Recomendadísimo!

9064716.review:
A game of platforms, beauty and song, Rayman Legends picks up where the previous masterpiece Rayman Origins left off, with the heroes of the glade sleeping. In their absence, the Dark Teensies have unleashed all manner of nasty upon the glade and various worlds. Someone wake Rayman up, we got real problems here.

The heroes, along with new Barbarian Princess additions, will need punch, slap, jump, run, glide and swim through worlds to rescue the Teensies held prisoner. Along the way they'll encounter a variety of gameplay types unparrelled in the genre and do so in realms with visuals that put most modern cartoons to shame. And of course, the music. A score lovingly constructed for its atmosphere and ability to illict unbridled joy in the player, you'll be humming the kazoo and whistles for weeks to come.

Rayman Legends deserves its title, deserves to be mentioned in the same breathe as platforming legends of days gone by and, maybe, belongs ahead of them all.

8960427.review: Rayman Legends отличное продолжение Rayman Origins. Игра веселая, особенно если у вас есть с кем в нее поиграть. Самому же, играть в нее весело только первые два часа, потом очень сильно надоедает. Скучно становится играть из-за сохранений, когда ты недопрыгиваешь до нужной платформы под конец уровня, то приходится проходить все сначала, становится не интересно собирать бонусы, и открывать секретные комнаты, которые уже открывал. Но когда ты играешь с другом или сестрой, то проигрывать не страшно, твой персонаж превращается в шар, и если твой друг его лопнет, ты можешь проходить дальше. Уровни все разнообразные, особенно порадовали музыкальные. Они очень динамичные, быстрые, требует умение быстро нажимать на нужные клавиши, чтоб не начинать все сначала. Музыка, используется разных жанров, от классики до хитов рока восьмидесятых. Один из приятных сюрпризов, это добавленные карты из первой части. Игра проходится на одном дыхании, у меня с сестрой заняла 18 часов. Разработчики добавили мини игры. Я раньше не понимал зачем они нужны в небольших играх, но когда мы закончили играть в основной сюжет, примерно в 11 часов вечера, и напоследок зашли в мини игру "футбол" то проиграли в него почти до пяти утра, так что часов 8 прохождения из основного геймплея можно убрать))) В общем, я всем рекомендую поиграть в нее, особенно если у вас есть сестра, младший брат или друг, который скучает у вас дома, во время вашей игры в доту или контру.

8952154.review:
Best platforming game I have ever played. Excellent audiovisual art direction (music is a work of genius). Whole game can be played cooperatively by 2 players (with fun soccer minigame up to 4 players as a bonus). It gets challenging hard really fast, but repeating is not frustrating - game makes you want to play. At the end of every chapter that consists of typical platforming gameplay there is one "music" level where you have to play according to rhythm of music that is playing - excellent idea, too bad there are so few of those. Technically game has some downsides - max res is 1080p, max framerate is 60HZ. This, of course, is dictated by hand made animations and graphics. Platforming genre, like no other, could really make use of 120Hz and beyond with some motion blur reducing technology (like ULMB) :(
Another downside is that Ubisoft insists on putting Uplay on their every game even if you buy it on Steam :( 
This is the game that converts people into gamers.

8940185.review:
Классическая, но очень интересная игра-платформер. 
Купил из-за того, что играл в предыдущие части: «Rayman vs. Rabbits», «Rayman 3: Hoodlum Havoc». Последней в Steam нет, но с полной уверенностью могу сказать, что это очень хорошая, продуманная игра, пожалуй, лучшая из серии. Это НЕ платформер, мы смотрим на мир от третьего лица (если кого-то заинтересовало). 
Так как я считаю, что «R3:Hoodlum Havoc» — лучшая игра из серии, я поначалу немного разочаровался в Rayman Legends. Это как же так? От одного стиля игры к совершенно другому! Так ведь не бывает! 
Но не тут-то было. Стоило мне поиграть около часа в Rayman Legends, как я понял, что ошибался.
Ваша цель — проходя уровни, освобождать каких-то парней, похожих на черепашек, из всех мест, какие только можно представить; из ящиков, сундуков, из-под земли (а на некоторых даже прыгают нехорошие ребята!).
Но самый главный плюс этой игры — музыкальное сопровождение. О, музыку здесь делали настоящие профессионалы. В комплекте с игрой она помогает вам расслабиться и получить истинное удовольстие.
Почему до сих пор еще нет значков и фонов для Steam? Их очень не хватает! :D

8803476.review: This is the best platformer I have played in many years.   The art style and overall ambiance enhance the game experience instead of hindering it, the music perfectly matches the levels (especially the musical themed levels), and the controls are very tight.  There are so many levels to play and they are the perfect length, not too long or too short, with checkpoints on each screen transition, making some of the harder levels fun to master, instead of dreadful.  Once you beat certain levels and reach a certain level of collectibles, levels unlock that are tougher than the main campaign for those seeking challenge (they usually have time limits which require perfect control or else you will not reach the goal).  The steam version also has the previous game (Rayman Origins) included, but require unlocks to play.    For those who love platformers, this is a must-have game.

8789146.review: Fantastic platformer that makes Rayman Origins obsolete. The mechanics have been changed for the better in my opinion combine that that a large amount of level from Origins are in this game, all of them redone with the new mechanics, makes me feel ripped of for having paid even more for Origins than I did for this game during the Steam Holiday Sale. Presentation is fantastic and even though I have not unlocked one yet, I played one of the music levels which was fantastic, like Bit Trip Runner but with Rayman Art and Rock music and some very good level design. For the masochists, the games levels progress to what i assume are insanely hard with a 6 skull rating. For the collectors, every level has two sets of trophies to earn more Teensies, which is effect is the currency used to unlock more levels, along with Lums which is the currency you earn in levels and other places that are used to buy new characters, and even on top of that there is an awesomeness ranking which I forget how you earn, but is used to unlock daily chalanges, of which there are up to 4 each day where you compete with poeple all over the world to see who is the best, and as you can figure these levels are different every day. Though similar to other levels already in the game, it still incrases the overall content and replayability of this game. For someone like who play it very casually, you can still run into the same problem that I ran into with Origins which was that I reached a point at which i had to redo previous levels to unlock more levels. This is less annoying in Legends because there are multiple story arcs, and so it means i wont feel as bad not finishing the game as I did with Origins because I wanted to finish the story. In the end the game is wonderful and gives you many ways of earning progress, including the reaffle mechanic (even though the interface for it was clearly made with the Wii U in mind).

8786104.review: Awesome game...so tricky and full of surprises! As good as Super Mario! Best leveldesign a jump and run has to offer!

8781381.review: Fast so gut wie Rayman Origins. Im Grunde genommen sind sich die beiden Spiele zum verwechseln ähnlich und sämtliche Stärken des ersten Teils wurden konsequent übernommen. Aus meiner Sicht haben sich die Entwickler jedoch mit der Einbindung von 3D-Effekten keinen Gefallen getan. Irgendwie stören die teilweise etwas klobigen 3D-Modelle den Gesamteindruck und ich persönlich sehe keinen Grund, wieso man nicht einfach mit dem selben wünderschönen 2D-Look weiter gemacht hat. Ob man die neue Person im Trupp man muss jeder für sich entscheiden. Ich für meinen Teil habe sie vollkommen ausgeblendet, da einfach niemand an Rayman herankommt. Große Stärke des Spiels sind die Musik-Level, die den bereits exzellenten Flow des Vorgängers auf eine neue Stufe heben, indem sie einen quasi nach Gehör spielen lassen. Zudem gibt es noch ein weiteres dickes Kaufargument: 20.000 Lums unter dem Meer hat so ziemlich die witzigste Atmosphäre die ich seit langem erlebt habe. Unterm Strich bleibt also ein exzellentes Spiel, das Liebhabern des Vorgängers dutzende Stunden Spaß bringen wird.

8739723.review:
Można by powiedzieć, że to tylko kolejna część  która od Rayman Origins będzie różnić sie tylko poziomami. Nic bardziej mylnego! Rayman Legends to najlepsza platformówka w jaką kiedykolwiek grałem. Zawsze kiedy gram z bratem w jakąkolwiek grę zazwyczaj kończy się to wyzywaniem np. dlatego, że jeden z nas  „zlamił”, podczas wspólnego przechodzenia Rayman Legends taka sytuacja się nie wydarzyła, a wręcz przeciwnie dzięki rozśmieszającym do łez poziomom i przeciwnikom gra w pewien sposób nas pogodziła. Na szczególne uznanie zasługują także poziomy muzyczne  (po jednym na końcu każdego poziomu). Dźwięk w tych poziomach i zgranie muzyki ze zbieranymi lumami (punktami) jest tak doskonały i miodny, że można by w nie grać wiele razy a i tak by się nie znudziły.
Wszystkie poziomy są ciekawie i fajnie przemyślane nigdy nie czułem ze robi się monotonnie czy po prostu nudno. Dodam jeszcze, że pod koniec gra robi się diabelnie trudna, ja jednak nie siedziałem nad nią tak długo bo grałem wraz z bratem w lokalnej kooperacji (ja klawiatura, brat pad) co znacznie ułatwia grę, ale za to daje jeszcze więcej zabawy i śmiechu. Jedyne co troszkę mnie zdenerwowało jest fakt, że kiedy już przeszedłem całą „kampanie” zostały mi jeszcze poziomy dodatkowe które można odblokować za zdobyte punkty w grze, wszystko fajnie ale kiedy już przeszliśmy (ja i brat) około połowę dodatkowych poziomów  po prostu usunął nam się cały zapis z grą. Szkoda ale trudno na pewno jeszcze kiedyś wrócę do tego tytułu aby przejść go na  100 %. 
Podsumowując  Rayman Legends to gra której długo nie zapomnę, a na pewno do niej wrócę. Polecam ją każdemu a w szczególności tym którzy mają kogoś z kim mogli by ją przejść wspólnie, jest jak najbardziej warta swojej ceny a spodoba się i tym co mają lat 12 jak i tym co mają  20.

8720608.review: Лучшее, что случалось с жанром двухмерных платформеров со времён классических Марио и Соника. Рекомендую всем и каждому. 10 из 10, ГОСПОДИ!

8714145.review:
Ви вважаєте себе гуру геймпаду? Подобаються яскраві мультяшні платформери? Любите ігри, які не пройдеш за вечір? 

До вашої уваги - Rayman Legends!

Моє знайомство з серією почалося з гри Rayman Raving Rabbids. Веселі змагання та геймплей у стилі Yetti Sports (прошу не закидувати мене тухлими яйцями і смердючими шкарпетками за таке порівняння) на той час дійсно були "Вау!". Але проект був розрахований в першу чергу на власників Wii, тому мій інтерес як РСшника до гри швидко згас. Рейман знов нагадав моєму "харду" про себе у 2011 році тайтлом Origins. Серія повернулась до "канонічного" платформеру і відхопила немало нагород від ігрової спільноти. Здавалось, розробники вже не перестрибнуть саміх себе. Але вийшов Rayman Legends і довів, що "если сильно захотеть...".

Сюжет. Після щасливої роздачі святкових затріщин ворогам з підземелля в Origins, у казковому світі знов настала "спокуха". Проте Рейман з друзями знаходить дивне шапіто з картинами, які магічним чином переміщують їх до інших світів. Розробники постарались на відмінно: ми побуваємо і в лісі, і на таємній військовій базі (привіт Splinter Cell), і у античній варіації світу Реймена, і у вимірі зробленого з тістечок та іншої смакоти. Фантазія і неповторність проробки кожного сеттінгу примушує тішитись як маля. 

Геймплей. У двох словах - повна чума. Ми будемо бігати, стрибати, роздавати всім копняків зменшуватись у розмірах і навіть перетворюватись на качку! Особливої уваги заслуговують "музичні рівні". Швидкісний забіг по зоні яка "заточена" під певний трек точно не залишить вас байдужими. Щодо самих треків: наші вуха будуть тішити переробки таких треків як Survivor - Eye of the Tiger, Tutti Frutti Елвіса Преслі і декілька інших.
Не дивлячись на показову "аркадність" геймплей доволі хардкорний. По мірі проходження ми відкриватимемо нові картини, рівні та "скіни" для героїв. Всього героїв - 4: Реймен, Глобокс, Тенсі і Принцеса. Анімація кожного героя просто безподібна. Дизайнери і художники постарались на славу. Більш того, для тих кому буде замало рівнів з Legends, розробники запхнули багацько рівнів з Origins. Сумарна кількість рівнів і їх хардкорність автоматично викидають гру з розряду "на пару вечорів".
Пару слів про мультиплей. Наявний режим локального кооперативу, який підтримує до 4х гравців дозволяючи скоротати пару вечорів в компанії друзів. Також наявний футбол, який дозволить вирішити споконвічне питання в "кого довший". 
Тим, кому цього буде замало, у Rayman Legends наявний "фіктивний" мультиплеер. Раз на день/тиждень ми отримуємо нові змагання результати яких вивішують на глобальну дошку пошани, порівнюють з результатами інших гравців і дають різні ігрові "плюхи", які підвищують наш рівень офігезності (awesomeness level). Особисто я не дійшов до останнього рівня, тому не можу з точністю сказати, що нас очікує у фіналі :).
Про мінуси. Багато хто лаявся на окремий юбісофтівський "софт" UPlay. Але оскільки я не отримав "мозковиносу" від користування даним софтом, то і плюватись на нього сильно не буду. Але можна було б обійтись і без нього.

Підсумок. Що ми маємо? Чумовий геймплей, купа гумору, класна графіка, мультиплей. Ви ще тут? Тоді команда Реймена йде до вас!

8686131.review:
Rayman Origins felt like a test. A well-thoughtout game, but a bit unpolished. Legends adds that extra pollish to both controls and art style, although that's hardly what feels improved. Difficulty curves quite nicely letting people experiment and mess around without being forced to progress until later on, and the controls are very responsive (even when used with a controller! Controller mappings are rebindable). The games tacked-on "underwater" world isn't actually too bad, more requiring critical thinking than it does skill and percision. Challenge support for this game isn't too unique, I've seen challenges repeated quite often although it was nice to see that I ranked at the very top of Gold-level players. Even if you aren't good at said challenges, a "ghost" option lets you hone and improve your skills and learn from other players.
Although... I've two semi-obvious complaints. The Ubisoft DRM can be quite invasive before gameplay, REQUIRING updates to its service and making you lauch the game from its Uplay service (I do not approve of it, mind you). My other negative thought being there is NO online multiplayer. Enjoy crowding around your monitor with 3 other people shoving controllers into every USB port you have.

8618480.review: Приветствуйте ещё один гениальный шедевр от гения Мишеля Анселя. Rayman Legends это гениальная рисованная игра про приключения человечка по имени Рэйман. Эта игра безусловно должна входить в 10-ку лучших игр этого года. Эта игра очень добрая красивая и местами очень забавная. 8612067.review:
Rayman Legends is just so much better than Origins. I remember talking, erm.. not so positive,.. about Origins. aside from the wonderful, colorful graphics. Well, let me say that Legends is a bigger and better game in every way; customization, unlockables (oh man, they keep on coming), secrets; there seems to be much more variety this time around and I couldn't recommend this game more.

There are 6 worlds to be completed, with the last one being more of a bonus world. Each world has about 8 to 10 levels, and each level could you take at least 5 minutes to complete. So it's a big game. Add even more secret and unlockable levels to that number and you know why it's called Legends. 

Each of the first 5 worlds end with a musical level where you just run, punch and avoid enemies based on the music. It's brilliant and it works very well. In general there's much more variety gameplay wise as well, with the aforementioned musical levels but there are also stealth levels, and levels where you have to rely on a (CPU controlled) co-op partner.

The animations and graphics are top notch. Rarely have I been as impressed with 2D visuals as I've been with the last few Rayman games. No words can describe how this game looks and plays, you really have to witness it for yourself. This is art !

By the way, the boss fights aren't as frustrating as the ones in Origins. There was only one boss that, in my opinion, was more of a trial-and-error boss fight, the rest of them could easily be beaten the first time around, if you pay enough attention.

Rayman Legends surprised me in a big way and I'm saddened to hear that it didn't sell all that well. It has tons of content, so much even that most games look empty in comparison.

Buy it. Cherish it. Love it. Play it. But, more importantly, enjoy it. How can this game not put a smile on anyone's face ?

[Rating: 92/100]

Конечно, она далеко не детская и, как я уже намекал выше, людям с тонкой организацией психики выходящим из себя из-за перепрохождения одних и тех же уровней она ПРОТИВОПОКАЗАНА! Так как некоторые уровни придётся проходить раз по 20, кому-то по 30, и вполне вероятно что и по 50 раз =)

В той части, кстати, есть и большинство уровне из прошлой версии игрушки, но только в качестве ностальгии. Лично я играл с удовольствием, не взирая на точто и перепроходил по десятку раз одну и ту же локацию. 
Уровней огромное количество, вот уж где-где, а тут фантазия авторов на высоте; есть даже пасхалки забавные (типа последние кадры терминатора). В конце каждого большого уровня (они там называются картины) всегда забег на время под шикарнейшую музыку, ритм которой зависит от чистого прохождения игроком. Поэтому крепитесь духом. 8566267.review:
NOTE: this review is written by a person who doesn't have any sentiments for Rayman having never played original Rayman titles on PS/PS2.
i did, however, play previous Rayman game, Origins, and it was great. truly, a 5-star platforming experience. when i found out that there is a sequel on the way, i was all over it.
i was playing on the launch day already, in fact, the two of us were. it's a great title to have fun while playing with family or friends and i highly recommend.

(pros marked with '+', cons with '-')

+ GRAPHICS.
gorgeous, simply gorgeous. it was hella hard to beat the look of Rayman Origins, but Legends managed to do it. what's amazing too, it's that it has considerably low requirements for what it is, i play it on Intel HD Graphics completely fine.

+ CONTROLS.
works wonderfully, as you would expect from a game that has pretty difficult time attack levels.

+ LEVEL DESIGN.
platforming is amazing, it's tons more fun to do local co-op in this one. fighting is easy, but then again enemies aren't supposed to challenged you, they're rather obstacles in this game, similarly to barricades.
my only gripe with level design is time attack/rush levels in co-op - the player who is slightly faster will always activate some events that lead to another player dying, at least we couldn't find a way around it. maybe it just requires being in complete sync, hehe.

+ SOUND/MUSIC.
music by itself is amazing. it's quite different from Rayman Origins, which had also had a stellar soundtrack, but while the first one was cutesy pitched-up singing, in Legends we platform to cinematic/orchestral top-notch quality music.
special mention: musical levels are best thing to happen to platforming in a good while. Castle Rock is the best level in any platformer i ever played.

+ CONTENT.
there's quite a lot to do.
collect 700 teensies - and it is pretty fun to do it. main levels have 8 (6 scattered across the level, 2 found in special puzzle rooms) in them, with time attack/rush/boss levels each having 3.
collecting lums net you lottery tickets, which are a fun side activity - they unlock collectable creatures and also remastered levels from the previous Rayman game, Origins. yes, they are gated between the grind, as in you have to collect enough lums in each available level to get a ticket to get a chance to unlock a level, but without trying to get a maximum rating we easily unlocked more than 16 remastered levels by simply beating the levels.
5 colourful words, each having two additional character unlocks, a boss level and a musical level. 6 world, as a bonus one, contains remixed musical levels. strangely enough, those are quite nauseating to play because of the fish-eye effect.
there are lots of other unlockable characters as well.

+ DIFFICULTY CURVE.
Origins had one very annoying feature, or rather, lack of one. proper checkpoint system. often you had to redo way too long sections of the level, especially, if you missed a Teenie, and that was one of the reasons we couldn't finish all levels from it. i feel like Rayman Legends, while easier overall, is a good balanced game, and much, much less rage-inducing that it's predecessor.

- STEAM INTEGRATION.
yes, that is a con for me.
i'd have loved getting achievements from this game. i'd love trading cards and background art for my profile from this game. i think workshop could have been pretty wonderful too, you know how many amazing talented people are there in the mod community.
i must mention the uPlay thing. i hate being forced to use their DRM on top of Steam. it's unnecessary. and i'm never going to spend money on a platform, that is trying to force itself on me. i bypassed uPlay requirement in my own version, so i'm missing out on the leaderboards, but so be it. i don't consider this to be a fair requirement to begin with.

- MINOR PORT SYNDROM.
well, it was originally conceived for Wii U, only later brought to other platforms.
this is not a major problem, trust me. the thing is. Murphy levels, which are based on QTEs and moving certain level props as you progress through them were originally controlled with special controller Wii U has. instead, in the port we control Murphy with a button push ('Y' on XBOX controller). sometimes he's focusing on the wrong platform depending on which player is ahead, and that can cause problems for players to progress at a slightly different pace.
that's not too bad, but it could be better, simple as that.

to sum up, it still is an amazing experience, despite the uPlay DRM inconviniences. i highly recommend it, this is a great, family-friendly, couch co-op experience that will net you many hours of enjoyment.

9.5/10

8564529.review:
Like Origins, Rayman Legends is a super stylish platformer requiring a good amount of coordination and multitasking skill to play relatively well. Origins was already a very stylish game, and Legends gives even more polish to both the visuals and the soundtrack. The platforming itself is pretty tight, and a lot of the later levels don't allow much room for error.
The game gives you a lot to do, including invaded (read: speedrun) versions of every level, daily and weekly challenges (for online bragging rights, mainly) and rankings on both lums and teensies collected. However, with a reasonable amount of skill I was able to 100% the game in about 20 hours.

A sequel to one of my favorite platforming game (Rayman Origins.) Legends surpasses Origins in every single way. It looks better, it plays better, more characters, more skins, and it has more levels. You can even unlock some of the original levels from Origins to play on the new engine.

I love the music levels at the end of each world. It’s truly amazing when you have each step and action sync up to the song playing in the background. 

One of my complaints is that there is only local co-op. There is no online multiplayer available.

Legends is a must play for anyone. If you’re still on the fence there is a demo to download.

If you like torture and pain, if you like failing tens and hundreds of times in a row, if you like dying whenever anything touches you, if you like repeating the same area over and over again until getting the perfect score, this is the game for you. It contains so many challenges that it's hard to count them all.

Lack of Steam achievements (well, at least Uplay achievements work) and online co-op and cloud saves, extremely slow startup of Uplay, no instructions on advanced moves, issues with servers* and other drawbacks are annoying, but I can bear with it because it's one of the best platformers ever. Before the resurrection of Rayman, AAA platformers were dead and the genre was left to indies. I'm immensely delighted that I can play Rayman now and small annoyances won't stop me.

The game contains levels from Rayman Origins, but you should still buy the previous game because the gameplay has been serously changed. Graphics have been upgraded, but new remixes are not as balanced and perfected as the original levels.

This game is definitly in my top games of the year list, and is probably the best 2D Platformer I ever played.

The bad stuf first: You need UPlay, which is a stupid annoyance and this game is not so nice to play with a keyboard. I really recommend a controller.

That out of the way: WOW
Easy to pick up and play -  had a stressful day? Play one or two of the music levels and you'll feel releaxed and calm.
Want a challenge? My controller has toothmarks from some of the time trial levels which get unlocked later on.
But still the game is never unfair or discourages you so you just keep coming back until you get that sweet sensation of finally beating the level. And when you have you can go to the daily challenges and compete against other players.

One thing I like to point out is the level design. Especially in the music levels but also in every other, theres a certain flow. You're almost playing yourself into meditation. Rayman Origins, I felt, had to much backtracking so that you get all the lums and unlocked more stuff. Here you have much less lums you have to collect to get a gold medal, so you can just play the game. Even finding the caged Teensies isn't pulling you out of the flow.

On top: The visuals are just.... happy. Nothing against dark and gritty games, I love them, but this game is radiating with happiness and joy. In the animations, the background, the enemys. Everything just says: Have a good time - and you definitly will. Solo or with friends.

If you have doubt: Play the demo, but I can't find a reason why not to like this game.

8495021.review:
[h1]Triple-A Title[/h1]

There are many cartoony indie side-scrollers available on Steam, most costing under $15, so $40 for Rayman Legends may seem steep. However, this game is much bigger and more detailed than most of the indie titles. The game appears to be bigger than its predecessor, Rayman Origins, as well. There are 60 main stages, "Back To Origins" levels re-playing some Origins levels, rotating daily and weekly challenges, and more little stuff. All of that adds up to a lot of gameplay, especially considering you'll want to go re-play stages multiple times to get the fastest time, or collect all the things. 

Speaking of which, this game is a collector's paradise. Every corner of the game is littered with collectable items, which the game constantly tallies and rewards you with new levels and characters. There are a lot more characters in Legends than there were in Origins, and they all have their own amusing animations. 

This game is highly polished on every level. From the character animations, to the visual style, to the music, this game is a joy to behold, unless you're only interested in the brown-grey wash gritty shooters. In a way the game is visually old-school, in that every level has a theme(swamp, fire, etc.), but it's always interesting to see new scenery, and it's all beautifully drawn. I can't tell for certain, but I'm pretty sure the soundrack is recorded with a live orchestra. The resulting sound appropriately zany, but rich and authentic at the same time. Again, this is on a level beyond what an indie side-scroller can offer.

The gameplay is fairly old-school as well, in good ways and bad. While the simple, classic controls never seem to get old, the game can also be very demanding, requiring split-second precision. If you want to get a perfect run through a stage you pretty much have to retry and retry, and basically memorize every button press, or every attack in a boss fight. While it can be frustrating, there are relatively few moments where you're bottlenecked; you don't have to grind unless you're a perfectionist.

I was happy to get the game for $20 during the holiday sale, and I think the game is absolutely worth it at that price. Is it worth $40, though? I'm inclined to say yes, simply because of the amount of content and the level of polish throughout. This is a full-size game, and it comes at a full-size price. If you can get it at a discount it starts to be a great deal.

[i]Honte sur eux quand même, Uplay n'était pas indiqué sur Steam, je n'étais pas au courant jusqu'à sa sortie...[/i]
Je n'avais pas vraiment accroché à Rayman Origins, en tout cas je n'y avais joué qu'1h30. Sans doute mon côté complétioniste, c'était assez lourd dans Origins de tête. Là on arrive plus facilement à tout récupérer et passer au niveau suivant "la conscience tranquille" o/.
Pas grand chose à dire, je me suis bien éclaté dessus. Globalement les niveaux ne sont pas vraiment durs, le challenge se passe sur.. les challenges justement. Et ils sont au nombre de 4 : 2 journaliers, 2 hebdo avec la moitié "Casse-Cou" pour une difficulté accrue.

Pour revenir aux niveaux du jeu, ils sont assez variés que se soit l'environnement ou le gameplay qui change un peu. Il n'y a pas vraiment d'acquisition de nouveaux pouvoirs par contre (comme c'était le cas dans le premier Rayman), on a directement à peu près tout au début. Il y a aussi les fameux niveaux musicaux à la fin de chaque monde, bien plaisants avec un petit délire une fois que vous aurez fini le jeu et/ou obtenu les 400 ptizêtres requis. Il y a aussi des niveaux "envahis" où le but est de libérer 3 ptizêtres. Pour ça il faut arriver à la fin du niveau sans mourir dans un délai de 40 secondes, sinon vous ne libérerez pas tous les ptizêtres. Autant certains sont faciles, autant y'en a qui sont à effectuer à la perfection en gros, avec les techniques qui vous permettent de gagner du temps, à savoir : [spoiler]Attaquer en courant, et sauter derrière si possible et si ça aide à gagner du temps justement, sinon l'attaque seule en courant aide quand même.[/spoiler]
Il y a aussi des niveaux d'Origins +/- refaits.
Bref, niveau complétion, j'ai fini les niveaux de Legends à 100% (toutes les coupes diamant). Pour la durée ça a fait de la merde un peu sur Steam, c'était à 12h, c'est passé à 8... Mais en gros j'ai du passer une 10ène d'heures sur les niveaux de Legends en eux-même. Et c'était bien cool. 8351291.review:
This title was a complete surprise for me. I did not expect this game to win me over like it did, but its aesthetic and its polish are unbelievable. This is a must buy for any fan of platforming games. This is the culmination of decades of creating platform games, and they nailed it. 

-The game looks absolutely incredible. There are 3D elements tied into the 2D perspective and they really did an amazing job with it. The game is VERY colourful and looks super crisp on my monitor at 1920x1080. 
-The game runs like a dream, no problems there. The graphics settings are rather limited, however. 
-The game features precision platforming but at times it becomes a spectacle-platformer of sorts 
-It incorporates very creative ideas in its level design, including rhythm courses where your actions sync up with the music - this was incredible. I had a smile on my face the entire time, it is a must play, or at least a must watch on YouTube.  
-The game is very deep, with tons of unlockable heroes and weekly and daily challenges, etc. Leaderboards are very prominent. The replayability of this game is unbelievable. 
-I HIGHLY reccomend you play this game with a controller. It is doable on keyboard with some keybinding adjustment required, but I much prefer the controller.

I cannot say enough about this title! Must-own.

8349995.review:
Rayman Legends is quite possibly the best 2d platformer released in the past 10 years.

It’s the follow up title to Rayman Origins (also a great game) and if you missed it, 40 of the stages from Origins have been included in Legends as additional re-mastered content.

It features over 120 different stages each with varying atmosphere, amazing music, and plenty of hidden collectibles. Each of the levels are hand drawn and beautiful to look at. Despite not being overly impressive on a technical level, Rayman uses a timeless style. While games like Crysis 3 probably won’t look that great 10 years from now, Rayman Legends will no doubt retain its charm.

The game also has multiple characters to choose from along with a host of unlockables. There are underwater stealth missions, time trials, and even musical stages where you jump to the rhythm of remixed popular songs. The inclusion of daily and weekly challenges allows you to compete with your friends, adding tons of re-playability.

If you enjoyed classic 2d platformers like Super Mario World and Donkey Kong Country, you should check out Rayman Legends as it’s the closest thing to them in this day and age.

For a more detailed review, here’s a video my friend and fellow reviewer Trent uploaded:

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=195783687

Rayman Legends also made our list for The Top 35 Games of the Generation. If you’re interested in seeing how it stacks up, check out:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DWIHmom_lP4


If you enjoyed this review, feel free to follow me as a Steam Curator: http://store.steampowered.com/curator/4886473/

8349334.review:
This game is impressively good. If you like Jump'n'Runs / Platformers you really should give it a try.  I managed to collect all possible 700 Teensies and I never had the feeling that I have to go on just to finish it, which sadly happens too often to me nowadays. I think it's easier than Rayman: Origins, which could be seen as one of the few cons. Especially the Back to Origins levels felt less challenging than the originals.
The art-design is superior and the graphics look just great. It's crazy, bright and funny, but not too childish to be not appealing to mature audiences. Surely, you have to like that type of style and humor. The same goes for the sound, great work! 
The levels are greatly designed, not too long not too short and enough variety to keep it fun to play. It has challenging parts, which never are too hard and can always be mastered with some tries. Fortunately, the checkpoints are set really fair, perhaps making it a bit too easy.
The music-levels are a highlight of the game, you run through a level to a song, while your jumping, attacking and the whole level architecture is timed to and built for the music.
The daily and weekly challenges are nicely made and keep you going after you finished the rest of the game.
I haven't played it with local multiplayer, but that also looks fun.
While the game is such a great one and really conquered the throne of 2D-Jump'n'Runs for me, the only really big letdown is the usage of Uplay. Since you can buy it on Steam, why the hell do I have to use Uplay for online features. I can't even change my username! Sadly, I realized this after I connected Rayman: Legends and Farcry3 to it, with something like: username: uplayaccount … -.-

[u]Conclusion[/u]
*Story: Well this is not the biggest part of the game, it's OK, nothing special but it doesn't need to be.
*Gameplay: Great! Fluid controls, impressive varied levels, lots of stuff to unlock, online challenges
*Graphics&Sound: Superior! I really love that style, not too childish but funny and crazy

I give it [b]95[/b] out of [b]100[/b]

[i]Side note: I played the game with maximum graphics fluidly and with a controller. [/i]

Here I was thinking Origins would be the best platformer I ever played... I am so happy I was wrong.

Featuring a beautiful and lively hand-drawn world of wonder and expansive variety, your eyes will thank you for all of the stunning visuals this game has to offer.  Gameplay feels absolutely perfect, even with Murphy being programmed to a single key.  The levels feature plenty of challenge, abilites and indeed the famed music levels that will make you want to scream in exitement with every perfectly synced note. 7891843.review: Amazing game. I've loved the Rayman series for it's immersive gameplay and unique style since the announcement of Rayman Origins. Ubiart Framework is a fantastic studio and I just adore this game like no other. The game is quirky and fun, you'll notidce that little is serious about this game when you play it. It's comical and charming all together. Fans of Rayman Origins will definitely enjoy this game. It has a lot more features than Rayman Origins had-In this game you collect Teensies, there're 10 in each level, and how many in each painting varies. In the invasion levels, and other specific levels(such as bosses or music levels) there're 3 teensies to collect. Each level is just an epic immersion into the marvels Ubiart Framework can achieve with their technology. The music is phenominal, it adds dynamic to the overall gameplay and allows the player to truly get into the game, and the E3 press conference mostly emphasized one of the music levels-but it's not just the music levels that have great music. The entire game has a beautiful soundtrack that truly adds to the game's feeling. I only have a few complaints about the game...Some of the invasion levels are merciless and tedious. For one level I spent a good hour trying to get it just right to earn all 3 teensies. The levels are put together awesomely, but the spike in difficulty of invasion levels sometimes takes a toll on gameplay. If you're a perfectionist, it becomes more of a chore than something fun...But it feels great once you do get it just right. The daily and weekly challenges always add a spice to the game, allowing for players to earn more lums for completing various tasks in certain levels, it helps keep things fresh, and it definitely made me come back for more because I always wonder what's going to be the challenge for today. In this game you recieve lottery tickets after earning so many Lums, which is pretty cool-but you can also earn 'creatures' for your creature gallery. I never really understood the creature collection. They supply lums daily, but otherwise they don't seem very collectible unless you just, you know, like to collect them(personal opinion). Overall this game is amazing. It's worth every penny,

7884390.review: I don't know how I feel about this game. Origins, the predecessor to this game, had a clear focus design wise and simple world progression. Legends has needlessly complicated things by adding fluff that distracts you from the juicy core of the game, much like what hats do for Team Fortress 2. Scratch cards, leader boards, animals, and a currency system based on lums (glowing flies you collect in levels). Couple this together with the dodgy adaptation of Wii U tablet stuff made to work with controllers and you end up with a game that is a bit of a mess. Legends would be a much better game if Ubisoft just trimmed off the fat. But the joy found in Origins is still here under all this pointless flubber. There is still game here that is fun and worth your time, even if you have to wade through the muck to get it.

7820657.review:
Without a doubt, this is one of the best games on steam.  (Or Uplay rather - heh.)

There's a TON of content - the controls are amazing, the level variety is great, and visuals/music are INCREDIBLE.  Almost every level of the original Rayman Origins is included to boot.

THERE'S ALSO A DAILY CHALLENGE FEED TO KEEP YOU COMING BACK - And you can compete with your friends to top one another, and even see the ghost of the player you're trying to beat.

This game is GREAT in solo play, but it REALLY SHINES when you get multiple people to play in local coop - beating up your friends is loads of fun.  There's even a smash brothers-like soccer minigame that's a pretty cool party diversion.

THIS GAME IS WORTH BUYING FOUR XBOX CONTROLLERS FOR YOUR PC OVER - Get it, wire it to a suitable TV or monitor that makes for good multiple person play, and have a blast.

THIS GAME ALSO SUPPORTS 3D GLASSES KITS and in spite of the 2d characters has tons of depth of field effects and perspective tricks that make a 3d mode all the more cool.

FOR GOD'S SAKE BUY THIS GAME NOW - IT'S ONE OF THE BEST PURCHASES I'VE MADE ON STEAM EVER.

7816940.review: Rayman Legends is a very fun game to play. Much fun as Origins. When I first saw the gameplay demo on youtube in 2012 I was so hyped. I know I never owned any other Rayman game(Excluding Origins)   back then,but when I gazed my eye on this game I wanted it. So when the game went on sale, I got my handy dandy Mann Co. keys and traded them for a copy.  The game has good controls and gorgeous art. If you play games on a keyboard, playing this game at first with a keyboard can be hard but you soon get used to it. The game can be also used with a controller(even Xbox or Playstation). The favorite part I like about this game are the Musical levels(Which includes reamkes of Black Betty, Woohoo, etc...) its very fun and I would always play those levels every time I go on. The game also features online challanges which involves obstacle runs and time trials. You win from Bronze to Diamond cups and it also feature the multiplayer minigame Kung Foot which is a form of soccer game. The downside to this game is that is the fact that it doesn't have online co-op and only has local co-op. The other downside (Which I really hate) is the fucking UPlay. Every Ubisoft game you buy, you have to make an UPlay account in order to play the game. You even have to make a Uplay account to play the demo. It sucks. It really does.  But back to the subject. Rayman Legends is a fun game I would recommend this game if you like fun, challanging levels. Even if you don't own any Old Rayman game. 7793083.review:
I'd never played a Rayman game before and so I had absolutely no idea what to expect when I started up Rayman Legends for the first time. Man, was I ever pleasantly surprised! It's truly one of the most fun games I've ever played. While not particularly deep from a gameplay perspective, good humor is bursting from every seam and it's impossible not to be swept along.

The level design is perfect and the visuals are utterly spectacular. I find myself playing "just one more level" to see what incredible visual treats the game has in store for me next. I also have to single out the game's remarkable composer, Christophe Héral. Music is as integral to the experience here as it was in classic Warner Bros. cartoons. You may find yourself replaying certain levels again and again just to enjoy the wonderful soundtrack. Of particular note is the fact that many of the tracks were recorded using a full orchestra, something which is very rare in games these days. Huge kudos to Ubisoft for being willing to spend the extra money to get such high quality results!

In conclusion, Rayman Legends is pretty much a must-have game. I think gamers of all skill levels, ages and backgrounds will find plenty to enjoy here.

7792492.review:
10/10
Rayman Legends verbindet alles was ich an Videospielen liebe. Es ist extrem witzig, hat einen extrem guten soundtrack, sehr abwechslungsreiches gameplay und macht einfach spaß. 

Gameplay:
Das Gameplay ist sehr direkt und klassisch, aber auch sehr dynamisch. Im Gegensatz zu Rayman Origins sind die Levels auch eher etwas hektischer, ob das einem gefällt oder nicht muss man selber entscheiden. Mir persönlich war es egal. Jedenfalls muss man dieses Spiel einfach loben für seine extrem abwechslungsreichen Levels, wodurch niemals langweile aufkommt.

Grafik:
Zur Grafik brauche ich nicht viel sagen, schaut sie euch an. Rayman Legends sieht einfach nur toll aus, läuft immer flüssig und hat sehr geschmeidige Animationen. Die Levels sind sehr detailliert designed, jedes mit seinen eigenen Besonderheiten.

Soundtrack:
Sehr stimmiger Soundtrack, stets abgestimmt mit der jeweiligen Umgebung und immer auf aller höhstem Niveau. Rayman Legends hat einer dieser Soundtracks, den ich auch nach dem Spielen immer wieder gerne höre. Bei diesem Humor, dieser Grafik und dazu diesem Soundtrack kann man keine schlechte Laune haben.

Fazit:
Wer auch nur ein bisschen was für 2D-Plattformer übrig hat, sollte ich Rayman Legends zulegen, denn es ist locker eines der besten Jump´n´runs aller Zeiten. Was Ubisoft hier abgeliefert hat stimmt von vorne bis hinten und zählt definitiv zu meiner Top 3 des Jahres.

7792238.review: Яркая, красочная игра поднимающая настроение. В один из тяжелых для меня дней, трагичных буквально, эта игра мне помогла оправится от негативных эмоций. Геймплей игры в духе старых "бродилок" какими мы их видели еще во времена первых консолей а - ля SEGA. Играть по управлению удобно, но при этом отнюдь непросто. 7783677.review:
Rayman Legends takes what was established in Rayman Origins and improves it. The vector graphics are back and look prettier than ever, there is the addition of a sidekick as well to help you get through some levels.
There is a lot to do in this game, each level has 10 teensies to find (The little blue guys), as well as the challenge to find enough lums (The yellow flying guys) to earn the Gold trophy. There are also unlockable characters as well, collectable creatures, unlockable bonus levels from Rayman Origins (each has teensies and trophies to collect) and Time Trial levels as well. If you're a bit of a completionist like I am with these sorts of things, you'll have lots to keep you occupied. There is also the new music levels, which are very much like the chest chasing missions in Origins, completely timing based where you jump or attack in time with the music. These are excellently thought out and the timing is spot-on. These are a bit more forgiving than Origins' chest chasing missions though, having checkpoints rather than making you restart after each death.
There are downsides though, this game is a console port and at times it shows, making some actions hard to perform using keyboard if you don't have nimble fingers. It is perfectly playable with the keyboard though and supports full key remapping (Which I suggest you do, I set mine to the Origins controls and it saved me a lot of trouble), but it may be easier to play using a controller. I can't say which is better, since I've only played using keyboard, although you can play one handed using keyboard, leaving your other hand free to do other stuff like eat a sandwich or write a book. It also doesn't really have much replayability, apart from the music levels which are awesome just to play occasionally, unless you are a big Rayman fan. Plus it only works through UPlay, which is not a bad piece of software but it does make things frustrating when you just want to get right into the game.
Overall, this game is worth picking up, even at full price and the annoying DRM. Graphics are pretty and there is a lot to do. I'm really looking forward to the next game in the series,
9/10

7773198.review:
Автор Vavila163, специально для портала GreatGamer.ru, ссылка на публикацию - http://greatgamer.ru/reviews/rayman_legends.html

После двухлетнего отдыха старина Рэйман вернулся. Теперь он собирается в прямом смысле окунуться в творчество, ведь в долине чудес найдены волшебные картины. Если коснуться одной из них, то можно оказаться в сказке. Поэтому, будьте готовы отправиться в очередное путешествие под названием Rayman Legends. Уже с первых секунд рассказчики дают понять, что на этот раз все интересней, красочней и чудесней.
Разработчики словно понимают, что третьего раза может и не быть, поэтому выжимают максимум из себя. Главное же правило, которого они придерживались простое — все было великолепно, но нужно сделать еще лучше. И знаете, они смогли его соблюдать от начала и до конца, что радует. Теперь мы получаем около сотни великолепных миров, которые ограничены условностями, заданными повествованием. Каждый маленький уровень — это отдельная район не похожий на другой, чувствуется индивидуальность каждого квадратного виртуального метра.
Немаловажную роль играет тот факт, что Ubisoft смогло собрать из небольших маленьких участков разных сказочных историй целые города, они в совокупности являются частью Волшебной долины. В итоге придется посетить 5 новых районов: средневековые замки с рыцарями и драконом, волшебные стебли с летающими жабами, вкуснейшие мексиканские дали, подводный мир Жак-Ива Кусто и напоследок подняться на небеса на битву с Титанами. Все столь непохожие местности объединяют лишь злые волшебники, которые забрали в рабство бедных люмий. Ну а вам как всегда придется их спасать.
В путешествие по долине вы можете отправиться вместе с тремя друзьями, но с одним не самым удобным условием — они должны находиться рядом с вами, а не на другом конце света и общаться с помощью современных технологий. Вообще Rayman Legends сделан с умом, поэтому если вы хотите получить удовольствие от всего происходящего, то нужно внимательно относиться ко всему. Иначе, торопясь, вы просто потеряете сладкие бонусы, цель которых помочь вам в изучении волшебного мира. Теперь бегать, прыгать и бить плохих парней еще веселей, ведь каждое действие показано очень красочно благодаря глубокой анимации персонажей. Помимо этого, почти каждый казалось бы небольшой уровень может предложить то, что нельзя будет нигде повстречать.
Если вам станет скучно путешествовать с Рэймоном снова, то тогда отправляйтесь на арену. На ней можно выявить, кто самый быстрый, ловкий и умный. А чтобы ностальгия по былыми временам в Origins сильно не мешала, разработчики бесплатно дают возможность вернуться в прошлое и снова ощутить привкус былых побед. Для этого достаточно лишь выиграть в бесплатной лотереи, которая является своеобразным бонусом для фанатов.
***
Rayman Legends соответствует своему названию, ведь проект навсегда останется в памяти тех, кто рискнет с ним познакомиться.

Оценка 9.6

7770985.review:
After playing Rayman Origins I thought there's no way there could be a better Rayman game. I was wrong. Rayman Legends is even more beautiful, more fluid and better in a lot of ways than its predecessor.
The art style is similar to Origin's but brings little improvements that make it seem not only pretty but also chiseled from a tech point of view. It definitely looks like they took their time with the visuals of Legends, when you have to improve on something as good as Origin's art style it's the details that make a world of difference.
The difficulty can vary depending on how thorough you want to be with the collectibles - and there's a lot of them: lums, teensies, trophies for getting them as well characters/costumes getting unlocked because of it. The game can be enjoyed by anyone, it's never dull even if you don't decide to got after those though to reach collectibles.

Pros:
+ beautiful
+ technical for collectibles
+ great campaign pacing
+ those music levels
+ couch co-op

Cons:
- no online co-op

7746749.review:
one of the best platformers ever, puts Rayman origins to shame, this game has tons of extras to unlock. there are some amazing classic hit songs in some stages (won't spoil the surprises on you ;) ), the score is awesome and the art style is top notch, high production values all around.

in case you didn't play Rayman Origins, the game is basically run from point A to point B to finish the stage, of course there are many hidden secrets in every stage and many things to collect to be able to unlock the other stages and progress through the game, it has a lot of variety and always interesting that you won't be able to put the controller down, there are many things that will spice up the game like in some stages you need to run as fast as possible to finish, some stages you will have a companion to help you out by raising up platforms or cutting ropes for you..etc.

the main game tends to be a little easier than origins but it still lots of fun and there are many challenges to be had if you want to, there are also a few stages from origins that made it to this game

the multi-player co op is frantic and funny as in origins, you will be laughing all the time at the crazy things that you can do when playing it with 3 other players

and then there is the mini game called Kung Foot, a crazy football game which requires you to slap or kick the ball and make it hit your opponent's goal, it might sound simple but it is really fun and you might get a lot of hours just playing this mini game.

well i think that should be enough to make you buy it or at least give it a try, it really is amazing and it is really scary how much content this game has and if you are a fan of platformers, believe me you will enjoy this game for sure

7693098.review:
When you pop in this game, the first thing you notice is the poor edging on Rayman, the main character of the movie and the main character you control in the game. The Rayman Legends movie was done with Silicon Graphics Computers™ and the instruction booklet says the game's graphics were created with the same 3D computer models used in the making of the blockbuster movie.

We don't know however if the game uses Silicon Graphics Computers™. If SGI Computers™ were used, we suspect they were only used for character animations because the backgrounds do not have the detailed quality graphics of Donkey Kong Country. As any good dedicated game-player knows, Donkey Kong Country was created with Silicon Graphics Computers™ and doesn't have edging problems.  Whats even more strange is that  Rayman is the only character with edging problems. All of the other characters look great.

One question remains, why didn't Ubisoft use Silicon Graphics Computers™ for the entire game? Were they too expensive? I don't think so. Come on. Big Ubisoft is one of the richest corporations in France. Let's get real here.

Bottom line, Barbara is cute.

7373126.review:
This game is excellent; buy it.
...
Oh, you're still here? You mean to tell me that you need reasons to buy things? Okay then.

Rayman Legends is the best platformer of this decade. Everything in it has such a touch of affection and detail that it constantly wows the player with it's unique style. Common background elements could have been hung in an art exhibit, enemies interact and animate in a variety of ways that boggles the mind that a team of animators took the time for such a trivial thing. And its platforming is exceptionally tight. The game ramps up in its difficulty in such a way that near the end you're more than prepared for its Lost Levels echelon of difficulty. It hearkens back to the older days of platforming, while at the same time discarding old standards like lives and poor checkpointing. It's constant fun, not tedium. Rayman Legends is what a modern Mario game should have been, and it surpasses the old bastions of platforming on every front.

And the music, sweet potato the music. When this game rolled out its series of trailers I was worried that it was just rehashing the songs of the previous title. But no, no no no. Another clever rouse on their part. There was a moment, I think around the third world, where I just had to put the controller down and appreciate how they had integrated the music into the stage. It's that good. In Origins the special stages were exceptionally difficult, particularly the Tricky Trunk levels. While Legends is no cakewalk, the trunk levels have been superseded by musically timed levels. It's understandably strange to jump and hit to the tune of Eye of the Tiger, but not unwelcome. But there's more than just those special stages, there's a huge variety of levels that leave the player with a myriad of options, all fun. There's a Gradius clone with mosquito mounts, time trials, wall running, a whole host of others.

There are criticism, and if you've made it this far into this recommendation I guess I could give them to you. The game has the same problem as its predecessor in that once you've collected all the baubles and creatures, there's really nothing else for you to do than the multiplayer stuff or to farm for days to unlock a skin for your character. Once you complete the main story, all that's really left is tying up loose ends, and it feels a little lacking in reason either than tying up loose ends in this game is still quite fun. Also, the introduction of touch based gaming in the series has been replaced by button prompts. Unless you're playing on a system that utilizes the touch, then some of the Murphy levels feel cheating, as entire swaths of gameplay get replaced by hitting the Y button.

But these are minor peeves. The game is still fun. It's a labor of love, and it shows it, bleeds it. I think, if you have the opportunity, that Rayman Legends is really worth your time.

2925963.review:
Questo platform si classifica già tra i miei giochi preferiti. Questo gioco rappresenta il divertimento. Ci volevano solo dei geni per superare il sorprendente Rayman Origins e loro ci sono riusciti. Potrei già chiudere qua, ma purtroppo in ogni capolavoro è presente qualche piccola imperfezione. La prima imperfezione è la difficoltà. Rispetto all'Origins, ho avuto pochissimi grattacapi e momenti bestemmia, a parte per i livelli finali e per i livelli a 8 bit. Anche i vari livelli con Murfy sono molto semplici da eseguire con mouse e tastiera e inoltre è anche più semplice scovare i Teens, nel primo erano nascosti meglio e invece qui è molto più semplice terminare il livello e trovarli tutti. 
Altro problema, quello forse più famoso di tutti, la mancanza della Co-Op Online, cosa che non ho capito a dire la verità. Rayman Origins è stato criticato moltissimo per la mancanza della Co-Op online e nel seguito nemmeno ce la mettono. Rendendo così anche sprecato il minigioco di calcio ideato. Visto che è giocabile solo in locale e non online. Se fosse stato online quel minigioco, non vi nego che ci avrei passato una marea di ore sopra. Ma anche per la co-op stessa dei livelli della storia si sente la mancanza, di sicuro il divertimento si amplifica, ma purtroppo han deciso di portarsi questa dimenticanza anche qui in Legends. 
E infine, il problema finale di questo gioco... È proprio l'online proposto. Detto in breve, l'online proposto si basa su 4 sfide. Due sfide giornaliere e due settimanali. Divise per difficoltà visto che c'è la sfida settimanale/giornaliera estrema e normale. Infine cambia la difficoltà. Ma questo online proposto ha due problemi enormi. Il primo problema è quello dei cheaters, che si infilano nella classifica mettendo risultati praticamente impossibili da raggiungere se non con l'uso dei cheat. E inoltre, almeno per ora, non vengono nemmeno bannati. L'altro problema è la ripetitività di queste sfide. Infine sono sempre le stesse 4 sfide riproposte, ovvero colleziona più Lum possibili entro un tot di tempo. Arriva il più lontano possibile in questo dungeon. Colleziona un numero prefissato di Lum nel minor tempo possibile. Fai 250 metri più fretta che puoi. E basta. Esatto, le sfide online sono solo queste qui sopraccitate. Nessuna nuova modalità, l'unica cosa che cambia è solo il design del livello.
Passando al lato single player, si trovano solo pregi. Prima di tutto bisogna dire che in questo gioco c'è tantissima roba da fare. Infatti se si vuole intraprendere la via del 100%, bisogna per davvero rimboccarsi le maniche. Perché oltre ai livelli normali, è presente una novità rispetto all'Origins. Ovvero le invasioni. Le invasioni sono nient'altro che delle semplici prove a tempo, molto divertenti e competitive. Infatti la vera difficoltà del titolo è presente in questo titolo di livelli, visto che sono molto difficili da completare. Poi sono presenti più di 40 livelli di Rayman Origins completamente rimasterizzati. Ma questi livelli si sbloccano solo in un modo particolare, ovvero ottenendo dei gratta fortuna a fine di ogni livello della storia principale. E sperare che nel grattarlo si vince un livello di Rayman Origins. Perché non c'è solo quello come premio. Volendo c'è la possibilità di non vincere nulla, oppure di vincere qualche Lum. Oppure qualche Teen. O le creature. Le creature? Sono nient'altro che dei collezionabili, oppure come l'ho soprannominata io, la fabbrica cinese dei Lum. Perché ottenendo queste Creature e passare ogni 24h da loro si ottengono Lum in più che vi aiuteranno nello sbloccare nuovi personaggi. E ce ne sono moltissimi, bisogna arrivare a 1 milione di Lum per averli tutti. 
Poi da non dimenticare la soundtrack. Forse tra le più memorabili e belle di tutti i tempi, tutti i brani sono fantastici, non c'è nessun brano brutto in questo gioco. Proprio nessuno.
Passando ai livelli invece... A parte la difficoltà abbassata rispetto all'Origins, è presente dall'altro canto un'ottima varietà. Dove perfino in alcuni livelli è presente lo stealth. Oppure livelli da fare in completa velocità. E poi gli immancabili boss che sono tutti diversi dall'uno all'altro. Però la cosa più bella proposta in questo gioco sono i livelli musicali. I livelli musicali rappresentano la perfezione, sono proprio l'apice del divertimento di questo titolo, una volta che si affronta un livello musicale, lo vuoi rifare più volte perché difficilmente ti stancherai a farlo. 
Infine vi dico di andarvi a prendere questo gioco a volo, perché non ve ne pentirete. Si ha davanti uno dei migliori platform di sempre, senza se e senza ma. Se vi dà fastidio comandare Murfy con un solo tasto, procuratevi la versione Wii U, perché è la migliore. (La versione PsVita ha tutti i livelli invasione che mancano, per questo non ve la consiglio). Mentre se non vi dà fastidio, potete prenderlo benissimo per pc, tanto lo può far girare perfino un catorcio, visto che è ottimizzato benissimo e questo motore grafico offre pura arte nel design. Quindi andate e prendetelo tutti che questo gioco se avete un umore basso è capace di farlo rialzare alle stelle.
